story:
Howdy! My name is James Joseph Michaelis Seidler Schulte (J.M.S.S)

     I am a first-time author and newcomer to the process of creating and publishing a novel. While I did not start my life with the aim of becoming an author, the art of writing and sharing tales has driven me to pursue this passion and its limitless potential.

    The imagination behind White Winds was not accidental, but rather a product of many end goals for the future. Beginning as a small, ten-page project for my collegiate-level creative writing class, White Winds was inspired by novels/movies that utilized the lack of dialogue to tell an in-depth story about animals in their natural habitats, including The Bear by Jean-Jacques Annaud and Raptor Red by Robert T. Bakker.  The story has since blossomed into a full epic and exceeded my expectations since its original classroom debut.

     The time and effort to reach this point has been a long uphill battle since 2013, and during that time I have had to overcome severe personal hardships both inside and out.  Nevertheless, against all the doubters I have finally persevered in making my dream come true and the only remaining hurdle is the financial backing to carry me over.

What is the story?

     In this historical animal fiction odyssey, we look at how survival in nature is not easy, even in the best of times. This much is true for three dire wolf brothers, Greymane, Sundown, and Red Oak, and their tenacious female wolverine companion, White Spruce, who are living in the prime era of the Ice Age. When the small pack begins their long migration to the Rocky Mountains to outlast another winter, their journey takes a sudden turn for the worst when a world-altering, atmospheric phenomenon known as the ‘White Wind’ unleashes its wrath across the North American frontier.  Surviving the event, the pack realizes their natural ability to navigate the exposed tundra is lost. Unable to continue, the pack joins a herd of mammoths lead by Snow Heart, a matriarch unaffected by the White Wind and still able to navigate the now alien terrain. Together, these contentious groups must endure each other’s company, overcome harsh environments, and survive a ruthless monster that will stop at nothing to end their quest home. 

What is the goal of the campaign?

     The goal of the campaign is to reach $15,000.00 to self-publish the book on a larger scale.

How is your money being used? Where is it going?

     Due to already securing an editor, there will be no need to spend money on grammar or minor plot hole corrections. Instead, each monetary contribution will be saved to aid in paying for a self-publishing service.

How does a self-publishing company work and what is its significance to this campaign?

      A self-publishing company acts as a middleman between traditional book publishing and independent publishing. You pay for a package that a publishing company offers and the effort they will put forward in helping to publish the book. In other words, the amount of money you are willing to invest is equal to the amount of effort and quality the publishing company is willing to put forward. I have been fortunate enough to reserve a spot with Elite Publishing in Houston, Texas. Now, as stated before, the goal is to reach the designated price that will make the company's invested time and effort into publishing White Winds worthwhile.

Why invest now?

     Any amount helps to make this dream come true, but certain packages will offer more perks than others. Those who invest in the Wolverine Package are offered a more in-depth sneak peek into the characters and story format of White Winds in the form of a short flash-fiction novel titled Winter’s End, as well as the other benefits listed below.

     And while it is not necessarily official yet, one of the primary goals of the campaign is to have a special release of White Winds to those who invest in the Dire Wolf, Ground Sloth, and Mammoth perk packages. Once that is made possible, I guarantee that the book will be provided to said investors before its major release and early release on both eBook and the physical copy.

What happens if I do not raise enough money?

     While this campaign is in progress, I plan to find other means of raising money outside of Indiegogo to assist in my endeavor. Should this campaign not reach its fiscal goal, I plan on combining the money I receive from this page with the money I raise elsewhere to fund my novel.

story:
Our Story

Hi everyone. Hopefully everyone of you reading this already know me but if you don't my name is Sarah Teegarden and last year I was blessed with the chance to go to Dufailly, Haiti on a mission trip. I had never been to Haiti before so I was more than excited to go there. Little did I know that before I would leave I would fall in love with country and the people. I've always loved going on overseas mission trips. It's something that has been placed on my heart and I gladly accept the calling. I love to help with mission organizations locally too, but I feel like at least once a year I should be going to other places and sharing God's love! My church and I go with an organization called Teen Mission USA. The group has been going to this village for some time now and has been able to set up a school for free education in the village. In order to obtain any type of education in Haiti, most people have to pay to attend schools. For many, this is not an option considering the income they have. Most of the families struggle to even provide food so an education was out of the question. Teen Mission built the school and offers free education except paying for books which is a minimal cost. Yvrose Johnson, the leader of the mission and school, wanted the people to feel like they were contributing somewhat because that makes them really take ownership in the project. The school had over 110 children last year in a small building and this year has over 200! We started work on another building last year and hope to be able to completely finish it when we return in February.

The school also provides lunch for the children. This is extremely important because for most of the children this is the only meal they will eat that day. Teen Mission funds this as well so any money received goes to help feed the children. I never knew what real hunger looked liked until I went there last year. I saw mother's fighting for extra food for their families just to survive. This is another goal. , to bring more food for the school and to pass out to the community.

Another goal we have is to be able to purchase Bibles for all the students. Most families do not have a copy of the Bible in their language. Our goal is to furnish each student with one that way each family will have one. Bibles in Haiti are hard to find and can be very expensive. This is one of our main goals this year and a portion of our money raised will go to that. We want everyone to be able to experience God's love and what better way to do that than to be able to read the very words He wrote Himself.

During our trip we also have medical clinics for the students and for the village. Many people suffer from malnourishment and many other disabilities that could be managed with the proper medicine and supplies. This however is not easy in a third world country. Yvrose is a registered nurse who makes it her goal to provide as much help as possible to the village. By providing families with Vitamin B supplements and as simple medicines such as Tums and Tylenol so many people can be helped. She also has more advanced medicine in cases that it is needed. The money we raise goes to help purchase and transport these supplies and the village relies on it.

We also do daily lessons with the children and make crafts with them. This may not seem like much but to them it's amazing to get to make something and take it home. The simplest craft turns into the greatest treasure for them. We also supply them with a snack which is something they are not used to. I'll never forget their faces on getting the smallest cookie. We can be so ungrateful for what we have and these trips remind us just how thankful we should be for what we have.

The Impact

The impact that the supplies we bring have on the village is immense. The impact of them knowing God's love for them is even bigger. The impact that we receive by doing God's will cannot be explained into words!

 


What We Need & What You Get

Each team member has to raise over $1300 to be able to go. This money covers airfare and transportation to the village, but more importantly it covers supplies that we bring in.

Team money is used for building supplies to finish the extra building needed for the school.

Team money is used for medical and food supplies to hand out at medical clinics.

Team money is used to help supprt the school with materials and staff.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to give anything at the moment can I ask you to spread the word to others in case they can?

 

Also, more important than the money we need is the prayer that we need. We might have as many as 20-25 people go this time around and each one of us need prayer that we will let God use us as He wants. Please be in prayer that each team member will get funded and please be in prayer for the people of Haiti!

story:
About 512 Media Inc. and The Bean Magazine

We're 512 Media Inc., an independently-owned and operated writing and publishing company located in Methuen, Massachusetts. Our vision is to take the small, dedicated indie team principles of the hyperlocal mag we already created — Merrimack Valley Magazine — and bring them to a global publication about the intersection of coffee, tea, the arts, music and more. The Bean Magazine is that publication, fueled by subscribers — not by ads. The print publication will feature very limited advertising, and the digital version will have no advertising at all.

What We Need & What You Get

Our humble $45,000 goal will help us get The Bean Magazine off the ground by not only helping us get the first issues off to the presses, but also by building a healthy subscriber base... proving that people are willing to pay for truly quality editorial content (especially when they don't have to be bothered by pesky ads)!

To reward our faithful first readers, we've got a whole host of awesome perks in many different configurations — just take a look at how long this page goes down! From The Bean Magazine-branded coffee mugs and T-shirts to limited edition prints and coffee/tea experiences with Editor Doug Sparks (the dashing gent in our featured video), we've got a little something for everyone.

Premium Subscriptions (Over $250) Ship Free

If you'd like to come as an attendee or VIP to our launch party here in Massachusetts, we've got some tickets available for that as well. Just remember that anyone coming to either the launch party or one of our coffee/tea experiences needs to provide their own travel accommodations. Also, please note that the images of the perks included are representative and not necessarily indicative of the final product.

Our Team

Publisher
Glenn Prezzano is the owner and president of 512 Media Inc. He is the founder and publisher of The Bean Magazine and Merrimack Valley Magazine. Originally from New York’s Long Island, he is a lifelong adman, with stints in outdoor advertising, daily newspapers and magazines. In the “80s, he chased a girl to the Merrimack Valley, married her, raised a family and started a business. He recently celebrated 30 years of marriage to the aforementioned girl. When he’s not doing publisher things, he can be found sipping a good single malt scotch and puffing on a fine cigar — on a nice Floridian or Caribbean beach whenever possible. He holds a bachelor’s degree from Long Island University and a master’s degree from Boston University.

Managing Editor
Doug Sparks is an editor and writer living with his wife, child and chihuahua in the greater Lowell area of Massachusetts. A lover of tea, music and poetry, he is a former coffee roaster. Aside from editing and writing, he has taught English literature and Brazilian jiu-jitsu, driven a delivery truck, lived on a goat farm and worked as a bouncer at an underground New York City club. He holds a bachelor’s degree from Goddard College and a master’s degree from New York University. He is a pretty good cook and prefers a cleaver to a chef’s knife. With a cleaver, it’s much easier to mince ginger.

Travel & Culture Editor
Emilie-Noelle Provost is a writer, editor and author who lives in northeastern Massachusetts with her husband, daughter and four crazy rescue cats. She loves wine, books, traveling and hiking, and is hopelessly addicted to European crime dramas. She began her career as a professional writer working in the travel and hospitality industry, and writing about interesting places is still one of her favorite things to do. Emilie-Noelle has published several pieces of short fiction and is the author of “The Blue Bottle,” a middle-grade adventure novel published in summer 2018. You can see what she’s up to at emilienoelleprovost.com.

Creative Director
Stephen Pennimpede is a creative machine … a workhorse … and quite possibly the most organized artist you will ever meet. If the building is on fire, he’s the one that will finish whatever he’s doing, shutdown the computer, pack it up and let the firemen in on his way out the door. He graduated from Tufts University with two degrees while working full-time (because one degree would have been too easy). He’s been using Photoshop since it was created, loves the clean design aesthetic of Japanese masters and dreams in CMYK color palettes. His wife insists he’s a combination of both Leonard and Sheldon, even though he was a geek long before “Big Bang Theory” made that cool.

Digital Editor
Joe Girard-Meli is an editor and writer living with his husband and two cats in downtown Lowell, Massachusetts. A lifelong video game fan, he dreams of publishing his own game someday. He can often be found poring over the game script at one of the area’s many independent cafés, a cup of herbal tea in his hand. Joe’s especially interested in the way a master’s craft – whether that’s game writing, journalism or coffee brewing – can be used to make the world a better place. With so many stories vying for attention in The Bean Magazine, he seeks to amplify the voices that aren’t heard often enough. He holds a bachelor’s degree in journalism from UMass Amherst and is a graduate student studying communication at Southern New Hampshire University.

    We've Done This Before, and We'll Do It Again

    The team at 512 Media Inc., led by publisher Glenn Prezzano, has been publishing regionally in New England for over a decade now — no small feat considering the challenging environment for journalism nowadays. We're confident that we're ready to take our DIY, smaller-is-better mindset to a wider audience with an appetite for independently-created content on the cafe culture that binds us all together (whether we've got a cup of coffee, tea or something else in our hands).

    Risks & Challenges

    As with any journalism project nowadays, maintaining a healthy print and digital publication — especially one with limited advertising! — is challenging. We need readers who are willing to part with their hard-earned cash to keep us writing, creating and publishing... but if you've read this far, we know you're one of our people, and there are enough of us out there to make this thing work in a major way!

    Outside the U.S.?

    Email us at publisher (at) thebeanmagazine.com. We'll make it work.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you just spent the last of your change on a cuppa to get you through the work or school day, don't worry — we get it. You can help us spread the word about The Bean Magazine by using the sharing tools on this page, or just with good old-fashioned word-of-mouth with your pals at the local tea room. You're always welcome to come back before our campaign ends, or to subscribe at TheBeanMagazine.com/Subscribe.

About 512 Media Inc. and The Bean Magazine
We're 512 Media Inc., an independently-owned and operated writing and publishing company located in Methuen, Massachusetts. Our vision is to take the small, dedicated indie team principles of the hyperlocal mag we already created — Merrimack Valley Magazine — and bring them to a global publication about the intersection of coffee, tea, the arts, music and more. The Bean Magazine is that publication, fueled by subscribers — not by ads. The print publication will feature very limited advertising, and the digital version will have no advertising at all.
What We Need & What You Get
Our humble $45,000 goal will help us get The Bean Magazine off the ground by not only helping us get the first issues off to the presses, but also by building a healthy subscriber base... proving that people are willing to pay for truly quality editorial content (especially when they don't have to be bothered by pesky ads)!
To reward our faithful first readers, we've got a whole host of awesome perks in many different configurations — just take a look at how long this page goes down! From The Bean Magazine-branded coffee mugs and T-shirts to limited edition prints and coffee/tea experiences with Editor Doug Sparks (the dashing gent in our featured video), we've got a little something for everyone.
Premium Subscriptions (Over $250) Ship Free
If you'd like to come as an attendee or VIP to our launch party here in Massachusetts, we've got some tickets available for that as well. Just remember that anyone coming to either the launch party or one of our coffee/tea experiences needs to provide their own travel accommodations. Also, please note that the images of the perks included are representative and not necessarily indicative of the final product.
Our Team
PublisherGlenn Prezzano is the owner and president of 512 Media Inc. He is the founder and publisher of The Bean Magazine and Merrimack Valley Magazine. Originally from New York’s Long Island, he is a lifelong adman, with stints in outdoor advertising, daily newspapers and magazines. In the “80s, he chased a girl to the Merrimack Valley, married her, raised a family and started a business. He recently celebrated 30 years of marriage to the aforementioned girl. When he’s not doing publisher things, he can be found sipping a good single malt scotch and puffing on a fine cigar — on a nice Floridian or Caribbean beach whenever possible. He holds a bachelor’s degree from Long Island University and a master’s degree from Boston University.
Managing EditorDoug Sparks is an editor and writer living with his wife, child and chihuahua in the greater Lowell area of Massachusetts. A lover of tea, music and poetry, he is a former coffee roaster. Aside from editing and writing, he has taught English literature and Brazilian jiu-jitsu, driven a delivery truck, lived on a goat farm and worked as a bouncer at an underground New York City club. He holds a bachelor’s degree from Goddard College and a master’s degree from New York University. He is a pretty good cook and prefers a cleaver to a chef’s knife. With a cleaver, it’s much easier to mince ginger.
Travel & Culture EditorEmilie-Noelle Provost is a writer, editor and author who lives in northeastern Massachusetts with her husband, daughter and four crazy rescue cats. She loves wine, books, traveling and hiking, and is hopelessly addicted to European crime dramas. She began her career as a professional writer working in the travel and hospitality industry, and writing about interesting places is still one of her favorite things to do. Emilie-Noelle has published several pieces of short fiction and is the author of “The Blue Bottle,” a middle-grade adventure novel published in summer 2018. You can see what she’s up to at emilienoelleprovost.com.
Creative DirectorStephen Pennimpede is a creative machine … a workhorse … and quite possibly the most organized artist you will ever meet. If the building is on fire, he’s the one that will finish whatever he’s doing, shutdown the computer, pack it up and let the firemen in on his way out the door. He graduated from Tufts University with two degrees while working full-time (because one degree would have been too easy). He’s been using Photoshop since it was created, loves the clean design aesthetic of Japanese masters and dreams in CMYK color palettes. His wife insists he’s a combination of both Leonard and Sheldon, even though he was a geek long before “Big Bang Theory” made that cool.
Digital EditorJoe Girard-Meli is an editor and writer living with his husband and two cats in downtown Lowell, Massachusetts. A lifelong video game fan, he dreams of publishing his own game someday. He can often be found poring over the game script at one of the area’s many independent cafés, a cup of herbal tea in his hand. Joe’s especially interested in the way a master’s craft – whether that’s game writing, journalism or coffee brewing – can be used to make the world a better place. With so many stories vying for attention in The Bean Magazine, he seeks to amplify the voices that aren’t heard often enough. He holds a bachelor’s degree in journalism from UMass Amherst and is a graduate student studying communication at Southern New Hampshire University.

We've Done This Before, and We'll Do It Again
The team at 512 Media Inc., led by publisher Glenn Prezzano, has been publishing regionally in New England for over a decade now — no small feat considering the challenging environment for journalism nowadays. We're confident that we're ready to take our DIY, smaller-is-better mindset to a wider audience with an appetite for independently-created content on the cafe culture that binds us all together (whether we've got a cup of coffee, tea or something else in our hands).

Risks & Challenges
As with any journalism project nowadays, maintaining a healthy print and digital publication — especially one with limited advertising! — is challenging. We need readers who are willing to part with their hard-earned cash to keep us writing, creating and publishing... but if you've read this far, we know you're one of our people, and there are enough of us out there to make this thing work in a major way!
Outside the U.S.?
Email us at publisher (at) thebeanmagazine.com. We'll make it work.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you just spent the last of your change on a cuppa to get you through the work or school day, don't worry — we get it. You can help us spread the word about The Bean Magazine by using the sharing tools on this page, or just with good old-fashioned word-of-mouth with your pals at the local tea room. You're always welcome to come back before our campaign ends, or to subscribe at TheBeanMagazine.com/Subscribe.

story:
Marriage of Honor - The Book

My name is Richard Quinonez, and I am the founder of marriageofhonor.com                  I have been married to Rosemary for more almost twenty eight years. We have been involved in ministry as group leaders and facilitators for more than twenty three years. For the last thirteen years we have focused on marriage ministry serving couples through studies, seminars, and retreats where biblical principles are the emphasis.

In 2010 I started to write Marriage of Honor.(it didn't start out as a book) which was a collection of the many principles that we have learned and applied in our own marriage. Not having any background or knowledge of the publishing industry I set out to research and discover the possibilities that exist for this book. It quickly became clear to me that whatever direction I was going to take the key and perhaps the most important element was the marketing of this book. More research became necessary in this area and after many hours of searching and reading about marketing and publishing I was able to narrow down my list of possible partners that I can work with on this project.

The next area that I needed answers for was how to fund this project. Again research unveiled many options the best being getting others involved in supporting this project. Crowd funding through Indiegogo became the most effective way to fund this project. This process gives individuals an opportunity to get involved, with amounts that both small and large.

Our goal is to raise $4500 dollars to be able to take this project to the next level. With these funds we will be able to publish the book and begin a marketing campaign that provides the best exposure. Our plan is get publicity with many radio and television producers that could grant us interviews before their listening audience. This exposure will get the message out sending customers to the best distributions channels. It will also provide an opportunity for us to follow-up with individuals, groups and churches providing studies and seminar materials. Additional marketing will take place with outreach on social media and with an improved internet presence.

Getting Marriage of Honor published is important because it provides husbands and wives with proven principles and practical ideas that can make marriages stronger and more fulfilling. This book is short yet direct in it's approach as it deals with issues that are most important to both men and women. With these principles couples could first consider the differences that exist in most marriages and second focus on those issues that are the most important to their spouse.  

Supporting this project makes you a part of providing couples with the tools that God uses to make marriages Christ centered. Accomplishing this work in ministry strengthens marriages while establishing an effective and fruitful witness. 

If we fall short of our desired goal we will seek to use the given funds as effectively as possible. The priority in which we will move forward is as follows: publishing, marketing, outreach, and internet presence.

Applying these principles helps men and women to understand the uniqueness of their spouse while having a positive affect on the stability of their marriage. Marriage of Honor was written to deal with and to help couples improve their connection and enhance their relationship. These changes contribute greatly to strong marriages and healthy families everywhere.

You can support this project in other ways as well. Though your financial support will be greatly appreciated, passing this information on to others for their consideration will also be of great benefit to many. The perks listed below are provided based on your level of support. Some of the perks are based on new resources soon to be created for seminars and presentations.

Thank You

Richard and Rosemary Quinonez

story:
Learn How To Win The Game of Your Life

What if there was an ancient book that listed the rules for you to play the game of your life, and win?  Does that sound too good to be true?

... like the holy grail.

And what if this ancient book of life had been hidden in plain sight all these years, masquerading as the ordinary deck of playing cards?

Aren't you curious to find out for yourself?

I was.

 

The Starting Point

I was at a loft party in Brooklyn.  A friend of mine from Burning Man asked me my birthday.  August 30th, why?

"Oh," he says, "your birth card is the 9 of Hearts. It means you've probably gone through many tragic endings of the heart.  You're learning how to let go of people without playing the victim."

My knees buckled. My head spun. The day before, I was served divorce papers, unexpectedly. But really, if I was honest, and not playing the victim, it wasn't so unexpected.


It Happened With A Priest

When I was 17, I went on a retreat offered by my catholic high school.  On it, a priest came to speak to us about walls around our hearts.  His talk moved me. 

I stayed after to speak with him in a face-to-face confession style.  I don't remember what I said.  But at the end, he stood up to offer the final prayer of absolution.  He laid his hands on my forehead.  As he did, something when woooossshhh right through my body, like an electric current that washed me clean.

That experience propelled me on a quest for my adult life to know and understand what that was.

It led me to work as an Evangelical Youth Minister, leading bible studies on Harvard campus.  I underwent training to be a Roman Catholic Priest.  And when that didn't fit either (no celibacy for me thank you), I decided to move to New York to learn from the corporate world.  I worked as a consultant on Wall Street.


Into The Heart of Darkness

Living in "the city that never sleeps," I started venturing out at night, and into my own shadow side.  I didn't articulate it that way at the time, of course.  All I knew was that I wanted to go clubbing and take ecstasy. I was 26. I had only just started drinking alcohol. I didn't lose my virginity until I was 24.  

I tried every drug there was to try.  I cut loose.  I learned how to dance.  And I burned out the years of false piety and intellectual dogma stuffed in my head.  I purged it and discovered a new version of myself.  It was an initiation through psychedelic experience.


The Alchemy of Light and Dark

Then, I went to India.  I lived in ashrams, meditating 8 hours a day.  Something shifted in me again.  Growing up, I had always been "Alex."  I returned to New York as Alexander, owning my full name, my birth right.  

I began apprenticing to Native American Shamanic Healers.  I met the mother of my children on a guided fast.  We started a holistic healing center together.  And then, one day, I found myself at a loft party in Brooklyn, where I found these Cards.  Or rather, the Cards found me.

It's like the story of the alchemist.  I searched the world over to find the meaning of life only to discover that it was hidden right in front of me the whole time.

Isn't that the truth?  The meaning of our life is right in front of our eyes if only we could lift the fog to see it clearly.

 

It's in the Cards

Very little has ever been written about these Cards.  Historically, they were kept secret by the Order of the Magi, the wise men and women who safeguarded their truth.

People used to be persecuted for reading these Cards.  It was called witchcraft or the work of the devil. 

And yet, the Cards are so accurate for reading our life that expressions from them are now built into our vocabulary, expressions like "put the cards on the table, find out what's in the cards, play our cards right, etc."


The Mathematics of Our Cosmos

The Cards are based purely on mathematics.  Unlike Tarot Cards, these Cards are scientific, based on numbers, with the precision of mathematical formula. 

We each have 13 Cards in our Life Path, based on the mathematics of our birth date.  Once we know the meaning of each Card we have to play, we can see clearly:

  • 1. What is our primary gift to give in this world.
  • 2. What is the biggest challenge we must face in this lifetime.
  • 3. How we are in relationships and why they fail.
  • 4. What our keys to financial abundance are.
  • 5. What our greatest lesson is that we are here to learn.
  • 6. What grounds us, supports us and what nourishes us.
  • 7. What our shadow side is, the part of us that can sabotage us.
  • 8. What our lifetime reward is for playing our cards right.
  • 9. And much, much more.

It's literally like getting the GPS Navigation for your Life.  You know exactly what to do to have the most enjoyable, wonderful, growing experience of life.

 

Win the Game of Your Life

So, what I'm doing is writing a guidebook where I lay out the meaning of each Card as it appears in your Life Path.  Your Life Path starts on your birthday. Starting from that point, you have 13 Cards in your life to play. 

If you know your birthday, you can use this guide book.

You simply look up your birth date to find out exactly what your Life Path is as it is laid out in the Cards.  Then, you'll know your true purpose in life.  And, you will know how to live a magical life.  

There's a reason why these Cards are associated to magic.  It's because when we play our Cards right, life is magical.  All of life aligns for us, synchronicity happens, doors open, the right people show up, and we manifest the life we really want.  I've seen it over and over again in my private coaching practice.

These cards aren't for playing poker.  They are for playing the game of our life!


In This Guide Book

In addition to learning your Life Path as it's laid out in the Cards, (as if that wasn't enough to learn), you will learn the back ground and history of these Cards, the meaning of all the numbers of the Cards, the meaning of each of the 4 suits and the real meaning of the expression:  A House of Cards.

Most importantly, by learning the meaning of the 13 Cards in your Life Path, you will get the rule book to play the game of your life, and win.

You will also see some common applications of this knowledge to everyday life for professional development, sales training, life coaching, career goals, relationship issues, parenting strategies, and personal growth.


Who Benefits Most From This Guide Book?

Yes, every single human being on this planet (who reads English) could use this guide book to live his or her meaning of life.  We already always live according to the mathematics of our life.  We just don't know it.  So, we fumble around in the dark, lost and confused, bemoaning our existence.

And all the while, the book of life that could show us the way has been hidden right in front of our eyes!

Having said that, this guide book will have the most benefit to people who have a compelling interest in the growth and development of themselves and the people around them.

  • Parents who want to empower their children to great heights in life
  • Therapists / Life Coaches who want to quickly uncover the root issues that are keeping people stuck in their lives
  • Teachers who want to know how to give the best to their students
  • Couples who want to understand the dynamics of their relationship
  • Sales Executives who want to know how to motivate their team
  • Sports Coaches who want to create a zen-like team environment
  • Leadership Trainers who want to bring out the gifts of others
  • CEOs who want to make better decisions

Are you ready to unleash the full potential of your life? Then, this guide book is for you.

 

Pre-Order Your Copy Today

I am self-publishing this guide book: Win The Game of Your Life. 

The minimum investment required for me to design, edit, lay-out and print a full-color, first-run edition of this book is $9,000.  I'm asking for your support to fund a first-edition guide book about these Cards. 

Pre-order your copy of the book now:  get the book that shows you how to win the game of your life.


Please Share This Project With Your Friends And Family

Please let everyone know about this project.  Once we know our cards, then we can live our true purpose.  And, once we know the cards of our friends and family, we can have compassion for them, knowing exactly what cards they have to play.  So, when we have this awareness of who we really are in this life, we can all live together giving our gifts in harmony. 

 

Thank You for Your Support

story:
I don't know of any reading of the yoga sutras as wildly creative, as impassioned and as earnest as this. it engages Patanjali and the reader in an urgent, electrified conversation that weaves philosophy, symbolist poetry, psychoanalysis and cultural history. There's a kind of delight and freshness in this book that is very rare in writing on yoga, and especially rare in writing on the yoga sutras. This is a Patanjali for postmoderns, less a translation than a startlingly relevant report on our current condition, through the prism of this ancient text. Please help Matthew Remski raise the funds to produce this book. The world needs it.

-- Mark Singleton, author of Yoga Body:The Origins of Modern Posture Practice

 

The short story.

I have retranslated the Yoga Sutras of Patanjali for our present paradigm. I've used the lenses of contemporary philosophy, psychology, and neuroscience to "remix" the original stillness and insight of the old book with the best that our age has to offer. I interweave the refashioned verses with critical commentary and personal reflections from a decade of practice.

After nearly three years of work and the collaborative input of dozens of colleagues, I am now ready to publish, and have decided on the print-on-demand route, for reasons of ecology, economy, and timing. My goal over the next 30 days is to raise enough money to pay for my typsetter/designer, my publicist, and the initial promotion drive. Contributing to this campaign is like pre-ordering the book.

 

A little background.

I've been writing novels and poetry from the age of 20. About five years ago, I turned my writing attention to ayurveda, and yoga philosophy. I've written extensively on my own blog, and on Elephant Journal. In 2008 I began collaborating with Scott Petrie on the Yoga 2.0 project, an experiment in open-source yoga philosophy. Over the past four years, we have developed innovative modules for yoga teacher training programmes in the Toronto area, focusing on community building, conscious communication, and navigating the paradoxes of teaching yoga in a consumerist culture. Our work culminated in co-authoring yoga 2.0: shamanic echoes, and producing the first draft of the translation that forms the core of the present book. My full resume is here. I'm especially honoured to be included in the recently-published 21st Century Yoga: Culture, Politics, and Practice: A critical examination of yoga in North America, edited by Carol Horton and Roseanne Harvey.

 

The longer story.

I've always loved the Yoga Sutras. 

The ancient text presents a brilliant picture of our internal complexity, our psycho-somatic interweave, our capacity for self-reflection, and our potential for clarity. Its 196 aphorisms are stirring, sonorous, and they reverberate from a place of deep stillness. Rare amongst spiritual classics, it is completely non-denominational, and points to no other authority for the measurement of evolution than the radiance of personal experience.

But the old book also carries strong echoes of a time and culture almost inconceivably different from our own. Written by and for ascetics who longed to escape the psychic pressures of their brutal civilization, it features several themes that contemporary yoga culture no longer needs. It suggests that our flesh is an impure obstruction to happiness. It promises levitation and the ability to body-snatch. It offers a clearly transcendent path, with little interest in interpersonal relationship, and no mention at all of family, social justice, ecological intelligence, or love.

Here's the paradox. The Yoga Sutras is a core text of contemporary yoga culture. It is required reading in all yoga teacher training programmes worldwide. And, it contains heavy doses of a philosophy we neither hold nor can use, while failing to speak to some of our dearest concerns.

After a decade of yoga practice and contemplation of the sutras, I decided that the best way to re-invigorate this beautiful but flawed book was to literally "remix" it. I've retranslated the sutras to be able to carry contemporary advancements in philosophy, psychology, and neuroscience, and interspersed the aphorisms with my own commentary and reflections on practice. You can preview the finished work here.

My intention is to open a new stream of discourse in our community about how we interact with ancient traditions: what we keep, what we must leave behind, and what we change by merely encountering it. My hope is that this book will make it onto the reading lists of every teacher training programme in the English-speaking world, to hasten our general movement towards intersubjective, socially aware, ecologically sound, and scientifically astute practice.

The book will number between 240 and 280 pages, depending upon how my designer works her magic. I'm asking for contributions to pay her, and my publicist, and for promotional costs as I navigate the jungle of self-publishing. 

 

"Having read the MS, I can wholeheartedly endorse this project as BADLY needed! Contemporary yoga practitioners are generally NOT aligned with the philosophical model and worldview proffered by Patanjali, and yet his text is 'revered' (at least at the level of lip-service) and taught as "fundamental" for practice and understanding. Remski offers a "remix" that offers a reading of Patanjali coherent with a more body/nature/ world positive worldview. I look forward to sharing it with my students!"

-- Frank Jude Boccio, author of Mindfulness Yoga: The Awakened Union of Breath, Body, and Mind

 

What I need & what you get.

I want to crowdsource a temporary publishing house. I'll achieve that if 200 of you pre-order the book!

I've hired Toronto designer Ingrid Paulson to lay out the text and create the cover. I need to pay her approximately $2500. She's fantastic. She produced the cover mockup you see above and in the video. She's done brilliant work so far with the typesetting as well. Take a look at her other work.

I've also hired Toronto yogini Lindsay Gamester to do publicity. Currently, she's creating a database of reviewers, endorsers, and all English-speaking directors of yoga teacher training programmes. When the book is in print, we have planned a mass mailing to all with complementary copies, and an invitation for bulk purchasing for training programmes. I need to pay Lindsay approximately $1500 for her hard work. The remaining $1000 is my estimate for the purchase and shipping costs of about 150 promotional copies to seed this initial publicity wave.

Entry-level contributors to this campaign will recieve the book, which will be available online from about the middle of November. A larger contribution will pay for the book and a one-hour Ayurvedic consultation via Skype. A larger contribution will merit a bulk order of 10 copies at a wholesale rate, to sell on to students. Larger still and I'll come to your studio or conference to workshop the rich themes of this book.

If I don't raise the $5000, I'll be happy as can be with all the pre-publication help and advance orders, and will keep all of the perk commitments as promised.

 

The larger picture.

Throughout this long twilight of institutional religion, the global yoga movement is offering a clear way forward for human evolution: embodied, contemplative, relational, psychosomatic inquiry. It will be successful, in my opinion, to the extent that it sheds its Iron-Age vestiges, and embraces the full range of contemporary knowledge as fuel for its transformational fire. My project is an homage to yoga's past, and a hopeful look into its future.

There's a kind of delight and freshness in this book that is very rare in writing on yoga, and especially rare in writing on the yoga sutras. This is a Patanjali for postmoderns, less a translation than a startlingly relevant report on our current condition, through the prism of this ancient text. Please help Matthew Remski raise the funds to produce this book. The world needs it.
-- Mark Singleton, author of Yoga Body:The Origins of Modern Posture Practice

I interweave the refashioned verses with critical commentary and personal reflections from a decade of practice.
After nearly three years of work and the collaborative input of dozens of colleagues, I am now ready to publish, and have decided on the print-on-demand route, for reasons of ecology, economy, and timing. My goal over the next 30 days is to raise enough money to pay for my typsetter/designer, my publicist, and the initial promotion drive. Contributing to this campaign is like pre-ordering the book.

story:
¿Qué?

Un pedacito de mí sigue los pasos de Nina al tratar de olvidar al hombre que cambió su vida...

Nina lo ha echado todo a perder con Álex; después de que este le mostrara sus sentimientos, ella sale corriendo muerta de miedo. Tras darse cuenta demasiado tarde de que ha cometido el mayor error de su vida tendrá que aprender a vivir con ello. Por si todo eso no fuera suficiente, una nueva pérdida, desgarradora e inesperada, hará que todo su mundo se vea sacudido profundamente.

Poco a poco, gracias a las descabelladas ocurrencias de su mejor amiga María y a la aparición de Diego, que tratará de ganar su corazón por todos los medios y dará algo de luz a su día a día, conseguirá sobreponerse. Sin embargo, los encuentros fortuitos con Álex, que aparece de nuevo en su desordenada vida de forma intermitente, no dejarán que se libere por completo de su dolor.

Por si creía que las cosas no podían ir a peor, una inesperada noticia hará que Nina se vuelva a plantear las cosas de nuevo. Después de un año de altibajos, frustración y pérdida, Nina se tendrá que enfrentar con su pasado, que vendrá de la mano de Álex, del que sigue, a pesar de todo, enamorada. Por fin dejará que salga a la luz toda la rabia contenida, enfrentándose cara a cara con lo que más miedo le da en el mundo, el amor.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Y. Arcenegui.

Nací en Valencia un día de agosto de hace ya treinta y siete años. Con gran pesar, abandoné mi tierra para seguir al hombre de mi vida en sus andaduras por toda la geografía española. Siempre fui muy aplicada en los estudios, perfeccionista y responsable así que, supongo que no me costó mucho sacar adelante la carrera de Derecho. Escribo desde que tengo uso de razón. Empecé muy pronto a crear historias en esta cabecita mía que nunca para de pensar. Devoradora incansable de libros y novelas, puedo pasarme toda la noche leyendo hasta que veo amanecer. Nunca ceso hasta que le veo el final a una buena historia. Romántica empedernida, fiel admiradora de todos los autores románticos, siempre estaré en deuda con mi profesora de literatura en el instituto, que me mostró un mundo nuevo con todas esas obras atemporales y maravillosas.

Tengo dos hijos que son mi vida y, con sus seis y cuatro años, todavía me hago cruces al tratar de encontrar tiempo para hacer aquello que más me gusta, escribir y crear. Trabajo mucho y muy duro, no solo en casa con mis pequeños, sino fuera de ella, haciendo labores comerciales en la empresa en la que trabajo, en Murcia. Llega la noche, todos duermen y la casa está en silencio, mi imaginación se desborda y mis dedos comienzan a aporrear el teclado de mi ordenador. Es entonces cuando puedo ser yo misma y nos encontramos mis historias y yo ante un papel en blanco, ansiosa por recorrer ese camino, por meterme en la piel de mis personajes e ir tejiendo poco a poco sus sentimientos.

Mi primera obra Mil pedazos vio la luz en enero de 2016. Ahora, un año después, os presento la segunda Un pedacito de mí, esperando que tenga la misma buena acogida que la primera.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 960€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para ayudar a sacar adelante esta primera edición de Un pedacito de mí que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Y. Arcenegui vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
I apologize for our english viewers. This ebook is only in French. But don't worry! An english version is in an early stage. Signup at http://gurl.im/a9803dC for updates!

Her you will found an automatic traduction for this text : http://translate.google.fr/

King Regards,

The Author

 

Profiler est une des plus vieilles activités sociales de notre espèce. Malheureusement, stéréotyper également.

SNAP a été créé pour simplifier le 1er point, et limiter le second.

Son cadre opérationnel : votre activité au sein de l'entreprise. Que vous soyez cadre, manager, négociateur, commercial, chargé de la sécurité, etc. Deux questions sont fondamentales lorsque vous rencontrez quelqu'un.                               

En toute discrétion, SNAP permet de répondre avec un taux de fiabilité élevé aux fondements même du profiling civil. Un :  comment l'individu communique avec son entourage ?  Deux : comment agira-t-il ?


Brain Persuasion en quelques lignes ?

La vidéo decrira bien mieux que des mots le principe de base de SNAP. Néanmoisn pour résumer, SNAP est discret. SNAP est facile à apprendre. SNAP s'appuie sur votre propre profil pour vous limiter vos stéréotypes.

et surtout SNAP vous donne une "carte routière" une fois le profil établi pour vous aider à mioeux interagir avec l'individu profilé.

Pour mémoire, certains pays commencent à interdire le recours à des profils par questionnaires même pour le recrutement. Comment ferez-vous dans quelques années ? Vous en ferez confiance qu'à votre intuition ?

Pourquoi du crowdfounding ?

Parce que profiler est une activité extrêmement courante pour chacun d'entre nous. Alors pourquoi pas permettre à chacun d'entre nous de participer en fonction de ses envies à ce programme.

Ensuite le crowdfounding permet une interaction active entre le lecteur et l'auteur ce qui permet de faire évoluer plus rapidement la pensée de l'un et de l'autre.

Votre impact

  • Les petits ruisseaux font les grandes rivières et les études sont coûteuses. Faire avancer ces sujets passionnants font partie des objectifs de l'auteur, et je l'espère des vôtres.
  • Ceux qui ont eu l'occasion de me côtoyer lors de formations savent que ce sujet est un de mes aiguillons personnels. Ils savent aussi je l'espère que j'aime partager le fond d'un sujet car la connaissance s'enrichie de cet échange.
  • La méthode SNAP101 est simple mais repose sur un corpus scientifique important et sans cesse en croissance : celui des variantes du Big Fives. 

Pourquoi pré-vendre cet ouvrage ?

Plusieurs raisons m'ont poussé vers cette solution :

  • Un manuel sur ce sujet ne peut être définitif. Le faire évoluer au fil du temps est donc une nécessité. Ce qui exclu tout intermédiaire classique de l'édition.
  • Le monde est  dynamique, j'espère que nos manuels le seront aussi! La prévente permet de vous proposer beaucoup plus d'options qu'un manuel habituel. Regardez plus bas pour vous en convaincre.
  • Je désirais introduire deux interactions spécifiques dans cet ouvrage. La première : la participation active de "beta-testeurs" pour améliorer le manuel en lui-même. La seconde permettre aux personnes intéressées de participer à un échange direct de questions/réponses, d'éclaircissements, d'approfondissement, etc.
  • Ces deux cas et les autres options ne peuvent exister que si l'intérêt est suffisant, et que le calendrier maitrisé compte tenu de nos activités professionnelles.
  • La prévente est le modèle idéal pour cela.
  • Si les préventes n'atteignent pas la somme minimale fixée, je compléterais le  delta pour lancer néanmoins les projets prévus. ET certains seront - je      l'espère - privilégiés de pouvoir accéder à ces approches modernes de      persuasion.
  • Si les préventes dépassent le seuil fixé. Tant mieux! Cela fera plus de      recherches lancées.

"Je veux bien participer. Mais, quel est l'intérêt pour moi ?"

Vous trouverez sur votre droite les perks du projet. Je sais Perk est un vilain nom mais résume bien la problématique des contributions. Chacune de ces contributions a un coût différent évidemment compte tenu de son impact sur nos activités.

J'aime l'idée de SNAP même si je ne veux pas participer à son financement

Je le comprend parfaitement! Vous pouvez néanmoisn nous aider et nous soutenir :

  • Faites de la publicité à SNAP101! Parlez de notre ouvrage. Diffusez cette      page, mais aussi celle-ci http://gurl.im/aa403dF. Bref, aidez-nous à rendre plus visible notre action.
  • Indiegogo met à disposition différents outils de sharing. Cela serait dommage de ne pas en profiter!

A tous, merci par avance pour vos actions ! Elles sont appréciées à leur juste valeur.

Bien cordialement,

L'auteur

Parce que profiler est une activité extrêmement courante pour chacun d'entre nous. Alors pourquoi pas permettre à chacun d'entre nous de participer en fonction de ses envies à ce programme.
Ensuite le crowdfounding permet une interaction active entre le lecteur et l'auteur ce qui permet de faire évoluer plus rapidement la pensée de l'un et de l'autre.
Votre impact

Les petits ruisseaux font les grandes rivières et les études sont coûteuses. Faire avancer ces sujets passionnants font partie des objectifs de l'auteur, et je l'espère des vôtres.
Ceux qui ont eu l'occasion de me côtoyer lors de formations savent que ce sujet est un de mes aiguillons personnels. Ils savent aussi je l'espère que j'aime partager le fond d'un sujet car la connaissance s'enrichie de cet échange.
La méthode SNAP101 est simple mais repose sur un corpus scientifique important et sans cesse en croissance : celui des variantes du Big Fives. 

Pourquoi pré-vendre cet ouvrage ?
Plusieurs raisons m'ont poussé vers cette solution :

Un manuel sur ce sujet ne peut être définitif. Le faire évoluer au fil du temps est donc une nécessité. Ce qui exclu tout intermédiaire classique de l'édition.
Le monde est  dynamique, j'espère que nos manuels le seront aussi! La prévente permet de vous proposer beaucoup plus d'options qu'un manuel habituel. Regardez plus bas pour vous en convaincre.


Je désirais introduire deux interactions spécifiques dans cet ouvrage. La première : la participation active de "beta-testeurs" pour améliorer le manuel en lui-même. La seconde permettre aux personnes intéressées de participer à un échange direct de questions/réponses, d'éclaircissements, d'approfondissement, etc.


Ces deux cas et les autres options ne peuvent exister que si l'intérêt est suffisant, et que le calendrier maitrisé compte tenu de nos activités professionnelles.
La prévente est le modèle idéal pour cela.
Si les préventes n'atteignent pas la somme minimale fixée, je compléterais le  delta pour lancer néanmoins les projets prévus. ET certains seront - je      l'espère - privilégiés de pouvoir accéder à ces approches modernes de      persuasion.
Si les préventes dépassent le seuil fixé. Tant mieux! Cela fera plus de      recherches lancées.

"Je veux bien participer. Mais, quel est l'intérêt pour moi ?"
Vous trouverez sur votre droite les perks du projet. Je sais Perk est un vilain nom mais résume bien la problématique des contributions. Chacune de ces contributions a un coût différent évidemment compte tenu de son impact sur nos activités.
J'aime l'idée de SNAP même si je ne veux pas participer à son financement
Je le comprend parfaitement! Vous pouvez néanmoisn nous aider et nous soutenir :

Faites de la publicité à SNAP101! Parlez de notre ouvrage. Diffusez cette      page, mais aussi celle-ci http://gurl.im/aa403dF. Bref, aidez-nous à rendre plus visible notre action.
Indiegogo met à disposition différents outils de sharing. Cela serait dommage de ne pas en profiter!

A tous, merci par avance pour vos actions ! Elles sont appréciées à leur juste valeur.
Bien cordialement,
L'auteur

story:
I grew up learning that antisemitism "belonged" to the Nazi ideology. But when I started my research on the Jewish families who "vanished" from my home town in 1942, I got some ugly surprises.

To translate my book, and add my latest research to it, will be my contribution to the fight against antisemitism today.

It is going to be a full time job for 4-6 month, and I do therefore need some financial supporters. Thank you!

story:
We need your help to publish the second holdfast print Anthology!

Holdfast is an award-winning free online speculative fiction magazine that celebrates all things fantastic.

We celebrate speculative fiction by focusing on specific aspects of the genres in themed issues, picking apart each topic in a detailed, analytical yet entertaining way. These genres have so much to offer the literary world, and we want to share our passion for this rich, fascinating and varied resource.

Holdfast is a free resource available to anyone with internet access, run by a small team who work on the magazine in their spare time for free. This means that in order to pay our incredibly talented writers and artists, we raise funds through the printing of an Anthology every four issues. We then use this to pay all of the contributors for those four issues.

We were so pleased to successfully run a campaign for our first anthology, issues 1-4, which not only enabled us to print a beautiful paperback, but also to split all profits after printing and postage costs equally between each contribution.

Since then we’ve gone on to win the British Fantasy Society award for best magazine, get nominated again this year (wow!), and publish four great new issues.

So it’s time for holdfast anthology 2!

Check out our perks and become a part of the holdfast team!

Remember ALL profits after printing and postage go to pay the writers and artists for their valuable work.

Illustration by Jenny Kadis for 'Sybil' by Deborah Walker - one of the illustrations available in our Art Print perks!

story:
The Story

A lot can happen in three months. Just ask Graziano Buonfiglio.

It is October 2009. 28 year old Graziano Buonfiglio has been living with his parents in a Toronto suburb for almost five years. His parents have long hated him, and for years have taken a sick pleasure in bullying him. To make things worse, he is haunted by the mysterious deaths of his grandparents and boyfriend. On the night of his birthday, he tries to take his own life. The following day, his family decides to kick him out for good. Graziano then relocates to Toronto and moves in with his former English professor. 

On All Saints Day, Graziano runs into his family at a cemetery. Despite their bullying, he stands up to them. And for the first time in years, Graziano flourishes professionally and personally. As his professor provides him with much-needed stability and support, he makes new friends and reconnects with old ones, and even contemplates a modeling career. Despite his successes, the memories of his past are always with him, affecting everything in his life, including a budding romance.

As Christmas approaches, the Buonfiglios plan to get rid of him once and for all. Soon, Graziano learns the shocking truth behind the deaths of his loved ones, and when his friends are all attacked within hours of each other, Graziano fears for his life. Before it is too late, Graziano must save his friends and himself from becoming casualties, even if it results in more shocking secrets revealed. 

About Me and the Project

My name is Alex Sarmiento, and I'm a writer/student. I am originally from San Francisco, but I currently live in Fairfield, home to a giant mall and the Travis Air Force Base. 

SAINT GRAZIANO THE GOOD has been a labor of love since fall of 2009. I have long wanted to write a novel, but never got around to doing it. It wasn't until I went to Toronto for a week-long vacation that I finally got the inspiration to do so.

This is the first book that I have ever written. I have done poetry, screenwriting, and short stories, and will continue to do so in the future. Aside from posting on blogs, I am an unpublished writer.

The Money

I completed the manuscript in late March of 2012. The money will be going towards self-publishing costs and other refinements. I want to raise at least $1,000. With the money, I can help get my book (and my writing career) off the ground.

What You Get Out Of It (Aside From A Tote Bag)

Okay, there is no tote bag. In addition to the thank you gifts, you will get the satisfaction of helping me launch my career. There aren't that many Filipino-American gay men in the world of arts & entertainment, and hopefully I can be one of the few who do break through. I will honor your pledges with thank you gifts even if I do land an agent and a publisher.

story:
Manuscript Preview

Also Manuscript Preview

Summary of Me

Hello all. M.P. Fulk here. I'm a recent college graduate with a degree in creative writing and a manuscript in need of readers. That means I have a piece of paper stating I know what I'm doing and another one to back it up. Maybe--that's for you to decide!

Anywho, I won't ramble on. Rather than write a chunk of text summarizing the story, I'll point you to the video above, which is me reading the Prologue for your enjoyment. Then I'll point you to one of the two links above, which preview the prologue and the first three chapters of the manuscript. I avoided reading more because I was scared to do all the voices for dialogue. You know how it is.

(Okay, short summary: Devil escapes Hell, mayhem ensues. I warned you it was short.)

This story is part of a series. Think of it as the cornerstone, sort of a foundation, if you will--there is a direct sequel and several other stories set in the same universe, but the series will be more horizontal than vertical. That is, The Fallen focuses on fallen angels while the sequel focuses on humanity, while another story focuses on demons, and so on. My take on the supernatural set in our real world. 

The Fallen is the first novel in an as yet unnumbered (but nearing two-complete-stories-long) series. After millennia in Hell, Lucifer breaks free, but not to lead mankind astray or tear down the Kingdom of Heaven: He has his own goals in mind. Upon reconnecting with old friend and allies-turned-enemies, he finds the world has changed. But nothing can stand in the way of the Devil unbound.

The Gist

So, this is something of an experiment. Over the last few years I've been writing on-and-off an urban fantasy/supernatural manuscript. In the last few months, I've polished and rewritten the manuscript to the point where I'm happy with it and ready to start pitching to literary agents or ready to consider self-publishing.

But before that, I want to make one final sweep through the manuscript, working out the kinks and potential inconsistencies that stem from the revision process, and I'd love to have readers along for the ride.

The Plan

Everyone that donates $10 or more will receive an email update once a week (Wednesday evenings) including a PDF file of the latest 4-6 chapters of the manuscript. That equates to about 10-15 single-spaced pages a week. Or roughly the amount of time it would take to watch an episode of your favorite television show.

Of course, these will be rolling updates. So when you first donate, I will send you an endearing thank-you note and a PDF file including all the chapters that have been released since the start of the project. And rather than "starting from scratch" for those that donate early, the first week's "update" will be the first 24 chapters of the manuscript, about 25% of the total. [There are currently 98 chapters. I may need to add a chapter or two as we go along to placate my OCD.]

And in case I've confused anyone, here's a simple example of how weekly updates would work:

Ex 1. Billy donates week 1. He receives a PDF of 24 chapters and then weekly updates.
Ex 2. Bob donates week 4. He receives a PDF of 39 chapters (24+15~) and then weekly updates.

For those of you faster at math than I am, you may notice that the chapter updates would extend past the project deadline. This is true! As I've planned now, the entire project will take around 15 weeks. Due to the site's 60-day time constraint, the project will be split into two parts.

But please be aware that you DO NOT have to donate twice. Unless you're feeling generous, of course. Splitting the project into two parts does not affect you or your perks, only gives me more breathing room. I may speed up the updating process and cut the project closer to three months, but with holidays approaching and family hijacking looming, I would rather give everyone a later end date than one I might possibly overshoot.

End of Project (ETA March 1): you will receive a copy of the manuscript in ebook format or a complete PDF, whichever you prefer. Random note goes here--if you only want the ebook/completed manuscript and would like to opt-out of weekly updates, that's cool too, just message me!

Networking Love

Obligatory "your-voice-can-help-me-so-so-much" part. If you would, please consider posting a link to this project on your Facebook page, Twitter, Tumblr, blogs or Whozitz. Better yet, pick out a line or quote you particularly like and post that on your social media first, then send the project link to interested friends, twits and tumbleweeds.

Check out the Facebook page for discussions and random postings. The Tumblr page has short stories, notes on The Fallen and exclusive character sketches highlighting some of the more obscure characters.

If you've read all this, thank you so much. If you've read the preview too, thanks even more. If you've only read this, then you're reading backwards, which is weird. Anyway, thank you, thank you! Hopefully together we can make this novel a success!

--M.P. Fulk

story:
The Victory Press is going to be a real and evolving online news outlet about women's sports.

I'm Zoë and I've been writing about ice hockey online in various capacities since 2008.  Content creation is a very difficult field to get into, and many sports writers online are bloggers and folks who do it just for fun.  There are, however, a small amount of paid writing positions out there.  Most of them are filled by men to write about men's sports.

When I started following women's hockey, I was captivated by the game and the personalities involved.  I also noted that the players themselves were often not paid.  That is changing, thanks to the National Women's Hockey League, which promises to pay a salary to women's ice hockey players. 

I plan to build a site that publishes regular, dedicated women's sports coverage and compensates its writers for the many hours of original reporting that goes into covering women's sports, since other news outlets do not provide this coverage.  I want to start with ice hockey, since that's the beat I'm most familiar with, but The Victory Press will also accept pitches for any other women's sports, and pitches for media criticism/social issues in sports (especially those related to feminism, gender, and sexuality).  (ETA: race and any type of marginalization in sports are also topics we are very interested in.)

I will be running this, to start, as a "sole proprietor" doing business as The Victory Press, and writers will operate as independent contractors.  As the site grows, it will likely legally become a cooperative, where all staff members agree on a set of bylaws and run the business together.  (Also, the city/state for this campaign says Philadelphia, PA because that's where I live.  Hi!  However, I hope to network globally with sports writers to build our contributor base.)

The planned launch for the Victory Press is January 2016.  With this campaign finishing at the end of October, we will then have two months to finalize our staff, finish building our website, and network with contributors.

The Impact

This will be the first time that a company fully devoted to women's sports writing has offered regular pay to writers who will be providing dedicated coverage.  Many writers are already doing the work.  We want to reward them for their time and build a brand/name that will be trusted in sports coverage for many years to come.

  • Be part of history and support women making noise in an entrepreneurial fashion.
  • Elevate the women's game by legitimizing coverage of women's sports.  Starting with women's hockey, we want to make year-round, dedicated, professional coverage a reality.
  • Help us create a real news outlet that regularly publishes articles critiquing sports and sports media from an intersectional, feminist perspective, without having to go through gatekeepers in the mainstream media.
I have a history of writing feminist critique of sports media and I have been dedicating myself to women's hockey coverage for over a year now.  I am very serious about this being my passion, and I know others are too.  Unfortunately passion doesn't pay the bills or give us the professional cachet we need to make this succeed.  With your help, we'll be able to enact change by doing the writing we love and getting better at it.

If you're interested in what I have written personally, please check out the following:
  • Hockey Without Propriety
  • my posts on SBNation.com


What We Need & What You Get

We need money and the support of the sports fan and writing community to accomplish this.  This campaign will provide our startup funds to sustain our first year of operation.  When we are successful, we'll be able to sell subscriptions for premium content and sustain our operations through contributions, subscriptions, and advertising/sponsorships.

We need to cover:
  • Unlimited hosting through ghost.org, our CMS/blogging platform ($100 for the first year; cost goes up if we get more than 25,000 unique page views) (already paid for out of pocket)
  • Our domain name fees (right now, about $15/year) (already paid for out of pocket)
  • Fees for Google Apps for business so that we can have dedicated email addresses for our website operations and staff members ($5 per user per month; staff writers will have their own inboxes)
  • Monthly stipends for our small group of staff writers (in the neighborhood of $200 per month per writer [during the hockey season] for our first year of operation, depending on the amount of articles contributed)
  • Funds to pay writers who contribute to our site on a non-regular basis.  Payment will be negotiated based on each piece, but on average, should pay between $25 and $60 per article depending on length and time spent writing.
  • Funds to pay photographers and artists for the rights to use their photos and work.
  • A pool of funding to help writers cover expenses.  Many writers will drive or take public transportation in order to do original, on-location reporting.  We want to be able to cover these expenses so that they don't come out of our writers' pay.
  • Compensation for our business manager, who will be supervising our finances.
  • Any additional fees related to running/registering a business.

Risks & Challenges

The Internet communities around sports can be incredibly volatile towards women and we anticipate skepticism, if not outright harassment, as a matter of course.  We also anticipate criticism that there's "no money" in women's sports and that the quality of reporting, like the supposed quality of the game, just "isn't as good" as men's sports.

There will also, possibly, be bad press around the idea that our compensation is not a trustworthy promise or that we are taking coverage away from other outlets that provided this coverage without compensating writers.

  • We will treat this like a business and be totally transparent.  Our business manager will be compensated for their time and our funding will live in a dedicated business bank account.  We will publish financial reports on a regular basis to show where contributed funds are going.  Our plan is to be cost-neutral.  All funds will either go directly to paying our writers, website/hosting expenses, or future planning (ex. traveling to events).
  • We will get the word out and work tirelessly to expand our reach in the sporting community.
  • We will protect our writers.  No one will have to publish under their real name if they don't want to.  We will provide security measures on the financial side to ensure that our writers' personal information is secure.
  • We will not claim ownership to our writers' work nor will we prevent them from publishing their work elsewhere.  We will retain "exclusive" rights to publish for one year, after which publishing rights will default to the authors.  Authors can always re-post their stories to their personal blogs.
  • We will always listen to feedback from the community.  If you think that something we did was inappropriate or unfair, we want to hear about it and do what we can to make it right.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this.  Tell your friends.  Tell your friends about women's sports and how awesome they are to follow.
  • Use your social media accounts and use the hashtag #victorypress.  We're excited!  Help us get other people excited.
  • Feel free to reach out with your ideas or concerns.  We are listening.

The Victory Press is going to be a real and evolving online news outlet about women's sports.
I'm Zoë and I've been writing about ice hockey online in various capacities since 2008.  Content creation is a very difficult field to get into, and many sports writers online are bloggers and folks who do it just for fun.  There are, however, a small amount of paid writing positions out there.  Most of them are filled by men to write about men's sports.When I started following women's hockey, I was captivated by the game and the personalities involved.  I also noted that the players themselves were often not paid.  That is changing, thanks to the National Women's Hockey League, which promises to pay a salary to women's ice hockey players.  I plan to build a site that publishes regular, dedicated women's sports coverage and compensates its writers for the many hours of original reporting that goes into covering women's sports, since other news outlets do not provide this coverage.  I want to start with ice hockey, since that's the beat I'm most familiar with, but The Victory Press will also accept pitches for any other women's sports, and pitches for media criticism/social issues in sports (especially those related to feminism, gender, and sexuality).  (ETA: race and any type of marginalization in sports are also topics we are very interested in.)I will be running this, to start, as a "sole proprietor" doing business as The Victory Press, and writers will operate as independent contractors.  As the site grows, it will likely legally become a cooperative, where all staff members agree on a set of bylaws and run the business together.  (Also, the city/state for this campaign says Philadelphia, PA because that's where I live.  Hi!  However, I hope to network globally with sports writers to build our contributor base.)The planned launch for the Victory Press is January 2016.  With this campaign finishing at the end of October, we will then have two months to finalize our staff, finish building our website, and network with contributors.The Impact This will be the first time that a company fully devoted to women's sports writing has offered regular pay to writers who will 
be providing dedicated coverage.  Many writers are already doing the 
work.  We want to reward them for their time and build a brand/name that
 will be trusted in sports coverage for many years to come. 

Be part of history and support women making noise in an entrepreneurial fashion.
Elevate the women's game by legitimizing coverage of women's 
sports.  Starting with women's hockey, we want to make year-round, 
dedicated, professional coverage a reality.
Help us create a real news outlet that regularly publishes articles 
critiquing sports and sports media from an intersectional, feminist 
perspective, without having to go through gatekeepers in the mainstream 
media.
I have a history of writing feminist critique of sports media 
and I have been dedicating myself to women's hockey coverage for over a 
year now.  I am very serious about this being my passion, and I know 
others are too.  Unfortunately passion doesn't pay the bills or give us 
the professional cachet we need to make this succeed.  With your help, 
we'll be able to enact change by doing the writing we love and getting 
better at it.If you're interested in what I have written personally, please check out the following:

my posts on SBNation.com
