story:
Our Story

FAQ Research is a collective whose mission is to promote reasoned discussion of public policy issues. We analyse facts to answer questions. Led by Dr Mark Bahnisch and managed by Pandora Karavan, a team of prominent and experienced researchers and writers, including Professor Roger Jones, Professor John Quiggin, Dr Robet Merkel, Dr Tina Hunter, Troy Collings and Kim Jameson, will shine the spotlight of reason on the Coal Seam Gas industry during this year's Queensland election campaign.

We hope to both provide a new model for online investigative journalism and to make the debate over CSG accountable to fact and reason. We dispel the fog and let the light in, and reach out to stimulate an interactive and high quality debate on a hot button issue.


The Impact

Coal Seam Gas is set to be one of the biggest issues in this year's Queensland state election. Impacting directly on farmers, rural and regional communities and the environment, CSG exploration and extraction also raises big questions about the future of our state, of our nation, and of our planet. As with many such controversies, claims and counter-claims fly, and PR and political spin hides the truth. 


Working in conjunction with the prominent Australian independent media website, Crikey, we will be mining for facts, drilling into CSG, going behind the seams to tell the whole story of how CSG has become so controversial, how the debate has been shaped, and its policy and political implications.


A dedicated website and blog will sit on the Crikey website, demystifying the facts and answering the FAQs, allowing participants in the debate and affected citizens to put their own point of view, testing that point of view against expert knowledge, and providing a space for real time debate as the campaign unfolds.


We believe this initiative is a first for an Australian election campaign, and we hope that it will become a model for interactive, deliberative and stimulating debate on key issues, where the spin and the announceables that clutter the airwaves can be held accountable to facts and to reasoned argument.


We are very excited about this project, and we hope you will be too â€“ and that you will give not just a donation but also give of your expertise, energy and citizen reporting to its realisation.


What We Need & What You Get

We have fully costed our budget, and have already raised $7000 from donations sought through Facebook and email. Crikey is providing significant in kind support to this project, but we need cash to make it happen! Your donations will be directed toward the cost of field reporting, necessary equipment, website and communication tools and hosting, and most importantly, the research, editing and writing time that is needed to  fully realise the project's aims.


By donating, you make a real difference to the quality of public debate in Australia, and to getting the information out that policy makers and citizens need. For far too long, many of us have been passive in the face of political, media and corporate spin, and we now have the chance to get on the front foot around an issue that could hardly be more important to our collective futures.


We are more than happy to provide a detailed breakdown of our budget on request. If we raise funds over and above our target, we'll use those to facilitate evaluation of the project (whose processes are being mapped to ensure it provides a template for future similar projects) and to expand the scope of the project with even more field reporting and interactive goodness!


We have not accepted, and will not accept, any donations from groups, parties or entities with a stake in the CSG debate. We want to prove it's possible to raise funds for a public interest media project, and we're delighted with our progress so far.


If 100 people give $100, or 200 people give $50, then we've reached our target! And you will have made a significant contribution for a small outlay towards improving the quality of public debate in Australia on a key issue and more generally!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the appeal with all potentially interested friends, family, colleagues and contacts!


You can use the buttons at the top of this page to easily share the campaign via social media, including facebook, Twitter and Google+, as well as embedding the fundraiser at your blog, Tumblr or website.


Please also join us on facebook and Twitter to stay in the loop. 


The whole idea of CSG: Behind the Seams is to source as much energy, smarts and enthusiasm from interested citizens and groups so please help us spread the word!

story:
We really need your help.  After a year's worth of writing, putting our 'real' lives on hold, we find ourselves seriously in need of financial assistance to complete the publishing of our book.

The Book

When people think about the baby boomer generation, it often conjures up mental images of Ozzie and Harriet, hula hoops, or dish towels in detergent boxes. We are two boomer women co-authoring a book about the real lives of our generation,  including the nostalgia, but also the secrets and unspoken realities of our youth and every decade since then.

Once Upon Our Times ( Because Life Isn't A Fairytale) 65 Years Growing Up Baby Boomer will be part history, part nostalgia, part pictorial, part investigative journalism, and entirely truthful. We interviewed many members of our generation from all areas of the United States- from the suburbs, cities, rural areas, inner cities, as well as from all economic backgrounds. We extensively report on their views, experiences, and perspectives, often in their own words. 

Some subjects we explore are: the impact of WWII, our parents' generation, suburban growth, the Cold War, politics, lifestyles of each decade, gender roles, money issues, retirement,  clothes, movies, books, music, fads, morals, sex ed, education, Civil Rights, abortion, sports through the decades, growing up different from your peers (disabled, gay, transgender, divorce, addiction, religion, race. teenage pregnancy, abuse, and even teachers who were sexual predators ) Yes, it existed way back then, too!   

 

Baby boomers are now turning 65 at a rate of about 10,000 per day.  We are your parents, grandparents, great-grandparents, and even your children.  We are still active as we redefine aging, just as we actively changed the course of history throughout our lives. 

 

Before computers, cell phones, video games and cd's, before Prozac, before the Civil Rights Movement, the Equal Rights Movement, and Gay Pride, and around the same time TV was  born, so were we.  About 79 million baby boomers. Everyone has a story. This is ours.

Impact

It is our hope that this ground-breaking book is viewed as an important baby boomer history book as well as a thought-provoking and entertaining read for all generations.  In our quest for balance and understanding, we try to have both sides of a controversial issue represented.  We strive to encourage  increased tolerance of minorities through our writing. We also hope this book will find its way into every high school and university library.

 

We have partnered with Ronald McDonald House near Lurie Children's- Chicago as well as Island Harvest on Long Island, so we will donate a portion of the book's sales proceeds to them. They are grateful our book will help them raise much-needed funds.


What We Need & What You Get

We decided to self-publish this book, to have quality control over its contents and future promotion. What we did not count on is how expensive  self-publishing is today.  Shortly, we have to pay a book designer, a book editor, and a book printer to work with us. Our plan is to produce  an initial modest first printing of 1,500 copies. Then, all monies we receive will be re-invested for larger-size printings as the book becomes known throughout America and beyond.   To cut costs, the book will be in black-and-white for text and photographs, with a color front and back cover designed by Cookie Horowitz.  We estimate initial first printing costs will be about $6,000;  the book designer  between $3,000 and $4,000 for text and photo layouts;  and a professional editor  $2000.00 or more. There are other necessary expenses, which include acquiring ISBN numbers, shipping costs, galley proofs, etc.  

 

If we don't raise it all, we will still proceed. We have already pre-sold over 50 copies, and continue to receive occasional pre-orders.  There will be some ads in the back of the book, which raise some initial revenue. (Just like in the back of many high school yearbooks, these ads publicize a business locally or nationally; others contain personal well wishes or messages from fans).


So far, this book writing project has survived for over one year with our own personal funds.  We anticipate a launch date of March or April, 2012.

 

We will send you a free autographed copy of Once Upon Our Times for any donation of $50.00 or more.  Large donations ($1000.00 and up) will merit a special package.  A list of all donors like you will be included in our book.

 

To read more about this book and for a mini-trip down Memory Lane, visit                              www.onceuponourtimes.com  and like us on www.facebook.com/onceuponourtimes 

Contact us at author@onceuponourtimes.com


Even if you cannot donate:

We would appreciate your help spreading the word  about this important upcoming book.  Tell your friends and family. Share this website, our professional website, as well as our Facebook page - and ask people to "like" or "friend" us. Help us grow our e-mail list for future newsletters.

And, if you have a story to share about growing up baby boomer- happy, sad or challenging - please contact us. You could be in this book.  Thank you.

story:
About Start A Revolution

Hi, I'm Kieren Brown and I'm a web developer from London who's been passionate about stories for as far back as he can remember, but frankly has never had the guts to write anything and put it out to the world. 

This campaign is for my book Start A Revolution an apocalyptic novel that I've been working on for the past 2 years and will be releasing on Amazon. Basically, Christian fundamentalist terrorists completely destroy global society and in the middle of the chaos a drug dealer named Alastair Harris finds himself looking after Preeta Patel, a newly orphaned 8 year old girl.

 

As the world falls to pieces all around Alastair and he realises how miserable and alone he's been for most of his life, he's forced to take a deep look at the man in the mirror and he really hates what he sees.

The book is a labour of love and one that I'm unbelievably passionate about! It has energy, emotion, hard hitting action, pain, misery, love, and much much more.

By contributing to this project you'll help me realise a lifelong dream of actually having other people read and enjoy a story I've written.

 

It's what I've wanted to do ever since I was 7 and would take a flashlight under the bed covers to read books for hours on end and to have that happen would make me way more happy than I can EVER try to express with words.

 

Click Here For A Free Sample Of My Book

 

What I Need  

I need exactly 1241 US dollars for the following:

  • 868 dollars for it to be proofread by a professional and all spelling and grammatical errors removed.
  • 493 dollars to have an eye watering cover designed that will sell the book as strongly as is humanly possible and encourage people to want to read it.
  • If my goal isn't reached then the funds I get will go towards my paying for the jobs above as best they can.

 

The Impact Of Your Donation

This project means the world to me because it would be the achievement of a lifelong goal of mine.

Frankly I think the world needs more stories, a great story can and does take you away from all of your worries and problems and places you deep into another world.

 

You lose all track of time and even your own identity and actually become one with the world that you're experiencing. This is the feeling I want to give back to society, I want people around the world to loses themselves completely in my story and be moved by it the way I've been with so many others throughout the years.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get noisy and tell people about this campaign! Friends, family members, co-workers acquaintances, frenemies, enemies, anybody!  Use the social sharing tools to let the world know that this project exists!

story:
The Dodge Poetry Festival is widely acknowledged as the largest poetry event in North America, representing the most eminent poets from the late 20th and early 21st centuries. These four-day celebrations of poetry have been called "poetry heaven" by former U.S. Poet Laureate Robert Hass, "a new Woodstock" by the Christian Science Monitor, and simply "Wordstock" by The New York Times.

The Festival, held in even-numbered years since 1986, has drawn a combined audience of approximately 140,000 attendees from 42 states, including 17,000 high school teachers and 42,000 high school students who attended without charge and traveled from as far away as Florida, Maine, Minnesota and California. On each of these four Fall days, ten or more separate stages offer events simultaneously for audiences of 100 to 2,000 people. Originally held in Waterloo Village, the Festival found a new home in Newark’s Downtown Arts District in 2010.

More about Dodge: http://www.dodgepoetry.org/at-the-festival/background/

The louderARTS Project is a NYC-based literary organization that has, for over a decade, been creating a nurturing, challenging space in which poets and writers may test and revise their work while simultaneously celebrating and being inspired by the work of acclaimed poets from around the country.

We are a weekly poetry series that books 45+ featured poets a year, offers a free workshop for writers to test, revise, and rework their pieces, and annually send winners from poetry slam competitions to compete against over 70 other teams at the National Poetry Slam.

While the slam is vital and central to the challenge we present to our writers, the opportunity to experience the wide range of lectures, performances and panel discussions is incredibly important to our mission and the growth of our writers.

Therefore, rather than recommend attendance, we hope to facilitate it. We are looking for support in order to send as many individuals as we can, including youth poets, to experience the impossibly valuable event that is the Dodge Poetry Festival.

story:
Project Goals:

  1. To transcribe, translate, and publish the  "1000 Names of Sharada," from the original Sanskrit; the core ritual for this Matron Goddess of Kashmir Shaivism, which was lost centuries ago and only recently re-discovered.

  2. To fund the performance of this sacred ritual for the first time in centuries, during the prescribed time of the Nava Ratri festival (‘Nine Nights’ of the Goddess) this Fall, 2013.


    excerpt of the "Thousand Names of Sharada" text



Who is the Goddess Sharada?

“The Radiant Goddess known as Shri Sharada is venerated wherever She manifests  Herself amongst the people as the beautiful incandescence of the Autumn Moon. She unites all people through the expression of their own magnanimous qualities.”  

-Shaiva Master Abhinava Gupta (ca. 950-1025 A.D.).

                      

Sharada means ‘Autumn.’

A Tantric personification of the Goddess Sarasvati, Sharada represents the liberating light of the waxing moon. 

For well over a thousand years, Sharada has been venerated by the Shaivas of Kashmir as their Matron Goddess, as the magnanimous spirit of Kashmir itself who personifies the power (shakti) of Awakened Consciousness (shiva) which resides within all beings.

But for centuries She has been worshiped by the descendants of the Kashmiri Shaivas, who are now in exile from their homeland, without Her central ritual, the Sharada Sahasra Nama—UNTIL NOW.

 

“Sharada is not a being but an essence, not a goddess but the nectar of moonlight, enveloping humanity eternally. She is a song which reverberates the corridors of time with the message of Love.”

-Modern Kashmiri Pandit, Poet Maharaj Kaul.

 

The Story

My name is Christopher Tompkins, and over the last eleven years I have shared the empowering teachings of Tantric Shaivism with over 10,000 people across the globe. 

The vast majority of surviving manuscripts which represent this tradition remain in Kashmir; they have endured through the centuries solely due to the painstaking efforts of generations of Shaiva scholars known as Pandits (‘Learned Ones’), who diligently copied them by hand (below). 

 

               19th century Kashmiri Pandits copy manuscripts for preservation

Due to foreign invasion and persecution, the peaceful Pandits were forced into a final exile from their homeland in 1990, and had to leave these precious manuscripts behind.

Today, thousands of Tantric texts precariously survive in the hands of people who have no interest in this sacred tradition.

Since then, most Westerners with the ability to translate and preserve these texts have been denied access to this literary legacy... 

I was determined to beat the odds.

In March of 2012, I founded the Tantric (Shaiva) Manuscript Acquisition Project (TMAP), in order to retrieve as many of these sacred manuscripts as possible from Kashmir and make them freely available to other scholars and practitioners before they are lost forever.  

Thanks to the generous support of our community, I raised $13,000 in 2 weeks, and set off for the valley of Kashmir. I returned in May 2012 with over 25,000 scanned pages of unpublished Shaiva manuscripts.

This was the most successful acquisition attempt ever made.

                                                                                                Valley of Kashmir

While in Kashmir, I set off to four of the five shrines, now largely abandoned, where I ceremoniously re-installed the mantras of these Goddesses that are imbued contain their vibrational energy (shakti). Sadly, I was not able to pilgrimage to the temple of  Sharada, the oldest and most venerated Kashmiri Goddess of all, located in present-day Pakistan. I swore that someday I would find a way to the shrine of Sharada Devi.

Instead, Sharada found me.

                                                               above the valley of Kashmir, May 2012.

While cataloging the acquired manuscripts, I made a most auspicious discovery--the previously lost Sharada Sahasra Nama ("The Thousand Names of Goddess Sharada") mis-catalogued by the archivists.

Composed in antiquity by a devotee named Sahajaka (‘Spontaneous One’), the text is written in ‘Sharada,’ the beautiful Kashmiri script of the Sanskrit language named after the Goddess Herself (below)-- imbuing the 1,000 names with her very Presence and Power.

                                             excerpt, Thousand Names of Sharada (Sahasra Nama) 

The beautiful ‘1000 Names of Sharada’ (Sharada Sahasra Nama), lost and forgotten for centuries, has returned to us via a six-foot long scroll, preserving the most sacred and core ritual of Shri Sharada, the matron Goddess of Kashmir. 

It is the only copy of the text known to exist. 

The ritual recitation of Goddess Sharada’s 1000 sacred names was performed for centuries as an annual fire offering (homa or pooja)  at the culmination of the Fall festival known as Nava Ratri, the ‘Nine Nights of the Goddess,’ in order to bless all devotees and to liberate them from suffering.

 

THE FIRST UNVEILING OF THE SHARADA SAHASRA NAMA BEFORE KASHMIRI PANDITS IN EXILE IN MAY 2013

On May  27th 2013, at a beautiful Sharada Temple built in Stroudsburg PA, I revealed this scroll and preliminary translations to a group of Kashmiri Pandit families who were overjoyed with the re-discovery of their lost Sharada Sahasra Nama.

This was an honor of my life, for it marked the first time the exiled Kashmiris have ever heard a detailed description of what the Matron Goddess of their sacred homeland looks like. 

After this incredible event in late May, I intuitively knew that this is the year to bring the Sharada Sahasra Nama ritual back to life ,on the prescribed lunar day for its performance, which falls on October 12th. 

Thus by June I abandoned all other projects, and began the painstaking work of editing, transcribing, and translating, the lengthy ‘1000 Names of Sharada.’ My intention is to complete this work by early Fall with the help of this Campaign.

 

with Kashmir Pandits Rakesh Kaul, Dr. Sanjeev Kaul and Dr. Nirmal Mattoo, May 2013. 

        

“History was made, when for the first time in many centuries, the precious Sharada Sahasranama was revealed to the Kashmiri Pandits who had gathered expectantly for this moment. The translation, from Sarada script into Sanskrit and then into English of this important manuscript, is the painstaking effort of Chris Tompkins, who was our keynote speaker. For the first time we now have the description of Sharada, the Goddess Kasmir Devi, which we can use to visualize her…The translation of the full Sahasranama is proceeding as part of the Kashmir Shaivism project (shaivadarshana.org). It is intended that we will conduct the first Sahasra Nama ritual to Sharada on Nava Ratri this October.” 

–Kashmir Pandit Rakkesh Kaul, founder of the ‘Sharada Path to Wealth Consciousness’ and grand-son of Gopi Krishna, author of Living With Kundalini.

  

 What This Means:

The completion of this translation and publication will unite the Kashmiri Pandits with the Modern Yoga community--

Two groups of people with a shared interest in reviving Goddess Sharada for cultural preservation and Her expansion into modernity.

 

                                                                                                  Dal Lake, Kashmir Valley

WHERE YOUR MONEY WILL GO.

1. Towards the work of Editing, Transcribing, and Translating the Sharada Sahasra Nama scroll. There is a significant amount of scholarly work which must still go into editing (cleaning up) a lengthy text like this from a single surviving copy; half of the work has already been done, and the rest will be completed in time for the ritual's performance in October. Details are given in the next (brief) video below.

2. Towards the publication of an e-text containing the Sharada Sahasra Nama ritual with original Sanskrit and English Translation, made available to devotees worldwide in time for the prescribed performance of its ritual on October 12th, 2013. 

3. Towards funding the 1st performance in centuries of the ritual itself, on October 12th, 2013.  Worldwide access to the ritual’s performance will be given via live stream video or download. Hosted by Christopher Tompkins and Christopher Wallis, location TBA.

4. Towards preparing a beautiful hard copy edition of the entire Sharada Sahasra Nama scroll, including my introduction to the legacy and history of Shri Sharada, an English translation of the entire text (contents are given below), and the beautiful artwork of Ekabhumi Elik, available in March 2014.

5.  Kashmir Shaivism Preservation Project. Any contributions that exceed our goal will go directly towards this most auspicious cause --to support the translation of other precious manuscripts in our collection, and to fund our next trip to India, in order to retrieve as many of the remaining endangered Shaiva/Tantrik manuscripts still in Kashmir as possible. Please visit www.shaivadarshana.org to learn more!
 

 

IMPACT  

Justice and Cultural Preservation.You are directly helping to fund the revival of the lost core ritual of Sharada, the matron Goddess of both the Kashmiri Pandit community in exile, and also the worldwide Sringeri community based in South India (www.sringeri.net). You moreover will support our effort to preserve the endangered manuscripts of Kashmir Shaivism, and help to raise awareness about the legacy and integrity of the exiled Kashmir Pandit community, which has toiled so long to preserve it.

 

Deeper Knowledge of Tantric/Hatha Yoga: Your contribution will expand the world’s understanding of the system of Kundalini Yoga, a practice central to the Sharada Sahasranama ritual, and the corresponding science of sacred sound at the heart of it.


Self-Empowerment: The performance of this ritual is ultimately meant to trigger the power (Shakti) within all of us, personified as Sharada, to overcome habitual patterns of suffering and to draw blessings into our lives, especially to our creative projects. 

______

By contributing to this project you are joining a worldwide community supporting the revival of an ancient, sacred ritual, specifically performed in order to ignite the inner fire of awakened consciousness.

_______

This project brings the sacred ritual of Goddess Sharada back to Her people, the Kashmiri Pandits, in an united effort with the Modern Yoga community, a shared celebration in solidarity for a common goal:

 To revive the creativity, abundance, wisdom and compassion that Sharada herself embodies.

 

 

Please let your friends and family know about this revolutionary campaign!

story:
My Story

My name is Courtney Simchak and I am a senior at Texas State University-San Marcos, majoring in Creative Writing and minoring in Honors Studies. As an honor's student I have two major requirements that I need to complete in order to graduate within the program:  a study-abroad experience and a completed honor's poetry thesis.

Both have been very difficult for me to complete, due to my financial situation and responsibilities. I have been unable to find the time and the space in order for me to finish my first complete book of poems for my honor's thesis and I have not been able to raise the tuition costs needed to study abroad.

By the grace of a dear friend, I have been given an amazing opportunity to travel to Ireland and stay for a week in Galway for much cheaper than it would have been for me to pay the tuition for an official study abroad program and I have also been offered the discounted opportunity to stay at a house in Enniscrone for a week to allow for me to work on my thesis.

With the left-overs of my Spring financial aid and some saved up funds I have managed to cover the costs of my airplane ticket, my passport and the cost of lodging in Enniscrone, but I need help with funding the day-to-day costs of travel. 

This campaign is to help raise funds to cover the costs of food, busfare, a proper raincoat (an imperative piece of equipment, I am told) and the entry fees for museums, etc. 

The Impact

With your help, the impact from this trip could be enormous. This amazing opportunity will allow for me to have the experience of a lifetime, exploring and being exposed to a beautiful culture outside of my own and will also offer the precious time and space needed for to me to finish writing my honor's thesis.

The ability to visit Dublin, Cliffs of Moher, Galway City and Enniscrone will undoubtedly alter and expand my experience with the world and the access to such a quiet but intense landscape is exactly the kind of sensory research and experience I need to complete my first book.

Without the funding for this trip, fundraised by Indie Go-Go, it will be very difficult for me to travel in Ireland. I currently have enough cover my lodging and plane ticket, but without funds for food and intercity travel (bus, taxi, etc.), it will be impossible for me to take full advantage of this experience. I feel deep down, that this trip could be really extraordinary--not only for my work, but for my own life and self, as well. In the very least of it, I will be completing graduation requirements to finish my Undergraduate education!  I would really like to take advantage of the opportunity that has been set before me and would like your help to do it.

Help a colleen fund her trip to one the prettiest places on earth!

 

What I Need

I have some money saved up to cover the big costs of travel, so I officially have my airfare, lodging and passport taken care of, but I need funding for the day-to-day costs of travel, like a good raincoat, food and bus fare. 

Your donation will go towards the following items:

To offset gas costs for car trips: $50.00 (37 euros)


What donations have been covered so far: 

Averaged cost for food at roughly $26 (20 euros) a day, for 14 days: 364.00 (278 euros)

Bus fare from Galway to Enniscrone: $35.00 (26 euros)

Bus fare from Enniscrone to Dublin: $26.00 (19 euros) 

Hostel in Dublin: $28 (21 euros)

Taxifare around Dublin and to airport: $40 (30 euros)

Cliff of Moher Tour: $6 (5 euros)

Indie Go-Go Fees if goals are met: $28.00

Raincoat with hood: $40-$90 (30 - 68 euros)

Averaged cost for food at roughly $26 (20 euros) a day, for 2 days: $52.00 (39 euros)

(All prices are approximate.)


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word and encourage other people to share and donate, as well. Every little bit helps. 

Thank you for any and all of your support!

story:
Nerdy Little Secrets:

Marsy goes from planning a hairnet revolution to plotting a complicated bank robbery. Enter Mr. Darcy, who inspires her to start a whole new line of Mr. Darcy greeting cards and to get her love life in order. Clark, Marsy's brother & Cortez Marsy's long time crush are along for the ride to Marsy's Mom and step-Dad's Hawaiian wedding. This merged family wedding is bound to be filled with drama. Not to be outdone, Marsy inadvertently gets involved in a kidnapping and finds herself running from the Chinese mob.

With all the sex in 50 Shades of Grey & all the magic in Harry Potter completely missing, Nerdy Little Secrets crawls inside the mind of a twenty-year-old lusty, nerdy, desperate virgin. Shunning all logic and reasonable thinking she doggedly pursues impossible relationships and unnecessary heroic deeds. Embarrassingly honest and heartrendingly truthful, Marsy will make you laugh and see all the beauty in the everyday human experience.

Between the Ditches

Marsy Clemens is impetuous, tenacious, determined, creative and slightly desperate. Choked and exhausted by everything around her, she makes a mad dash for excitement and freedom by quitting her job, printing several thousand greeting cards, buying a map of Canada and packing some snacks for the road. For anyone who has ever felt like they wanted more, but were too afraid to go and grab it - or for those who have ventured beyond the cubicle into the indie world - this book is for you. Marsy will show you what living indie is all about, and what gluten induced paranoia, a confused terrorist attack, a near kidnapping, writing forbidden love letters and motel arson are all about too. She sleeps in her car, suffers through 5 star room service, drives a beater and braves the possibility of love, to sell her heart on folded pieces of paper. Endearing and hilarious, Marsy Clemens will take you on an entrepreneurial adventure.

Reviews:

"I thought I’d be able to keep track of the number of times I laughed, but soon gave up...The book and its humour are distinctly Canadian – easygoing, wry, and at times as dry as your skin in December...If you ever wondered what those geeky girls in the corner were thinking, if you don’t know what people allergic to gluten endure, or if you care about neither and just want an easy read that will make you laugh and smile, this book’s for you."                     

Maryss Noble, Author of Flow

 

 

 

"I started reading it last night and nearly got in trouble because I was trying not to laugh because my wife was sleeping, but I couldn't stop myself and so was kind of jerking and snorting...An absolute delight."

 

Tony Goodman, Head of History SMUS

 

 

 

"I haven't laughed that hard in public since I read The Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy."                

Michael Rodgers, Actor

 

 

"thinking of...your book...One of the biggest...books a year...other than my own...I...read...the book...Fondly"

 

 Janet Evanovich,  Author of The Stephanie Plum Series

(email quote possibly somewhat creatively edited)

 

 

 

"Tish Heath’s brilliant run-down of all things Canadiana through the quirky and immediately likeable perspective of Marsy Clemens rings so true you can’t help but squirm in your seat knowing Marsy’s awkward suspicions could very well be your own...her quick witted retorts and unpredictable reactions will keep you laughing and relating well beyond three thousand miles of highway, and she might even teach you a thing or two about going after what you really want.

 

Selina Jacobson,  Author of Tangled Limbs

story:
A Campaign to Raise Funds for a Full-Page Ad Calling for a Global Support of the Sewol Ferry Act


On April 16th, the world watched as over 300 students helplessly lost their lives in the capsized ferry. 100 days have passed, yet we are still asking the same question: Why was not ONE rescued?

President Park Geun-hye and the South Korean government have failed once again to keep their promises for an investigation that will bring answers to the question.  Their treatment of the victims' families have been beyond inhumane since the disaster.  Instead of providing adequate support to the families and helping them to heal from the trauma of losing their children, the government took over their social media accounts and placed them under illegal surveillance using undercover police. Members of President Park’s party spread false rumors coloring the families as money-hungry revolts and communists in attempts to manipulate public sentiment against them. While ten families are still waiting to retrieve the bodies of their lost children, members of President Park’s party have told the families to quit mourning and start moving on with life. The riot police violently suppressed the families and supporters during peaceful march, blocking them with walls of barricade and shooting them with high-pressured water hose.


The families never asked for any monetary compensation or even medical help. The only thing they have been seeking since Day 1 was the truth – why was a disaster like this even allowed in the first place, and why weren’t any of their children saved? 


The families soon realized that their trust in the tears of President Park shed in front of the cameras were lost in vain. They started a rally demanding a special legislation to be enacted. The "Sewol Ferry Act," which will involve independent and thorough investigation of the disaster with prosecution of those who are responsible, will serve as groundwork to finally putting an end to disasters caused by governmental corruption and corporate greed prevalent in South Korea.  It will also serve as a corner stone to building a solid plan that will prevent future disasters like Sewol.


The Elements of Sewol Ferry Act -- proposed by the families of the victims

1. Form a Special Committee that the families of the victims and public can trust:  8 members elected by the congress and 8 members elected by the group representing the families
2. Guarantee an adequate time (up to 3 years) for the Special Committee to carry out a thorough investigation, prosecution and construction of a plan to prevent future disasters
3. Form technical subcommittees within the Special Committee:
      a. Independent Investigation Committee
     b. Safety Planning and Disaster Prevention Committee
     c. Commemoration Committee
4. Guaranteed rights to investigate and prosecute to be exercised by the Special Committee:  Without these two rights, a thorough investigation and prevention of
future disasters will not be made possible
5. Guaranteed implementation and enforcement of Disaster Prevention Plan: 
     a. The Committee submits the Plan to the congress
     b. Related agencies periodically submit reports of the status of implementation to the congress
    c. If not followed through, the responsible agencies and personnel  receive disciplinary retribution 


What the families are asking only makes sense. What they are asking is not much. But for some reason, it seems to be too big of a pill for the Park Geun-hye administration to swallow. You can't help but wonder, what are they so afraid of?

In today’s global society where close to one million foreigners live in South Korea, of which 120,000 are Americans, the lack of public safety due to government's negligence and corruption is not only their problem, but our problem.  In order to make a safer society and prevent history from repeating itself, the Sewol Ferry Act must be enacted.  We cannot let corruption and greed take any more innocent lives. Our fight will continue until the Sewol Ferry Act proposed by the victims’ families gets enacted and justice is served to those who deserve it.


Your Voice Through Our Ad is Powerful

In case you're not aware, this is our second Indiegogo campaign and if successful, we'll be able to place a third (and hopefully fourth) full-page ad(s) in major American newspapers.  You can find our first Indiegogo campaign and our two published ads here: Our Previous Indiegogo Campaign

Following the release of our ads in the New York Times and the Washington Post, which received much publicity in Korea, numerous journalists at KBS and MBC (public broadcasting companies in SK) came out confessing of their involvement in the fabricated coverage of the ferry accident. They further testified of the pressure by the upper management and government coercing them to write biased reports favorable of the Blue House. The journalists at KBS eventually stood up against injustice, demanding rights to deliver objective journalism for the benefit of the public by going on a week-long strike. Coincidence? We think not. 

[KBS Journalists on strike apologizing for their failed journalism and demanding right to deliver objective news to the public]

[Citizens gathered in Seoul for a rally to support the Sewol Ferry Act]

We want to keep the momentum going. We seek to make a difference -- a history that will finally put an end to the man-made disasters so prevalent in Korea. And we invite YOU to be a part of it.


What You Can Expect

If we reach our initial goal of $58,273 (the cost of placing a full-page black & white ad plus transaction fees), we will place a full-page ad in one of the major newspapers in the U.S. that will call for a global support to petition for the Sewol Ferry Act.  

If we double or triple our funding goal like we did in our initial campaign, we will use the remainder funds to place subsequent ads with different contents that will continue to pressure the South Korean government.

If we have leftover funds after the ad(s), we will select an independent news company and donate the funds as we did in the first campaign.

Finally, as we did with our first campaign, we will be transparent with the use of the funds and post screen shots on the Updates for your reference. 


Other Ways You Can Help

It's totally fine if you cannot support us financially. Your words still matter as much, if not more. Please spread the word through Facebook, Twitter, and other social media outlets. Share this link with your friends and family:  http://igg.me/at/SewolFerryAct


==========================================================


세월호 100일, 진실은 침몰했습니다.

구조를 기다리던 300여명의 아이들이 통째로 수장되었지만 100일이 지난 지금, 세월호가 침몰한 정확한 원인도 단 한명도 구조되지 못한 그 이유도 여전히 밝혀지지 않았습니다. 유가족들은 진상규명과 책임자처벌을 약속했던 대통령의 눈물을 믿고 기다렸지만 돌아온것은 유가족 사찰, 평화시위에 대한 폭력진압 뿐이었습니다. 모두가 떠난 팽목항에는 아직도 돌아오지못한 10명의 아이들을 기다리는 실종자 가족만이 남아 있습니다. 이에 우리는 정부와 여당이 국민과 유가족 기만을 즉각 중단하고 350만명이 서명한 유가족측 세월호 특별법을 수용해 제정할 것을 촉구합니다.  

진실의 열쇠를 쥐고있을 선장도 언딘도 해경도 청와대도 모두 침묵으로 하나된 것 같습니다. 국정조사 특별 위원회가 열렸지만 관련 장관들은 무책임한 태도와 성의없는 답변으로 일관했고 여당의원들은 졸거나 오만한 자세로 특위에 임하며 유족들에게 막말을 하기도했습니다. 특위는 청와대에 207건의 자료를 요청했으나 제출자료는 7건에 그쳤고 최초 허위보도를한 MBC는 출석을 거부했습니다. 그러나 특위에서 일어나는 여당과 정부의 비상식적 대응을 주요방송 3사중 어느곳도 생방송으로 중계하지 않았고 뉴스로 다루지도않았습니다.

진상규명과 책임자처벌 그리고 참사없는 안전사회만들기를 내용으로 하는 유가족 측 세월호 특별법안은 위원회의 수사권, 기소권, 청문회소집권을 포함하고 있습니다. 수사권이없다면 특위에서처럼 진실을 밝히기가 어려울거고 기소권이 없다면 적절한 처벌을 기대할 수 없습니다. 그리고 청문회가 열리지 않는다면 특별법 조차도 그 과정이 언론에 보도되지 않을것 입니다.

세월호 참사 당일 박근혜대통령의 행방은 묘연합니다. 사고 직후 무려 7시간동안 대통령은 부재 상태였습니다. 구명조끼를 입고있는 학생들을 왜 구조하지 못하냐고 한 초등적 질문은 부재로 인해 사고에 대해 관심도 없고 보고도 제대로 받지 못했음을 반증합니다. 청문회를 통해 성역없는수사 그리고 국민이 공감할 수 있는 처벌과 사후대책이 뒤따라야 합니다.

유가족측은 의사자 지정도 특례입학도 아닌 오직 진정한 진상규명과 책임자 처벌만을 요구하고 있습니다.  현재 여당과 야당이 내놓은 특별법안은 제대로 된 수사도 처벌도 불가능하며 세월호와 같은 대형사고의 재발방지를 위한 대책마련도 빠져 있습니다. 우리는 특별하지도 않는 특별법, 아무효력도 없는 특별법이 아닌 진정한 기능과 권위를 가진 유가족 측 특별법안 채택을 촉구합니다. 

첫째, 유가족 측 추천위원의 과반수 구성

둘째, 특별 위원회의 활동기간을 최장 3년으로 보장

셋째, 특별 위원회에 독립적 수사 및 기소권 보장

넷째, 참사 재발 방지 대책의 지속적 시행 보장

세월호참사 100일이 되던 날 5만명의 시민이 모여 특별법 제정을 촉구했지만 경찰의 폭행 진압외에 청와대에서는 아무런 답변이 없었습니다. 

우리는 다시 한 번 해외교민의 힘을 모아 세월호 특별법 제정 촉구 광고 캠페인에 나섭니다. 많은 참여 바랍니다.


*** 성공리에 마친 1차 인디고고 캠페인과 NYT, WP 에 실린 광고를 보시려면 여기를 클릭하세요: 1차 인디고고 캠페인

1차때와 마찬가지로 목표금액을 도달하면 미국 주력 일간지에 전세계인들로 부터 세월호 특별법 제정을 위한 서명운동을 촉구하는 광고가 나갈것 입니다.  만약 저희가 1차때 처럼 목표금액의 세배를 넘는 금액이 모금이 된다면 한국 정부를 압박할 2차 3차의 새로운 광고들을 내보낼것 입니다. 이번 모금은 최대한 광고에 이용될 것 입니다. 광고를 다 하고 더이상 광고를 낼 수 없을만큼의 잔액이 남는다면 양심언론사 한곳을 지정해서 기부할것입니다.

마지막으로 1차때와 마찬가지로 자금정리는 스크린샷을 통해 후원자분들에게 투명한 공개를 하겠습니다. 


저희 인디고고 캠페인을 소셜미디어를 통해 널리 퍼트려주세요!

세월호가 침몰한 정확한 원인도 단 한명도 구조되지 못한 그 이유도 여전히 밝혀지지 않았습니다. 유가족들은 진상규명과 책임자처벌을 약속했던 대통령의 눈물을 믿고 기다렸지만 돌아온것은 유가족 사찰, 평화시위에 대한 폭력진압 뿐이었습니다. 모두가 떠난 팽목항에는 아직도 돌아오지못한
10명의 아이들을 기다리는 실종자 가족만이 남아 있습니다. 이에 우리는 정부와 여당이 국민과 유가족 기만을 즉각 중단하고 350만명이 서명한 유가족측 세월호 특별법을 수용해 제정할 것을 촉구합니다.
 
진실의 열쇠를 쥐고있을 선장도 언딘도 해경도 청와대도 모두 침묵으로 하나된 것 같습니다. 국정조사 특별 위원회가 열렸지만 관련 장관들은 무책임한 태도와 성의없는 답변으로 일관했고 여당의원들은 졸거나 오만한 자세로 특위에 임하며 유족들에게 막말을 하기도했습니다. 특위는 청와대에 207건의 자료를 요청했으나 제출자료는 7건에 그쳤고 최초 허위보도를한
MBC는 출석을 거부했습니다. 그러나 특위에서 일어나는 여당과 정부의 비상식적 대응을 주요방송 3사중 어느곳도 생방송으로 중계하지 않았고 뉴스로 다루지도않았습니다.
진상규명과 책임자처벌 그리고 참사없는 안전사회만들기를 내용으로 하는 유가족 측 세월호 특별법안은 위원회의 수사권, 기소권, 청문회소집권을 포함하고 있습니다. 수사권이없다면 특위에서처럼 진실을 밝히기가 어려울거고 기소권이 없다면 적절한 처벌을 기대할 수 없습니다. 그리고 청문회가 열리지 않는다면 특별법 조차도 그 과정이 언론에 보도되지 않을것 입니다.
세월호 참사 당일 박근혜대통령의 행방은 묘연합니다. 사고 직후 무려 7시간동안 대통령은 부재 상태였습니다. 구명조끼를 입고있는 학생들을 왜 구조하지 못하냐고 한 초등적 질문은 부재로 인해 사고에 대해 관심도 없고 보고도 제대로 받지 못했음을 반증합니다. 청문회를 통해 성역없는수사 그리고 국민이 공감할 수 있는 처벌과 사후대책이 뒤따라야 합니다. 
유가족측은 의사자 지정도 특례입학도 아닌 오직 진정한 진상규명과 책임자 처벌만을 요구하고 있습니다.  현재 여당과 야당이 내놓은 특별법안은 제대로 된 수사도 처벌도 불가능하며 세월호와 같은 대형사고의 재발방지를 위한 대책마련도 빠져 있습니다. 우리는 특별하지도 않는 특별법, 아무효력도 없는 특별법이 아닌 진정한 기능과 권위를 가진 유가족 측 특별법안 채택을 촉구합니다. 

첫째,
유가족 측 추천위원의 과반수 구성
둘째,
특별 위원회의 활동기간을 최장 3년으로 보장
셋째,
특별 위원회에 독립적 수사 및 기소권 보장
넷째,
참사 재발 방지 대책의 지속적 시행 보장
세월호참사 100일이 되던 날 5만명의 시민이 모여 특별법 제정을 촉구했지만 경찰의 폭행 진압외에 청와대에서는 아무런 답변이 없었습니다. 
우리는 다시 한 번 해외교민의 힘을 모아 세월호 특별법 제정 촉구 광고 캠페인에 나섭니다. 많은 참여 바랍니다.

*** 성공리에 마친 1차 인디고고 캠페인과 NYT, WP 에 실린 광고를 보시려면 여기를 클릭하세요: 1차 인디고고 캠페인
1차때와 마찬가지로 목표금액을 도달하면 미국 주력 일간지에 전세계인들로 부터 세월호 특별법 제정을 위한 서명운동을 촉구하는 광고가 나갈것 입니다.  만약 저희가 1차때 처럼 목표금액의 세배를 넘는 금액이 모금이 된다면 한국 정부를 압박할 2차 3차의 새로운 광고들을 내보낼것 입니다. 이번 모금은 최대한 광고에 이용될 것 입니다. 광고를 다 하고 더이상 광고를 낼 수 없을만큼의 잔액이 남는다면 양심언론사 한곳을 지정해서 기부할것입니다.
마지막으로 1차때와 마찬가지로 자금정리는 스크린샷을 통해 후원자분들에게 투명한 공개를 하겠습니다. 

저희 인디고고 캠페인을 소셜미디어를 통해 널리 퍼트려주세요!  
링크: http://igg.me/at/SewolFerryAct

story:
A children's book written by Maria Zavakou in both Greek and English: 

This is a story - written in both greek and english -about how difficult and important it is for children to remain loyal to what they love to do, to find the strength to resist peer pressure and negative influences. It is about raising awareness that happiness is closely linked to doing things we love. It is a great way to speak about important issues with our children through examples and images. Finally, It is about letting children bloom. 

By supporting this project you make it possible for creative people to do meaningful work, something not taken for granted after the collapse of the Greek economy.  By giving the opportunity to artists involved to do what they love you become a supporter of the book's idea in practice, you help artists bloom, and you spread the message out there. 

In the event that we exceed our goal we wish to donate all proceedings to Μake-A-Wish (Κάνε-Μια-Ευχή Ελλάδος) the NGO that grants wishes of children with life-threatening medical conditions, in order to enrich the human experience with hope, strength and joy.   

About the book and this effort wrote the Huffington Post http://huff.to/1xkTJO3

By donating you get the book for yourself, for your children or as a present:  

The story needs to be illustrated, it needs a cover design, formatting and editing in order to get published electronically and printed. Maria Bacha is our illustrator who will create the cover and approximately 12 pages of illustrations plus vignettes. 

Once the campaign is complete and successful all contributors will receive the illustrated book electronically or published depending on th perk. 

At the same time, you become part of an important cause, of raising funds for Make-A-Wish, since all extra amount will be directly donated for the granting of wishes of children with life-threatening medical conditions.  

For the realization of this project we need your support.  

Please join us to make this book a reality!

A few things about us...

I am a writer from Greece, one amongst many suffering the pains of the crisis that made us believe that art is a second priority in life. In this discouraging environment I still strongly believe expression is a first priority for artists.  It is a need and for its fulfillment I will keep trying my best considering the obstacles as an opportunity to produce something important.

Our illustrator is Maria Bacha, her love for childrens' book illustration has been awarded. Check out her work.  

http://mariabacha.com/about

Moshoula Strevlou is both a graphic designer and believer in human dreams that will assume the formatting and book design process.  

Maritina Diamantopoulou who cooperates with a well known Greek publisher will add her touch and love for literature.  

The story:

Lou and Lee, a boy and his best friend the rabbit love pastry cooking. Actually, every child loves something in the island of perfection: gardening, making hats, drawing, writing. They all have a desire in their hearts, an inclination, something they enjoy doing. But King Perfect, the island's authority, wants to make a generation of super citizens, of great accomplishments and introduces the celebration of perfection where everyone has to complete unrealistic missions. The winner will become his assistant. 

All kids are influenced by the King’s carrot and stick methods and give up what they love. Gradually, they integrate his view of them into their belief system and become alienated from who they are. The “celebration of perfection” transforms them into adults, their childish appearance and nature is lost. Everyone wants to win even at the expense of others. The snowball effect of suspicion begins and the island becomes a horrible place to live in.

Only Lou and his rabbit Lee stay true to their love of cooking pastry. To this end they fight against peer pressure, fail, experiment with new recipes, feel disappointed and betrayed by their peers, but in the end retain their inner voice and remain faithful to themselves.

Lou and Lee’s actions and decisions are an inspiration for children to overcome self -doubt and keep trying. Lou and Lee send a message to all parents, teachers all kinds of authority to reflect twice on their responsibility over influencing younger people. What Lou and Lee try to say is that there is one thing that stands out in all of us. Protect it.

Lou and the rabbit is a story dedicated to all "sufferers", "quitters", disoriented, disappointed kids, but also parents. It is hope for more happiness because after all happiness is linked to being aware of our skills, standing up for them, practicing them and limiting the negative effect some people have on us - or that we have on others. It is a reminder that if we return to what we once loved happiness can be found again, no matter how many years we may have lost it.   

Perfectionism has turned into a global epidemic. There is a large portion of people out there suffering this, there are kids, but also parents who will remember this story in a time of need. A funny, enjoyfull, adventurous and useful story for audiences from 7-14 years old, their parents and teachers. 

Other Ways You Can Help

E-mailing this to other people, institutions, blogs who can contribute to this is valuable help. Thank you for your support!  

Thank you to Maria Lafi for helping us make the video: http://marialafi.com/index.php?lang=en

story:
What is The Troubadour? 

The Troubadour is Bard High School Early College's annual student-run literary magazine. We are the longest standing publication at BHSEC. Our weekly meetings, in which we review peer works of all genres, consistently attract over twenty student editors. We aim to cultivate an accepting and creative environment where literature is celebrated. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $1250 to be able to publish a high quality magazine that compliments the high quality student content, and to finance our annual reading event. This event features published authors and student contributors who share their works. 
See our perks section! 

The Impact

The Troubadour is a highly appreciated publication that gives teens an outlet for their creative and emotional expression. In the Bard High School Early College curriculum, there is little room designated for creative writing. The Troubadour provides a crucial break from structured analytical writing. 

Spread the word about The Troubadour! 

Thank you for all of your support,

The Lit Mag Staff

story:
My name is Cassandra Wind, and I’m a single mother of three, a certified acupuncturist and massage therapist, and owner of Wind Sports & Wellness in Milwaukee, WI. I’ve practiced both Eastern and Western Medicine for over 25 years, first as a nuclear medicine technologist, and more recently after receiving my masters in Oriental Medicine from the Midwest College of Oriental Medicine, with an internship at the University of Traditional Chinese Medicine in Guangzhau, China. My personal and professional mission is to create an environment where people are comfortable integrating both Eastern and Western practices and traditions into a balanced, healthy lifestyle. I work with many adults who suffer from symptoms like pain, skin conditions, allergies, obesity and weight issues, digestive complaints, fatigue, headaches and more. Often I think to myself, wouldn’t it be wonderful if we were able to get to the root of these conditions earlier, and treat them when they are less severe? This is why I’m seeking to publish my book, Ancient Teachings – New Traditions, and establish a workbook and toolkit to guide parents through one of the most important transitions in a girl’s life.

I believe that in traditional western society, we often overlook the magnitude of the time when a girl physically begins her transition into womanhood. As adults, we are anxious and even embarrassed to discuss the physical changes that occur, and it’s even more difficult to figure out how to guide our daughters and shape them into the loving, secure, confident adults we hope they’ll become. My book offers a simple guide and user-friendly tools to help you approach your daughter’s coming of age in a different, gentler way. I use ancient traditions from cultures across the globe to inspire practices that any family can replicate to create a positive, safe environment for their girl(s) to grow into women.

I believe that this book and the tools that surround it can impact the next generation of women in America and beyond. It is our responsibility to give our girls the tools they need to lead a healthy, well-adjusted life. Ancient Teachings – New Traditions offers a guide to help us get back to the sacred coming-of-age practices that provide support, guidance, and the nurturing that our girls need in order to be successful, healthy adults.

Our Request & Your Investment: 

I am seeking $25,000 in funding for this project. The breakdown of those dollars includes:

·  $5,000 for editing and producing the e-book, paperback, and workbook

·  $8,000 for producing the accompanying Treasure Chest for mass distribution

·  $2,000 for scholarships to my overnight Mother-Daughter retreats which include the book, workbook, and Treasure Chest

·  $10,000 for Marketing and advertising related to the release of the e-book, paperback, workbook, and treasure chest

My perks include first-releases of Ancient Teachings – New Traditions autographed by my daughter, Sage, the inspiration for the entire project and myself. At higher levels, I invite contributors to connect with me on a more personal level, through informal one-on-one meetings, formal health and wellness consultations, and at my Mother-Daughter overnight retreat. And at the highest levels of giving, I invite my sponsors to include their name or business name on the published version of the book, and to help develop the Treasure Chest component of the package. The Treasure Chest will be a vessel designed to accompany the book and workbook, filled with the things that helped Sage and I through her transition into adulthood.

If I don’t achieve my $25,000 goal, my first priority is to develop and publish the e-book and paperback versions of Ancient Teachings – New Traditions, releasing them to the public in 2015. I can provide guidance through my website and public speaking engagements until the time when I can publish the workbook and develop the Treasure Chest.

You Have a Huge Impact! 

Every person who helps to fund Ancient Teachings – New Traditions is taking responsibility for the next generation of women. Whether you have a daughter, niece, Goddaughter, neighbor kid, or just want to see a healthier, happier generation of girls, you are in the right place. By teaching parents, teachers, counselors, and all youth service providers to use the wisdom of past generations across many cultures, we can change our society, and change the world.

Our Challenge: 

The real risk in this project is creating something that doesn’t reach the people who need it, which is why I’ve built in a marketing and advertising budget for Ancient Teachings – New Traditions. Once the book and accompanying tools are developed and produced, the real key will be to distribute it widely and champion its use across the U.S. and beyond. You have my personal commitment that once we’ve got the tools in place, I will take every opportunity to teach real people how to use it, champion it’s use both locally and nationally, and bring it to people who may not be able to purchase it through my retreat scholarship program.

How You Can Help Without Investing Financially: 

If you are passionate about helping the next generation of girls become loving, secure, confident women, and are unable to contribute financially, there are many ways that you can help this movement:

·  Tell your friends and family about this fundraising campaign for Ancient Teachings – New Traditions – talk to them using the phone, email, or make it an excuse for a coffee date!

·  Follow us on Facebook (Facebook.com/wind-sports-wellness), and talk about this exciting idea using your own social media outlets – Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn are great ways to share your passion for this project!

·  Does your business like to support community projects like this one, or do you know of an organization that makes grants that might support Ancient Teachings – New Traditions? Let us know how we can get our campaign in front of them!

·  When the book gets published, share a copy with the parents of a girl you know will grow into an amazing woman!

Thank you for investing in Ancient Teachings – New Traditions. I believe that it truly does take a whole village to raise a child, and I can’t wait to share the tools and techniques that helped me get through the transition of girl to woman with Sage, and successfully raise a daughter in the age of cell-phones and social media. Your support of this campaign will help us reach thousands of parents and put the tools in their hands to change a generation!

entire project and myself. At higher levels, I invite contributors to connect
with me on a more personal level, through informal one-on-one meetings, formal
health and wellness consultations, and at my Mother-Daughter overnight retreat.
And at the highest levels of giving, I invite my sponsors to include their name
or business name on the published version of the book, and to help develop the
Treasure Chest component of the package. The Treasure Chest will be a vessel designed
to accompany the book and workbook, filled with the things that helped Sage and
I through her transition into adulthood. 
If I don’t achieve my $25,000 goal, my first priority is to
develop and publish the e-book and paperback versions of Ancient Teachings –
New Traditions, releasing them to the public in 2015. I can provide
guidance through my website and public speaking engagements until the time when
I can publish the workbook and develop the Treasure Chest. 
You Have a Huge Impact! 
Every person who helps to fund Ancient Teachings – New
Traditions is taking responsibility for the next generation of women.
Whether you have a daughter, niece, Goddaughter, neighbor kid, or just want to
see a healthier, happier generation of girls, you are in the right place. By teaching
parents, teachers, counselors, and all youth service providers to use the
wisdom of past generations across many cultures, we can change our society, and
change the world. 
Our Challenge: 
The real risk in this project is creating something that
doesn’t reach the people who need it, which is why I’ve built in a marketing
and advertising budget for Ancient Teachings – New Traditions. Once the
book and accompanying tools are developed and produced, the real key will be to
distribute it widely and champion its use across the U.S. and beyond. You have
my personal commitment that once we’ve got the tools in place, I will take
every opportunity to teach real people how to use it, champion it’s use both
locally and nationally, and bring it to people who may not be able to purchase
it through my retreat scholarship program. 
How You Can Help Without Investing Financially: 
If you are passionate about helping the next generation of
girls become loving, secure, confident women, and are unable to contribute
financially, there are many ways that you can help this movement: 
· 
Tell your friends and family about this
fundraising campaign for Ancient Teachings – New Traditions – talk to
them using the phone, email, or make it an excuse for a coffee date! 
· 
Follow us on Facebook
(Facebook.com/wind-sports-wellness), and talk about this exciting idea using
your own social media outlets – Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn are great ways
to share your passion for this project! 
· 
Does your business like to support community
projects like this one, or do you know of an organization that makes grants
that might support Ancient Teachings – New Traditions? Let us know how
we can get our campaign in front of them! 
· 
When the book gets published, share a copy with
the parents of a girl you know will grow into an amazing woman! 
Thank you for investing in Ancient Teachings – New
Traditions. I believe that it truly does take a whole village to raise a
child, and I can’t wait to share the tools and techniques that helped me get
through the transition of girl to woman with Sage, and successfully raise a
daughter in the age of cell-phones and social media. Your support of this
campaign will help us reach thousands of parents and put the tools in their
hands to change a generation!

story:
Parents Need Support

When I was diagnosed with a life-altering illness, there was no manual about what my parents could expect. They didn't know how to answer questions about my own fate, they didn't know how to deal with me not wanting to take care of myself, or how to give me a quality life that I would be proud of. Luckily, my parents are superheros, and they did the best they could, and I turned out just fine. Now, I feel it is my duty to pass along the secret ways they gave me a quality life, which lead to an adulthood where I am healthy and happy.  It is so important that I share my story so that parents of kids with illnesses like mine can feel prepared and comforted that they GOT this! And for the kids, this book will allow them to live a life with less fear and more laughter. 

What you get

I'm asking for funds to help pay for the editing and publishing costs of this book. 

  • $1500 will pay for all editing and some initial publishing costs. 
  • Any donation of $20 will get you your very own copy of the book, or a donation to a parent. For $10 more, you'll get a copy AND one will be sent to a hospital to be distributed to parents who will benefit. If you become a Top Contributor, you will not only receive a copy and have one sent to a hospital, but I will also publish your name in the acknowledgements of the book for your generosity. 
  • If I don't reach my goal, the funds will be used to off-set the costs of publishing. 

The Impact

This book will make an impact on parents and children who are struggling with a life similar to my own:

  • Parents will be prepared with ways to address the many challenges they face when raising children who are going through such a scary time
  • Kids of these parents will benefit when they learn how to take care of themselves, and live a quality life without limitations
  • I have written a blog for years on this topic, but now is the time to deepen the impact and provide families with concrete tools to give their children the life they've always imagined for them

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't got the cash to spare, no worries. You can still impact this important project by sharing it with your friends! 

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share to social media
  • Go to http://thesowhatlife.com to sign up for my mailing list, and follow me on facebook and instagram

Thanks for your support!

story:
Covering Venezuela

 

  • Mi chiamo Barbara Schiavulli e per 20 anni ho seguito i conflitti in particolare in Medio Oriente e Centr'Asia. Ho lavorato per quasi tutti i quotidiani e settimanali italiani. Ho vinto premi prestigiosi e pubblicato cinque libri. Il cuore del mio lavoro è stato sempre portare i lettori con me ovunque andassi. Attraverso le storie a volte piccole della gente, raccontavo i grandi avvenimenti, come la caduta di Saddam, o la caduta e risalita dei talebani in Afghanistan, il conflitto israelo palestinese, o il colpo di Stato ad Haiti. Ho fatto la prima intervista al mondo al presidente afgano, ho ascoltato le storie dei soldati, raccontato la forza e il coraggio di donne che hanno subito violenza per mano dei trafficanti. Per me entrare nella vita della gente è un onore.
  • Ora vorrei andare in Venezuela. C'è una tremenda crisi politica ed economica in corso. Conosciamo i fatti, quelli ci arrivano attraverso i media della gente. Ma vorrei sentire delle storie. Vorrei far conoscere chi lotta, chi aiuta, chi soccombe e chi invece ha coraggio da vendere.
  • Questo costa, il giornalismo indipendente, onesto e serio, non è gratis e io come molti altri colleghi, sono una freelance in un paese dove i giornali pagano poco e male. Ma il valore del nostro lavoro non è lowcost. I costi più gravosi per stare un paio di settimane in Venezuela sono il volo (un migliaio di euro), i prezzi degli aerei sono schizzati perché naturalmente nessuno ci sta andando e il fixer. Il fixer è una persona del luogo, spesso un giornalista che ci organizza il lavoro, traduce, rischia accanto a noi. Non si parla mai di loro, ma senza questi giovani professionisti, questo mestiere non si potrebbe fare bene. Devono e meritano di essere pagati. Poi ci sono gli spostamenti, l'hotel (che in realtà ora è molto economico sempre perché nessuno sta andando), la connessione. 
  • Sostenere questo mestiere è una sfida, mi rivolgo alle persone che credono in questo mestiere, a chi vuole sapere cosa sta accadendo in quel paese dove vivono anche migliaia di italiani, mi rivolgo ai nostri ascoltatori e amici, che conoscono quanto sia importante per me e per la squadra di Radio Bullets, raccontare stando nei posti. Se volete essere parte di questo viaggio, contribuite con una piccola, o grande donazione, oppure con la diffusione di questo crowdfunding, con l'ascolto e la lettura di quello che racconterò. Sono fermamente convinta che il giornalismo crei cultura e indipendenza. E chi ci crede, dovrebbe venire con me. Ho intenzione di fare un reportage quotidiano oltre ai pezzi tradizionali, dove raccontare un po' il backstage di quello che vedo e sento. Venite con me. Grazie.

story:
THANK YOU TO THE UNIVERSE!

I have accomplished one of my life goals. To write 80,000 words, create a co-cohesive story that can lead to more books in a series. I will also reach another goal in the process of being a published author. 

I have decided to self publish my first book because of the genre that it is in.Young Adult Supernatural, specifically werewolves. I wasn't really planning on the book to become something when I started it, but it did. It became awesomeness. 

My book follows three character's perspectives taking you into the lives of Anchorage Wolf packs, their Alpha contenders and the hunters set to kill them. 

ELIZABETH TUCKER: Recently aware of her family's secrets, Elizabeth (age 15) struggles with her twin brother transitioning into a wolf, yet she is not changing. She finds out the guy she has been dating for the last five months is a hunter who is supposed to kill a wolf. She dreams and meets her potential Alpha mate, who she can talk with in their heads. The Tuckers are the Alpha's of the Eastside.

MALAKAI FISHER- A hunter who finds out his specialty is healing. He has lost both parents to the war between wolves and hunters, adopted by his parent's best friend and guardian, he works through loving the one he has to kill and choosing to heal his fellow hunters, or the wolf he loves. 

SIMEON NANTO- Alpha pup of the Hillside Pack, also a member of the only set of wolf triplets in his generation, Simeon has always liked being human, and being with his girlfriend, who is human. He is a poet and songwriter, but hides his love for music because his Father doesn't approve. When he starts having dreams about his mate, while she is in human form, he starts to question his role as an Alpha. He feels instinctively attracted to her, and is able to have conversations with her.

What they face together will determine the future of the wolf packs in Anchorage.

TO DONATE TO MY CONTRIBUTION OR NOT

Self publishing, while expensive at first glance, is nothing compared to traditional publishing where the company has to put the money up front to print a bunch of books that might not get sold. I have decided to publish through Amazon, using a print upon demand system where the book isn't printed until the order is placed. I am also going to get my manuscript edited through their professional staff, which is the majority of where the funds will go. 

A list of the things needed to get published are:

Editing

Custom Cover

Formatted for online publishing (E-books) 


Everything is not just about being published either. An author needs to promote their book in order to get book sales, so a portion of the funds will go to advertising and promotions.


My perks for your contribution are as follows in detail:

$5 - Love note and quote book mark- A personalized handwritten thank you note and a quote from the book made into a book mark to keep in a place where you left off. 

$10- A 5X7 photograph taken, matted and signed by me, love note and quote bookmark. 

$15- A handwritten poem of 16 lines on stationary paper. Love Note and quote bookmark.


$20- Hand painted Canvas made specifically for the donation. A love note and quote bookmark handmade specifically for you.

$25- Handmade 11 X 18 poster that says "Northside". Love note and quote bookmark. 

$30- Create a future character in the series. There are three more books planned for this series, see your character in a future book of the Black Wolf Series, plus a love note and quote bookmark.

$35- Gift Surprise package with any of the above perks combined

$50- Acknowledgement in book, (up to two names) 2 love note and quote bookmarks, handwritten poem on stationary paper. 

$75- Your choice of perk, Acknowledgement in book, signed copy of First edition copy of Northside. 




ALL CONTRIBUTORS NAMES WILL BE ADDED TO THE WEBSITE ON A SPECIAL "THANK YOU" PAGE.  

I WILL ADD PICTURES AS I START MAKING THEM. KEEP A LOOK OUT FOR UPDATES.

The Impact.

Your contribution will help me get on my way to becoming a published author. I have saved some money to help with editing, but I do not have the full amount and am choosing to ask for help from family and friends in order to get my name out there and publish this dream of mine. Not only will my great fiction story be told, but you will be able to tell people that you helped be a part of this story. 

Networking and touring my book will need to be done also, so some of the money can go towards my first book reading too! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute today, that is totally fine! I ask you please spread the word to your friends to help me with my project. I have chose a flexible campaign where I will recieve all the funds raised, even if it doesn't hit my goal, which will get me one step closer to the final project. 

I am planning on launching the book one 11/12/13, so if all goes well, that will be the date I launch my book.

story:
Hello Creative Types,

My name is Al Saulso I'm a photographer, artist, and lover of artistic energy.

 As long as I have been a artist/photographer, I have dealt with media institutions, that have blocked or tried to control my artistic vision. I felt as if no one cared about the artist and what he or she thought about a project, just how fast you could produce what they wanted to see. Therefore, the artist becomes expendable and overshadowed, so the true intent of the art is lost.

 CRAY magazine is a simple idea that puts the art and artist in front and gives them a platform to stand on, thus allowing their creativity to grow. We pride ourselves on being different from other companies by allowing the art to speak for itself the artist can control the whole layout or any amount of pages in the magazine to get their point across. Images are important forms of communication and if we stop an artist from fully developing their concept through their chosen medium, then we are diminishing an idea that could one day change our perception of the world.

  It's my dream to expand art awareness in the world and we wish not to stop at just a magazine, but go on and open artistically driven centers, complete with galleries, nationwide where literacy programs and showcases for upcoming young artists are paramount. Yes I'm a "dreamer" a big dreamer that believes with the help "you" give,  we can change the world of the artists we promote in CRAY magazine.  

FUNDING:

The amount we ask for is very small, but you have to start somewhere to help grow the project into new avenues. Since our wonderful staff volunteer their time and still is committed producing a quality digital magazine, eventually we would like to do special for each of them with the funds we raise. 

CRAY magazine will be digital until we get enough funds though advertising to expand to print. We wish to stay "free" when we start to print because it's important to give everyone a chance to see art, not just one class. Being free requires a amount of advertisement, so if you can't give now and you have a business in art or fashion, please let us know we would love to have you advertise in our magazine.   

YOUR HELP MATTERS:

As you know I've been an artist for about 10 years now and 100% of my income is from patrons, people just like yourselves, that believe in the work that I do. Your  donation means the world to our staff and to a new artist we promote. Please help us get one step closer to that beautiful artistic dream of a world full of art and harmony.

ANY WAY YOU CAN HELP:

We know everyone has different ways of giving or may not have the funds, trust me I can understand, I still want to hear from you!! because I will do this project if I'm flat broke and I know this will change lives in a positive way. I love speaking to people and inspiring them and allowing them to inspire me. It's all about giving whether that be time, energy, or even thoughts. They all equal to something helpful.  We welcome artist and creative types and we want you to enjoy CRAY. please follow us at www.facebook.com/craymagazine and http://craymagazine.tumblr.com  for work by Al Saulso   http://www.pinterest.com/alsaulso/my-work-all-work-by-al-saulso/

 

CRAY MAGAZINE VIDEO: Made by two up and coming photographers  Willie Vance and Rajan Wadhera and in the video is Natasha Knight a model & actress that is pushing boundaries in modeling in the UK and Nationally. We wish to give young artists a chance to do projects and explore the realms of creativity.

 THE COVER OF THE 2ND ISSUE:  Above was taken by photographer/model Phillip Meeks and is becoming a rising star in the fashion world we are happy to be apart of his journey.
