story:
Dear visitor,

Our campaign has ended.

We welcome you to our home on the web.

With love and gratitude,

Maya & Shanto


Let us now tell you the true story about...

Shanto’s Meeting with Maya – and the Birth of a Book

In the end of June 2013, Shanto moved out of his home in Sweden – with nowhere to move in. He drove to the mountains of southern France, where he met up with his family of tantrikas. Two intense and mind-blowing weeks later, he spent an open-air night in a vineyard together with two Dutch women, who were like him on their way home. Bats flying only centimeters over their faces didn’t disturb the peacefulness of this full moon night. It merely added to the magic of their journey – home.

But where was his home – for the future?

After a short stay in the Netherlands, Shanto returned to Sweden for three weeks of taking care of business, and seeing friends. He started to think about where to move in after this summer on the road – and his mind went blank. The past three years, he had spent living alone in a forest cottage; cherishing the silence, chopping firewood, shoveling snow, and watching roe-deer munching fallen apples in the garden.

During this time he had seen his ghostwriter business grow from zero to successful, but now the page had been turned. It was time to start a new chapter. The cottage he had been renting was up for sale, and his “writing behind the scenes” business didn’t completely satisfy him anymore.

The only thing that came to mind when envisioning his next home, were some comments made by the two Dutch tantrikas during their road trip northwards. Those were comments about upcoming events and possibilities in the Netherlands, along with playful suggestions that he should make his home there – so much closer to most of the people of his beloved tantric family.

It did sound appealing. The idea of it did touch his heart. But was it not sheer madness; irresponsible dreaming? He could not prolong his holidays for an indefinite period of time – could he? He needed a new home, and even though he was between assignments, he could not just give up his ghostwriting business – could he?

And then the idea came…

He would write a book – with his own name on the cover! The two Dutch women would be in it – as would the other people of his tantric family. Focusing on this idea, the prospect of returning to the Netherlands immediately took on a new quality: from irresponsible whim to the only possible continuation of the journey of his heart.

Letting this new project put him in motion, he hit the southbound road again. The first interview started to unfold with the person in whose home he was a guest, in Utrecht. And then the second portrait of a tantrika of his family started to emerge in his manuscript…

The work was now in progress; he was interviewing his brothers and sisters in the ‘Kaula’, the tantric family where he felt so deeply at home. He spent August and September in this way, moving from friend to friend in the Netherlands.

And then, one day, he was offered to rent an apartment – in Utrecht! From the first of November.

His heart said YES – so what did it matter that he had by now lived up all his savings, and had no money whatsoever to pay the rent?

Once again, he returned to Sweden for a few weeks, to prepare for the moving of himself and his business: From being a ghostwriter in Sweden to being a writer in the Netherlands. From being paid by his customers, to writing with the joy of the heart as the only payment.

Having sold his furniture, his bicycle, his old printer, and whatever little things he could let go of, he moved in in the Utrecht apartment. Looking for the odd job, and gratefully receiving some economical support from friends, he kept financing his writing and living in his new home – where a happy bunch of green naturalized parrots would often play around just outside his third floor window.

And then, one day… he met Maya!

A lover always knows his beloved in the moment he meets her, doesn’t he?

In the meeting with Maya, lies the deepest home Shanto has ever known together with a woman. On the 10th of January, Shanto and Maya entered a ‘Tantric Marriage’ for a year to come.

In a Tantric Marriage, divorce is not an option – it is designed for the growing together, no matter what is brought up within and between the two partners. And many juicy, yummy fruits can for sure come out of such a commitment. In the marriage of Maya and Shanto, a book – ‘Maya – Child Of The Earth’ – is one of the fruits that immediately started to grow.

It just happened like that. This Book came sailing by, and there was no other option than to jump aboard - joyously shouting laughter-filled prayers to the wind...

What can be said about this book? Well, let’s first state clearly what it is not: it is not a biography; it is not a chronological account of one woman’s life. Far from it! It is an open exploration; an innocent journey into the multidimensional space of human experience; a mirror where each and every one of us may recognize their own face – its darkness and its light. It is a free fall through the labyrinth of memory; it is a wild encounter with the rawness of being alive on this earth; it is a curious inquiry into the unknown face of Existence Itself… It is a book in the making, and as every truly creative project it is a journey into the unknown.

Would you like to have a little taste of the book right now? Then go to the newly set up website – www.childoftheearth.org – where you can read the prologue. [Update 5 Feb: And now also the first chapter! Update 18 Feb: And the second!]

While the writing of Shanto’s first book, ‘The Seeds Of Tantra – Portraits Of Men And Women In A Tantric Family’, is still going on, parallelly ‘Maya – Child Of The Earth’ is now being created – day by day… Shanto feels that the two books graciously cross-fertilize each other in his busy writer’s life. [Update 5 Feb: Shanto has chosen to put 'The Seeds Of Tantra' project on hold, as the work of creating and funding 'Maya - Child Of The Earth' currently takes all his time. The work will be resumed whenever possible - and there is even a vision that 'The Seeds Of Tantra' project may transform into a film...]

And it all happens without economical resources.

Please consider helping Shanto and Maya to sail their book project into its harbor, by contributing a sum of money. They will be forever grateful to you, and you will be personally thanked in the book – which can only be born into this world thanks to your contribution.

With love,

Maya and Shanto



The insect 'Child Of The Earth' (genus Stenopelmatus), also known as 'Jerusalem cricket', or 'potato bug'.



What Will Your Contribution Be Doing?

Your contribution will make it possible for Shanto to finance his new life as a (non-ghost) writer, in the time period of February – December 2014.

Rent of writer’s accommodation: 5720 euro

Telephone & Internet costs: 880 euro

Travel costs: 1960 euro

Living expenses (food, personal services, etc): 3250 euro

Fund raising costs: 690 euro

Contingencies: 500 euro

 

What Do You Get?

Above all, you get the chance to read the book!

This book depends on your contribution for its birth into the world.

By donating to our campaign, you become its co-creator. And as such, you are cherished deep within the hearts of Maya and Shanto. Thank you!

Every contributor to this book project will be personally thanked in the book.

*** In addition, you will be rewarded for your contribution according to how much you contribute. See the list of perks! ***


Who is Shanto, the Author of ‘Maya - Child Of The Earth’?

To find out, please, visit the official website of Shanto’s ghostwriting business, available in English and Swedish.

Still have questions? Please, feel free to send an e-mail to Shanto with any questions you may have – or ideas, suggestions or feedback.


When Will You Have The Book In Your Hand?

Shanto and Maya’s Tantric Marriage ends on the 10th of January 2015 (at which time it can be prolonged, should they so wish). They see this book as a fruit of their marriage, and so they have decided that the manuscript will be completed well before the 10th of January 2015.

They have also decided that an e-book version will be made available before the 10th of January 2015.

Exactly when you can lay your hands on a printed copy of the book, is currently not possible to say. It depends on the publishing process.


A Word on Crowdfunding

Normally we go out there, into the marketplace we call ‘the world’, searching among everything on offer. We spend our hard-earned money on what we feel will fulfill our needs – in terms of health, pleasure and entertainment. We act as passive consumers.

Yet, there is also another way: we can take part in creating what we want to have in our world. We can search in the world of initiatives that precedes the world of the marketplace. Indiegogo is such a world of initiatives. Here you can browse any number of creative projects, in search of the ones your heart wants to support. And by so doing, you start to act as an active consumer – and even a co-creator!

By donating to crowdfunded projects, such as this one, you actively influence which initiatives will bear fruit in the world. With a few clicks of your mouse, you can become a ‘midwife’ of books, films, and art projects that would never have had the chance to make it into the world without you.


A Word on Tantra

Piglet: “How do you spell 'love'?”

Winnie The Pooh: “You don't spell it... you feel it.”

This quote from the world of Winnie The Pooh, has something to say about tantra too. You can read up on the Indian and Tibetan roots of tantra, trying to ‘spell it out’ – but will it give you a true understanding of tantra? No. It is with tantra as it is with love: you feel it, you experience it, you live it…

What is a Tantric Marriage? Well, apparently it is a union which can give birth to a book called ‘Maya – Child Of The Earth’…

Are you curious beyond that? Then maybe look for ways to have your own experience of tantra. Here, for starters, is a link to Wild Tantra.


A Word on the Child of the Earth – the Insect

One evening, Maya showed one of her favorite movies to Shanto, La Belle Verte.

After watching the movie, Shanto felt touched, and a phrase flashed up in his mind: ‘Child Of The Earth’. He googled it, and found… an insect! It turned out that insects of the genus Stenopelmatus, are known by the name child of the earth – as well as several other names, such as Jerusalem cricket and potato bug.

In a conversation between Shanto and Maya in a bathhouse a couple of days later, the phrase ‘Child Of The Earth’ merged with the idea of creating a book out of their meeting. Ever since, this little bug is invited into the ongoing creation of the book – as a guest with unknown significance… And as the project mascot. :-)



We hope you're enjoying being a Child Of The Earth!
Thank you for being here - with us!

story:
HELLO

Welcome to our Indiegogo crowdfunding page. Please have a look at our video and read the information below to learn about our project and its beneficiaries. We hope you will help us realise our ambition and bring our project to life.

WHAT WE ARE TRYING TO DO

We (the Afghanistan and Central Asian Association) will hold a one-day conference in London at the end of January to examine the future of Afghanistan post-2014, the year of the Afghan elections and the deadline for the withdrawal of international troops. We have invited a number of high-profile guests representing political, academic and humanitarian fields, as well as our membership network of Afghan people living in the UK and Europe. Throughout the day we will hold panel discussions on the electoral process, the position of human rights and women in Afghanistan, and the role of the diaspora in the growth of a democratic society.

While there have been plenty of events on post-2014 Afghanistan, most have been exclusively political or academic. The most important and exciting thing about our event is that we are trying to give the Afghan people living in Europe and the UK the opportunity to put their questions and suggestions to politicians and experts. These people, many of whom have come here as refugees and asylum seekers, need to be heard and represented. They need to have a stake in the future of their own country, to which many wish to return when conditions permit.

The UK has been involved in Afghanistan since 2001 primarily in a military capacity. With the departure of troops at the end of 2014, many inside Afghanistan are worried not just about the implications for security and the possible resurgence of the Taliban, but also the massive decline in foreign aid which will follow. By holding our event at a UK university and inviting students to learn about Afghanistan, we want to make an example of the kind of support which will be invaluable in strengthening Afghan civil society in the future. We want to empower Afghans living here, show that we support their participation in the post-2014 political settlement, and give them hope that they will not be forgotten after the departure of troops.

WHAT WE NEED

We are able to put on this unique event because of the efforts of our staff and volunteers. We are not requesting funding for any aspect of the organisational process. What we need your help for is the costs during the day itself.

In recognition of our charitable efforts in South-East London, we have kindly been offered a venue by Goldsmiths, University of London free of charge. But such an event carries numerous other logistical costs.

As a base, we need to raise £1500 to cover the costs of catering and promotion. With our team of volunteers, we will buy food and cook for the 200 guests we expect to attend the conference. We will be able to serve a hot lunch and provide tea and coffee during breaks. Funds allocated to promotion will go towards the cost of advertisement and the printing costs of literature on the day.

If we go beyond our target any additional funds will go towards the travel expenses of some of our speakers, enabling us to attract important voices that might not otherwise be able to contribute, as well as arranging transport for Afghan community members. We would also look to secure journalists and well-known commentators to chair our panels, as well as a camera team to film the conference so that we can upload a video to be viewed in Afghanistan and around the world. Every extra pound we raise will make this event better and make a real contribution towards the empowerment of the Afghan people.

WHO ARE WE?

Founded in 2003 by Dr Nooralhaq Nasimi, himself an Afghan refugee, the Afghanistan and Central Asian Association (ACAA) works to support refugees and migrants from Afghanistan and neighbouring countries and help them reach their potential. It raises awareness of issues refugees face in the UK and supports community integration and cohesion. As well as providing advocacy, our services include a supplementary school, ESOL classes, citizenship classes, employment workshops, a women’s support group, youth and family services, drop-in and telephone advice, volunteer placements and cultural events. We also visit individuals and families in detention and have recently started working with the Home Office/Metropolitan Police PREVENT programme to stop the radicalization of young people.

In 2011, we launched the European Campaign for Human Rights in Afghanistan, working to assist the victims of human rights abuse, advance education and unite the Afghan diaspora across Europe in the promotion of human rights and democracy. The campaign has 200 individual members and 5 affiliated refugee groups. In summer 2013, we secured funding from the UK Department for International Development (DFID) to open citizens’ advice centres in Kabul and Pul-e Khumri, bringing our services directly to Afghanistan. The centres opened in August.

WHO WILL THE PROJECT HELP?

-  The Afghan diaspora living in the UK and Europe. The event will give them a chance to put their questions to our guests, including important politicians from Kabul. As well as giving them a stake in the future of their country, it will facilitate the growth of a diaspora network through which we can promote democratic values and human rights.

-  Students in the UK, especially those at Goldsmiths. We will encourage students to attend and interact with the Afghan community, giving them the opportunity to learn about Afghanistan, where UK troops have been engaged for the last 12 years, but about which little is known in the West. Students will see first-hand how charities and NGOs work to support post-conflict societies, and will have a chance to meet several high-profile political, academic, humanitarian and media representatives.

-  The wider community, especially in South-East London. By involving people from across the community, the conference will promote understanding, integration and respect for diversity and pluralism, helping migrants and refugees communities integrate.

-  The Afghanistan and Central Asian Association. Your donations will make a vital contribution towards the success of the event, raising the profile of our organisation and enabling us to better represent Afghans and people from Central Asia.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

-  Please tell your family and friends about our event and our crowdfunding campaign. Help spread the word, raise as much money as possible, and put on the best event we can.

-  Please “like” our Facebook pages: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Afghanistan-Central-Asian-Association/143499609037596https://www.facebook.com/pages/European-Campaign-for-Human-Rights-in-Afghanistan/149458751821047

-  Follow us on Twitter @ECHRA1

-  If you are interested in volunteering for the ACAA, you can contact us at info@afghanistan-central-asian.org.uk

FUTHER INFORMATION

You can visit our websites for more information about the organisation and what we do:

Afghanistan and Central Asian Association:

www.afghanistan-central-asian.org.uk

European Campaign for Human Rights in Afghanistan:

www.echra.moonfruit.com

Campaign for Human Rights in Afghanistan, working to assist the victims of
human rights abuse, advance education and unite the Afghan diaspora across
Europe in the promotion of human rights and democracy. The campaign has 200
individual members and 5 affiliated refugee groups. In summer 2013, we secured
funding from the UK Department for International Development (DFID) to open
citizens’ advice centres in Kabul and Pul-e Khumri, bringing our services
directly to Afghanistan. The centres opened in August.
WHO WILL THE
PROJECT HELP?
- 
The
Afghan diaspora living in the UK and Europe. The event will give them a chance
to put their questions to our guests, including important politicians from
Kabul. As well as giving them a stake in the future of their country, it will
facilitate the growth of a diaspora network through which we can promote
democratic values and human rights.
- 
Students
in the UK, especially those at Goldsmiths. We will encourage students to attend
and interact with the Afghan community, giving them the opportunity to learn
about Afghanistan, where UK troops have been engaged for the last 12 years, but
about which little is known in the West. Students will see first-hand how
charities and NGOs work to support post-conflict societies, and will have a
chance to meet several high-profile political, academic, humanitarian and media
representatives.
- 
The
wider community, especially in South-East London. By involving people from
across the community, the conference will promote understanding, integration
and respect for diversity and pluralism, helping migrants and refugees
communities integrate. 
- 
The
Afghanistan and Central Asian Association. Your donations will make a vital
contribution towards the success of the event, raising the profile of our organisation
and enabling us to better represent Afghans and people from Central Asia.
OTHER WAYS YOU
CAN HELP
- 
Please
tell your family and friends about our event and our crowdfunding campaign.
Help spread the word, raise as much money as possible, and put on the best
event we can.

- 
Follow
us on Twitter @ECHRA1
- 
If
you are interested in volunteering for the ACAA, you can contact us at info@afghanistan-central-asian.org.uk
FUTHER
INFORMATION
You can visit our websites for more
information about the organisation and what we do:
Afghanistan and Central Asian
Association:
www.afghanistan-central-asian.org.uk
European Campaign for Human Rights
in Afghanistan:

story:
Quick introduction

Explore the mysterious lands of post-apocalyptic Japan with a cute girl by your side in this immersive romantic light novel.

Inspired by Japanese character-based visual novels it uses of some of their writing techniques to reinforce the bonds between you as the protagonist and the characters of the story.

Continue reading to find out more about the author, the story and the writing style.

Or you can just check the writing samples:

Prologue (3 pages) - View PDF in browser | Download PDF
Chapter 1 pt.2 (10 pages) - View PDF in browser | Download PDF


About the idea

In the English visual novel community (message boards such as Fuwanovel forums and few other smaller communities) I am mostly known for my long posts full of both passion and philosophy, touching all sorts of topics. From discussions about the meaning of love and friendship through debates about law and the world order to abstract talks about perception of reality and its impact on our mind.

And that is where this project idea originated. I am often labeled as delusional, thinking that the 2-dimensional* world is reality, spreading love towards characters from games, anime and manga and spending lot of time with said characters in my daydreams and fantasies. This strong imagination is however often praised and I have been told many times that people would love to read more of the stories happening in my mind. And so I would like to fulfill my dream and make writing my profession to share my fantasy worlds with others and to improve creating and describing them.

*2d vs 3d: in manga slang these terms are used to distinguish the anime/manga world (2d) and the real world (3d).


The story

These are the genres you can expect to be touched in the story:

Romance, Post-Apocalyptic World, Mystery, Fantasy, Drama, Science Fiction, Alternative Dimensions, Dreams

Premise of the story:

Hundreds of years after a nuclear apocalypse, the few survivors living in underground bunkers were able to continue the human legacy. Nobody was however able to rebuild what was once destroyed - that being hope for peace, technological progress and other great deeds that people before the war were striving to achieve.

Yukirou used to live in one of these bunkers. But just like people fought during the war, people these days still fight the same way. And even though the ideals they are fighting for might have changed over the centuries, the main reasons for fighting remain the same - greed, lust for power, desire to control others.
And so during his childhood, after a riot caused a series of malfunctions resulting in a full lockdown and large fire spreading throughout the bunker, he was forced to escape using a secret shaft only a young and agile boy like him could fit through, leaving behind everyone he knew and loved.

Thrown into the outside world full of dangerous animals and people (often times very hard to distinguish the two apart), he soon met a mysterious girl. Introducing herself as Chiiko, she started addressing Yukirou as onii-chan*, despite this being the first time he met her. To Yukirou she almost seemed like a gift from gods to guide him through the hell he must explore.

And so he ventured towards the future, towards all the mysteries of this land that he is slowly discovering to be very different from what he was taught. Perhaps the world is not what it seems to be. Hopefully Chiiko will have the answers for him when the time to ask the questions comes.

*onii-chan is a Japanese term younger sisters use to call their older brothers, honorific -chan often signifies close relationship.


Format and style

Light novels are Japanese style of novel associated with the anime and manga culture, often receiving adaptations in those media. The characters in them are described (and often illustrated) in the 2d manga style with the romantic novels including cute girls with whom the readers often fall in love (this can be described using a Japanese term "moe").

Visual novels (English term) are in Japan known mostly as "eroge" (erotic game) or just game (for non-erotic ones) and are a style of often interactive novels with visual representation of the characters on the screen. Most of the time focused on romance between the protagonist and the heroines in the story, they use very immersive first person style to make the reader feel like they are experiencing these stories themselves, together with the cute girls.

As a result, the mixture of these 2 kinds of media I plan to put in use will be mainly focused on the immersion aspect. The story will be told in first person present tense to let the reader become the protagonist himself and experience the events the moment they happen, instead of being told a story after it has concluded like in regular novels. The main focus will therefore be on the dialogues between the characters, internal monologue of the protagonist, his thoughts and description of the world and events from his point of view. Action scenes and fighting scenes will be very rare, if there is any fight to be had, it will be a mental fight with an inner self, a fight to overcome the obstacles the world puts between Yukirou and his goal, a fight to not give up.

There will be no erotic content in this book as I am not yet fully familiar with publishing of such works and I want to reach to as wide audience as possible, including younger students seeking romantic stories with lots of deep thoughts.

The level of English I plan to use should be fairly easy to read for everyone who is used to reading visual novel or light novel translations. The vocabulary used will be mostly simple so even not native English readers can enjoy it.
The philosophical ideas behind the world are going to be the main focus of the writing.
Instead of pondering about the meaning of a confusing word, you will be pondering about the meaning of a confusing world.


Sample

To have a pretty good idea how my style of writing looks like, you can check the prologue and second part of chapter 1. It is still work in progress and some things might change for the final release.

Prologue (3 pages) - View PDF in browser | Download PDF
Chapter 1 pt.2 (10 pages) - View PDF in browser | Download PDF


What I need and where does it go

I've been working on the story and main plot points of the book for about a year but in the past months I was not able to focus on it as I would like.

So what I need is several months when I can just sit down and focus only on the writing full time, undisturbed by the 3d world.


The funds will go towards the following:

  • Very basic living expenses
  • Fees related to the funding - that includes indiegogo fees and Paypal transfer fees
  • Fees related to the online publishing of the title


Future of the series

The story doesn't end here! I actually have a pretty good idea about where I would like the series to be going if it ends up being a success. There is much more in the world than I will be able to fit in this one light novel and if people like the result, I will definitely write more.
I am after all trying to make writing these fantasies my profession.

The ultimate goal would be adapting the light novel into a full length visual novel with emotional soundtrack and beautiful art, but such dream is still far in the future.
A future which this project will allow me to get that much closer to.


Other ways you can help

Even if you are unable to contribute to this project, you can still help!

If you like the idea, talk to your friends who might be interested, discuss it in your anime (manga/visualnovel/lightnovel) groups and forums. Spreading the word can help more than you might think.

story:
Our Story

As the US plans to end combat in Afghanistan in 2013-2014, the Central Asia/South Asia region is under great stress and facing severe challenges from authoritarian regimes causing human rights, social, and environmental problems. Yet little is known about these regions outside the specialists in governments, foundations, and establishment foreign policy circles. Russia, the US and China are all competing for influence and extraction of resources in this region. I want to promote an alternative public-funded approach to news on international and regional affairs via social media.and network with other like-minded journalists and civil society advocates.


Different Stans is a project to use social media (blog, Twitter, Facebook, etc.) and several curated news streams on Scoop.it to translate, digest, and discuss the news and views of the Central/South Asia region during 2012-2014, as the US plans to end combat and withdraw troops. This is a critical period for the people of Afghanistan and their neighbours who already experience an Afghan war spillover effect.Often Russia is covered in isolation from its neighbours; or only the post-Soviet "stans" are covered without reference to Pakistan and India. I think it's important to follow trends throughout all these areas without isolating them or narrowing the focus to specifically military issues.


Image credit:  Political cartoon depicting the Afghan Emir Sher Ali with his "friends" the Russian Bear and British Lion (1878)

Painting:  Thomas Edward Gordon, Lake Victoria, Great Pamir, May 2, 1874


The Impact

The goal is not only a more informed public, but more participation from interested people in foreign policy, and formation of connections to people in the region to hear their stories and learn their issues. The US has a military delivery route called the Northern Distribution Network throughout the region which it envisions converting into a New Silk Road for prosperity. Is the US military presence unwelcome? Is the business only with state-own corporations mired in corruption? What is the impact on the environment of roads and pipelines? Who gets a say in decision-making about the scarce water and energy resources in the region?  People need to ask these questions because their tax dollars pay for it.


What We Need & What You Get

I have been writing and translating stories from this region for 30 year. I would like to cover the region independently, and find several collegial fellow writers and photographers to cover this region with me.  I am committed to continuing to blog frequently on a volunteer basis while I make a living translating and consulting. But I am setting a fund-raising goal of $5000 for the next three months to be able to devote more time to this project and also pay some honoraria to reporters and photographers in the region. Suggestions of contacts and input are welcome.


Other Ways You Can Help

By publicizing this project, I'm hoping to find other writers who would like to help cover this region during this critical period, first on a volunteer basis and then hopefully to cover some costs. I would welcome comments and requests and critiques from people using a pseudonym if need be.

story:
Story of My Book

Sweat the Small Stuff!

My name is Ram Lokan and I am the author of Sweat the Small Stuff! a book that will give you a different perspective on how to be successful in business. To be ambitious does not mean to only focus on the big things; instead you can grow your business by focusing on the details, and understanding the granular actions that make your business move. 

Sweat the Small Stuff! explores the intersections of business, ambition, and leadership. I want the reader to come with me on a journey that took me from acquiring a business, growing it, and eventually selling it, and understand that what made my business successful was sweating the small stuff: understanding the small day to day issues that when solved, unleashed growth and motivated the entire team.

This is a story about how planning lunch every day for staff from 5 different cultures teaches you about team building; how handling a customer complaint on the price of corn flakes teaches you about the logistics of a supply chain spanning 9 countries; how promoting a cashier earns the trust of the entire company; and what showing up at the bakery at 5 a.m. to make bread teaches you about leadership. Sweating this small stuff made me a better manager and ultimately led to the growth of my business.

I wrote this book because I wanted to show a different perspective on ambition and becoming successful in business. Whether you are an ambitious college graduate thinking about your first job or an experienced professional wondering about your next move, I am hoping this book will give you a different perspective on what it takes to be successful in business. Future entrepreneurs, disruptors, innovators, will glean from this book the journey that lies ahead and how they can be more successful in growing their business by sweating the small stuff.

Ultimately, I hope that Sweat the Small Stuff! inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, and makes people realize that ambition does not always mean doing something big. It can start by doing the small things. They might or might not be easy to fix, but those always lead to a very meaningful impact. So, sweat the small stuff!

 

The book - Sweat the Small Stuff!

The book is written in 4 parts. 


Part 1 contains the introduction + Chapters 1-5. Here, I explain how and why I ended up in Tanzania owning a supermarket and the early challenges of acquiring and running this business.

Part 2 contains Chapters 6-10. This is where I learn more and more about the business and the people involved in running it. At this stage in the journey, I also apply management lessons on operations and leadership to learn the business. 

Part 3 contains Chapters 11-15 where I explore how I used the lessons from Part 2 to grow the business, including expansion in a new country.

Finally, Part 4 contains Chapters 16-20 where I talk about some of the psychological costs of entrepreneurship and how I made the decision to sell the business. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook formats)
  • Copyediting - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • Launch & Promotion efforts - when I ultimately publish this December

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish an eBook and paperback edition. When I pre-sell 150 copies, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements section (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book

 

About the Author

Ram Lokan is currently a Principal at Kasada Capital Management, a hospitality-focused private equity firm investing in Sub-Saharan Africa.

He is passionate about operating and investing in businesses in South Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa where he has spent the last ten years with a heavy bias towards real assets. He believes strongly that to be successful in these markets, you need an active investor/operator mindset and the willingness to be on the ground talking to people and understand the details.

When he's not pestering his local barista with supply chain questions, you can find him reading business and military history books, or discovering new beaches along the Indian Ocean with his wife.

For more information you can connect with Ram at ram.lokan@gmail.com and on LinkedIn.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier (for North America and South Africa). 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are additional ways you can help, besides contributing. I’d appreciate your support in the following manner:

  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #SweatTheSmallStuff and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. You can do this as a text message or direct message on social media

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Ram

story:
Hi, I'm MaNishtana.

For over a decade I've done work focused on racial and religious identity, least of which including the insistence that Jews are a multiethnic, multiracial people who can be found across the globe. And now I'm aiming to produce a traditional Torah commentary that feels just as diverse. One that is firmly traditional/Orthodox, but with a modern and non-myopic lens on race and gender. One which engages with our texts with a viewpoint beyond the standard right-wing and/or Ashkenormative frame that dominates most other Orthodox Jewish commentary.

Of course, that's not to say that it will be left-leaning just to be left, either.

There's no "liberal agenda" here, and the discussions on socially sensitive topics will be frank and presenting what the traditional view or rulings are, yet thoughtfully approached in a [hopefully] non-condescending/patronizing manner.

It's not meant to be some enchiridion of heretofore unheard of gems of inspiration, but a compilation of the usual sources and interpretations, yet with a particular focus on those that have been maybe forgotten, and perhaps some sparks of my own occasionally.

My publishing goal is Chanukah 5781/2021. Feel free to shoot at me on Twitter (@MaNishtana) if you have questions or want more deets!

story:
American Sulla - A Time of Trial is the story of how an act of state-sponsored nuclear terrorism forces President William Orwell Steele to become the military dictator of the United States of America. How he copes with the aftermath of the greatest civil disaster the U.S. has ever experienced will change the destiny of a great nation, the fate of the world, and the lives of countless individuals.

I've been working on American Sulla since late Winter. I'm currently more than 60,000 words into the tale, and going strong. At this rate, I should finish the book by late December or early January - but I need your help. My savings are nearly exhausted, and my income doesn't cover my monthly expenses. So I'm asking for a month's rent to help stretch my resources.


You can read a 38,000-word excerpt called American Sulla - A Time of Crisis at the book's home page. If you like it, please consider investing in the project - and please pass copies of American Sulla - A Time of Crisis to any of your friends and family whom you think might be interested.

Spread the word!

story:
About "Those Meyerson Women"

“Actually, it was the obituary that started all of this”.  From the first line you are pulled into this story as it comes to life around you. Set in the Chapman Town area of Chico, California. The quiet of the rural area is disrupted when local resident artist Rebecca Sloan reads an obituary in the local newspaper. A local store owner, Harry Meyerson, has lost another wife and Rebecca starts to question the deaths of his other wives.  Her investigations reveal that she is not the only one that is suspicious of Harry Meyerson and things really heat up when she gets the local district attorney involved.

 

About Sandra Luce and Linda Sue

Imagine, if you will, you have a favorite Aunt, she is an artist, a gardener, decorates her house beautifully, always dresses impeccably.  That was my Aunt Sandy. Then, you learn she is writing a book, you’re not surprised, she is extremely creative.  You know she finished it and you’re excited to read her creation but she falls ill and is unable to get her book published before she leaves us.  Life gets in the way, as it tends to do, years go by and her manuscript sits in a box (or in this case it was a basket).

 

That’s where I come in, I’m Linda Sue. I asked my cousin Lisa (Sandra’s daughter) about the book and she loaned me the basket with the manuscript to see if I could do something with it. So, I have her original typewritten manuscript (yes, it was before computers) and have been madly entering it into my computer so that it can be published. I am almost finished and need help to take it to the next step.   As for my creative side, I have been designing and creating handmade greeting cards for several years, have done wedding invitations, birthday party invites, etc which is why I choose to use them as part of the perk package for the fundraising effort.

 

That’s where you come in, I need your help in getting the book published. I am offering some perks in return for your support! Please review them and purchase the pre-order package that makes sense for you. If all the funding is received the book should be done just after the 1st of next year. A portion of book profits will be donated to a literacy program to support adult and child literacy and encourage reading.

What I Need

This book is coming together. There are a few more things like editing, cover design and printing that need to happen. I am reaching out to you to believe in this book and pre-order it! When you pre-order it today, you’ll get your copy before ANYONE else plus any other bonuses you pick up.

 

What else can you do?

Help me spread the word, “like” the “Those Meyerson Women” page on Facebook, ask your friends and family to do the same and let them know about the fundraising efforts underway on Indiegogo.com.  If you have followers on Pinterest or Twitter let them know too. You are welcome to use the Indiegogo share tools! Thanks so much for your support!

IF GOAL IS NOT REACHED: If the funding falls short, It will take longer but I will struggle as best I can to try to complete the publication of the book on my own.  It means a lot to me and to Aunt Sandy’s family to complete the project.

IF FUNDING EXCEEDS GOAL- If funding exceeds initial goal, it will help fund additional printings and marketing and the search for a publisher.

story:
Why We Exist

This magazine is a brainchild from my graduate school class. I wanted to do a project that was informative and fun. It reaches to the depth of who I am and where I have come from.  Society put me in a place where I didn't know what to do with the limited amount of information I had access to. I filled in the gaps. 

I met lots of other women who did the same. It would have been great if while I was encountering these problems someone gave me helpful information.  That is what this magazine is designed to do.  Different women will share their experiences of filling in their gaps across different issues like healthcare, parenting, relationships, finances, legal, and so on.

 

Help & How

We need funding and distribution.  We need funding to hire staff and pay contributors. Currently, we have solicited volunteers, but to maintain quality information we need to pay contributors.  We also need funding for printing and distribution. 

For supporting this campaign you will get:

For $25:      a copy of our debut issue

For $50:      Cover art

For $100:    Subscriber status with a T-shirt

For $250:    Sponsor status with an Advertising spot in the magazine

For $500:    Patron status with your name printed under Publisher Group

 

The Impact

This magazine is designed to be published four times a year. Each issue will stand on its own bringing helpful and encouraging information to its readers. It will have data that helps people become better people. It will have information that inspires and encourage those about to give up.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk of this magazine is that it will not get to its intended audience.  There is a chance that women will continue to struggle without the benefit of this magazine and the power it carries.  There is a chance that the information inside will be ignored. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help financially at this time, please share this campaign with your friends.

story:
Just before midnight on September 15, 1810, a priest by the name of Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla addressed his congregation from the steps of his church in the small town of Dolores, in the central Mexican region of Guanajuato. “Death to bad government!” Hidalgo cried, in what later became known as the Cry of Dolores and the Cry of Independence. The next morning, the priest’s revolutionary army marched on the region’s capital, marking the beginning of the Mexican War of Independence.

One hundred years later, Francisco I. Madero, an upper-class upstart from the northern state of Coahuila, declared that he would run against Mexico’s autocratic leader, Porfirio Díaz, in the country’s upcoming presidential election—to which Díaz’s characteristically autocratic response was to have Madero thrown in prison. Madero escaped and on October 5, 1910 issued the Plan de San Luis Potosí, which called on the citizens of Mexico to revolt. The first major revolution of a century that would sport plenty of them began on November 20, 1910. It, too, would last ten years.

Between September 15 and November 20, 2010—between independence and revolution, between two anniversaries—journalist Matthew Clayfield and photographer Austin Andrews will be travelling through Mexico and visiting a number of the towns and historic sites that played some role in these two conflicts. The War of Independence and the Revolution remain the two most important events in the history of modern Mexico. They also form a prism through which we might look at the country today.

For while Mexico is looking forward with understandable excitement to the one-two punch of bicentenary and centenary celebrations planned for later this year, the bloody events for which it currently finds itself in the headlines are not those of its past, but rather, worryingly, those of its present.

The work we hope to produce on this trip—a magazine feature article and an accompanying series of photographs, as well as a blog and, eventually, possibly even a book—will combine elements of travelogue, history and frontline reportage in order to do so.

Like Capa and Steinbeck’s A RUSSIAN JOURNAL, the work we propose to produce will provide a unique and nuanced look at a country that remains of such enduring interest to so many, and which this year more than any other—or at least, any other in the last hundred—has found itself caught so squarely and so inescapably in the spotlight.

story:
Important Note: The initial $4k raised will go straight toward publishing and editing costs, so my real goal is to go over this! If I raise $6k, I will consider releasing an audio-book.

 

Story of My Book

It's about impact-driven companies and how the space of impact, missions, and sustainability has been growing over the past 10 years and will continue to grow exponentially. The hope is that it will inform both people entering the workforce as well as existing industry leaders about the huge trend that will soon affect all businesses due to pressing issues that we can no longer avoid (i.e. the environmental crisis).

Exponential Benefit (working title) explores how the impact-driven space has evolved over the past decade or so. It predicts how this trend will continue to evolve.

The book discusses the ways in which sustainability and being driven by a mission will become relevant for all businesses. It also offers recommendations for what concrete changes companies can make in order to have more meaningful impacts on the world.

My name is Mariana Rodriguez and I am the author of Exponential Benefit. I wrote this book because as I considered options of companies to work for after graduating college, I sought out places where I could have a positive impact on the world through my work. Yet, I struggled to find a place where I could do so to the extent I wanted. I continue to seek where I would be most fulfilled, and through this book, am hoping to help others find their own interests within the space.

In reading this book, my hope is that you will discover why the recent growth in impact-driven companies is so relevant for new and older generations. I want you to learn why in a not-so-distant future every single company will have to consider this issue at some level.

Through it, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement in you that I have for making a change through work. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you distinguish truly impactful companies from ones that don’t result in much action when considering where to work, where to purchase from, and who to support. You will find that in this book as well as ideas for how to change companies themselves into powerful agents for change.

In this book, you'll learn about the most successful business models for impact-driven companies as well as why it's becoming necessary for a business to be both sustainable and socially conscious.

You'll learn...

  • How science proves that sustainability and a mission is good for business
  • How charity: water has become the most successful, and beautiful, non-profit organization
  • The most promising impact-spaces to work for, invest in, or buy from

 

You will love this book if

  • You are a millennial trying to navigate finding meaningful and financially secure work
  • You are into impact-driven / environmental / socially-conscious trends and want to learn more about them
  • You are a business-owner considering how your business will have to change in the next decade to accommodate public demands

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December of 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition! My ultimate goal is to pre-sell between 200-400, so your support is very much appreciated. If you are particularly interested in this topic or work with companies that are impact-driven, purchasing multiple copies for fellow employees or interested friends is even more of a help. It makes for a great Christmas gift!

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my paperback now:

  • You will receive a personally signed (and early) copy of the book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

The Book - Exponential Benefit

The book is written in 6 Parts...


Part 1 contains the introduction + two and a half additional chapters. Here, you will be introduced to what impact means, why it has historically been seen as separate from profit, and why they should really go hand in hand. You will hear stories about why money is, in fact, necessary for impact, and why impact should be a part of every business and industry.

Part 2 contains Chapters 3-7, which focus on the urgency of creating change, which issues are driving the most change, and how companies are leveraging that need with the need to be successful in business.

Part 3 contains Chapters 8-13 and discusses the problems with how some companies are balancing the two needs. Specifically, are some companies faking it? How can we create an impact that actually matters? What can we do differently?

Part 4 contains Chapters 13.5-16 and discusses what people are already doing well in order to balance profit and purpose, as well as some of the most promising emerging fields in this space. There is a chapter dedicated to environmental issues and how they're being targeted, which for me is probably the #1 crisis we are facing as humans.

Part 5 contains Chapters 17-21 and introduces an organization that goes above and beyond with what they have been able to achieve and continue to achieve, in addition to going into depth about why and how it's able to do this.

You will learn how to recognize and seek out these organizations so that you will truly feel motivated by your work. You will also hopefully be convinced that every single business in the future will have to, in some shape or form, integrate sustainability into their business model.

Part 6 contains Chapters 21.5-24. It offers conclusions on the topic, reflections on what has been learned, and recommendations for going forward. This is a call to action and a call for consciousness about the issues that all of us are facing.

 

About the Author

Mariana Rodriguez currently works on Business Operations at Commonwealth Fusion Systems, a start-up company partnering with MIT researching and developing clean fusion energy for the world. She is also a recent Tufts University graduate of Psychology with a background in Management studies.

With graduation approaching, Mariana wanted to find a place she could work and be challenged professionally, but also somewhere she could make an impact on the world. Finding good information about this to be lacking, she embarked on her own search, interviewing dozens of people about the topic. This book is a collection of experiences, stories, and her own opinions about how the impact-driven trend has evolved and how it will continue to evolve.

Mariana’s first love (and still a current love) are books and writing. She also enjoys singing, painting, photography, and scuba diving with bull sharks (and all other animals, but her favorite are bull sharks). Her bucket list of places to visit is based on where the best diving sites are. She can permanently be seen with at least four bruises on both legs as she is one of the clumsiest people you will meet.

For more information you can connect with Mariana at mariana.rodriguezal@gmail.com and 917-972-3259.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #ExponentialBenefit and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Mariana Rodriguez

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December of 2019
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

 
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition! My ultimate goal is to pre-sell between 200-400, so your support is very much appreciated. If you are particularly interested in this topic or work with companies that are impact-driven, purchasing multiple copies for fellow employees or interested friends is even more of a help. It makes for a great Christmas gift!I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my paperback now:

You will receive a personally signed (and early) copy of the book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
And more...

 
The Book - Exponential Benefit
The book is written in 6 Parts...
Part 1 contains the introduction + two and a half additional chapters. Here, you will be introduced to what impact means, why it has historically been seen as separate from profit, and why they should really go hand in hand. You will hear stories about why money is, in fact, necessary for impact, and why impact should be a part of every business and industry.Part 2 contains Chapters 3-7, which focus on the urgency of creating change, which issues are driving the most change, and how companies are leveraging that need with the need to be successful in business.Part 3 contains Chapters 8-13 and discusses the problems with how some companies are balancing the two needs. Specifically, are some companies faking it? How can we create an impact that actually matters? What can we do differently?Part 4 contains Chapters 13.5-16 and discusses what people are already doing well in order to balance profit and purpose, as well as some of the most promising emerging fields in this space. There is a chapter dedicated to environmental issues and how they're being targeted, which for me is probably the #1 crisis we are facing as humans.Part 5 contains Chapters 17-21 and introduces an organization that goes above and beyond with what they have been able to achieve and continue to achieve, in addition to going into depth about why and how it's able to do this.You will learn how to recognize and seek out these organizations so that you will truly feel motivated by your work. You will also hopefully be convinced that every single business in the future will have to, in some shape or form, integrate sustainability into their business model.Part 6 contains Chapters 21.5-24. It offers conclusions on the topic, reflections on what has been learned, and recommendations for going forward. This is a call to action and a call for consciousness about the issues that all of us are facing.
 
About the Author
Mariana Rodriguez currently works on Business Operations at Commonwealth Fusion Systems, a start-up company partnering with MIT researching and developing clean fusion energy for the world. She is also a recent Tufts University graduate of Psychology with a background in Management studies.With graduation approaching, Mariana wanted to find a place she could work and be challenged professionally, but also somewhere she could make an impact on the world. Finding good information about this to be lacking, she embarked on her own search, interviewing dozens of people about the topic. This book is a collection of experiences, stories, and her own opinions about how the impact-driven trend has evolved and how it will continue to evolve.Mariana’s first love (and still a current love) are books and writing. She also enjoys singing, painting, photography, and scuba diving with bull sharks (and all other animals, but her favorite are bull sharks). Her bucket list of places to visit is based on where the best diving sites are. She can permanently be seen with at least four bruises on both legs as she is one of the clumsiest people you will meet.For more information you can connect with Mariana at mariana.rodriguezal@gmail.com and 917-972-3259.
 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 
Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #ExponentialBenefit and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 
Thank you so much of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Mariana Rodriguez

story:
Mi nombre es Carlos Eduardo Indriago, y junto a un equipo conformado por Edith Velásquez, Lidia Caldeira, Angelys Márquez, Kley Salinas y Adriana Rosas, tomamos la iniciativa de crear esta campaña en pro de todos aquellos estudiantes desamparados y abandonados por el Gobierno de Venezuela en Irlanda. Somos venezolanos, mayores de edad y profesionales que aún viajando al exterior a invertir en nuestra educación fuimos dejados al olvido por el gobierno venezolano al negarnos el cambio de nuestro dinero en moneda local a las divisas solicitadas, en este caso, euros para pagar nuestros estudios y poder subsistir en este nuevo país.

Venezuela desde el año 2002 creó un sistema de control cambiario, que mediante un proceso burocrático nos limita a solo cambiar nuestro dinero en Bolívares (Moneda local de Venezuela) un cupo limitado de divisas al año tanto para estudios, viajes de turismo y compras electrónicas. Este control cambiario impide que podamos cambiar con libertad nuestra moneda a otras divisas, o recibir en el extranjero dinero de nuestras familias, etc, imposibilitando la manera de subsistir. La situación actual en Venezuela, que es bastante crítica hace imposible para muchos que deseen regresar por miedo a vivir sin libertad y a regresar con la moral y autoestima destruida por no haber logrado los sueños y metas con las que vinieron a Irlanda.

Desde hace unos 3 meses a la actualidad, las solicitudes de divisas al Gobierno de Venezuela han sido totalmente fallidas, tanto para aquellos estudiantes que se encuentran en proceso de estudiar en el exterior como para aquellos que ya nos encontramos en el país de destino, en este caso Irlanda. Trayendo esto como consecuencia que por la negativa del Gobierno Venezolano a liberar las divisas necesarias para el pago de matriculas de estudio, alimentación y alojamiento, los estudiantes venezolanos en Irlanda, estén pasando necesidades, encontrándose actualmente en situaciones críticas de alimentación y hospedaje. Muchos en situación de calle y otros sin tener la posibilidad de comer, y otros pasando a convertirse en ilegales por no poder pagar la visa de estudios.

EL GOBIERNO DE VENEZUELA NOS ABANDON[O, NOS DEJ[O TIRADOS EN EL EXTRANJERO SIN NUESTRO DINERO, SIN POSIBILIDAD DE REGRESO, SIN POSIBILIDAD DE TENER DONDE VIVIR O QUE COMER.

Buscando una solución de ayuda humanitaria, tenemos como propósito fundamental rentar una casa grande de 6 habitaciones en la ciudad de Dublin, y en esta casa alojar temporalmente a todos aquellos estudiantes en situación crítica, y así poder darles un apoyo y un gran impulso para que puedan salir adelante, conseguir un empleo digno e independizarse, y así al este lograr tal independencia, darle oportunidad a otro Venezolano de ser alojado y apoyado de la misma manera. No con dinero sino con comida y hospedaje para que no se encuentre en las calles y dejando de comer, sino al contrario darles algo de calidad de vida y confianza en si mismos para que logren tomar fuerzas y lograr sus objetivos. Todo esto con el fin de que no regresen a Venezuela sin cumplir lo que con tantos años de sacrificio y ahorro económico hicieron para estar en este momento en Dublin, Irlanda.

La casa que hemos encontrado en la pagina web inmobiliaria por excelencia en Irlanda, www.daft.ie, está valorada en 1.800 euros mensuales más servicios. Por lo tanto la meta a alcanzar es de 25.000 euros, para alquilar tal propiedad por 12 meses, logrando con esto ganar algo de tiempo para que todos puedan solventar sus situaciones criticas económicas y tener un espacio para el encuentro de Venezolanos en este país.

La opción que más se adapta a las necesidades es esta casa, la cual pueden encontrar en este link:

http://www.daft.ie/lettings/coolgreena-road-bea...

La recompensa que podemos ofrecer a todos aquellos que de alguna u otra manera esto les llegue al corazón, es de que, en el momento que todos aquellos Venezolanos hayan sido apoyados por esta casa comunitaria que bautizaremos como la CASA DEL VENEZOLANO EN IRLANDA, serán bienvenidos todos aquellos amigos, hermanos, compañeros de todas las nacionalidades del mundo que necesiten apoyo, asesoría e impulso para salir adelante en este país sin distingo de raza, religión, sexo o preferencia política. Estaremos para hacer el bien sin mirar a quien, esa será nuestra misión principal. Si de alguna manera no logramos reunir los fondos totales, seguiremos en la lucha por lograrlos, con otra campaña, o haciendo cualquier otra actividad en pro de ayudar a quien lo necesite con recolección de alimentos, medicinas, ropa para el frio, entre otras, como ya hemos venido haciendo hasta este momento.

Si por alguna razón no puedes ayudar de manera económica, por favor difunde esta campaña, este es un problema que se agrava con el pasar de los días, y deseamos de corazón lograr nuestra meta en los próximos 15 dias. Comparte, difunde donde aparecen los botones de facebook o twitter. Ayúdanos a llegar con esta campaña a todos los rincones del mundo donde este mensaje sea entendido.

story:
Howdy!

My name's Ron, and I'm the author of Young Adult Paranormal Romance Silent Song. Its follow-up, Shattered Silence, is about ready to come out with the conclussion to the series and I'd like you to be part of this great project!

But... is this really going to happen?

Oh, yeah! The book is written. It has already undergone several revisions and I've booked a date with my Super Editor. The cover art is ready to go as well!

So, why do you need the money?

Well, several reasons... One of them is that this allows you to be part of the project from the get go, and it allows me to be in contact with you (which is something I love!). In doing so, we get to share some really cool perks--the icing on the cake!

Another big reason is, simply put, that getting a book out there is expensive. Getting it the attention it deserves and the PR to go with it is even more so.

$500. Isn't that a convenient sum?

Well... yes, I suppose it is! It probably looks weird because it's not the full cost of production, though. Instead of asking you to fund the whole thing, I decided to ask you to help me with the basic costs. At the moment, the project's expenses would look like this:

  • 350$ towards third-party, professional editing and proofreading.
  • 150$ towards cover art and promo items.

If we managed to raise more money, it'd go towards marketing and promotion. Which brings us to the real reason I chose that amount:

By asking for part of the costs, we can keep the sum small enough that there's hope of... stretch goals! With added perks. My favorite part!

Less talk, more fact: what do we get?

I've put together a list of perks for your contributions--the descriptions are in the sidebar, and in the project gallery you can find images of some products, like the bookmarks or the guitar picks.

However, imagine you want something not listed. Or a perk combination I didn't think of. Never worry! Let me know what you have in mind and we'll see if we can't work something out.

Nice, but I can't invest in you right now...

Ohhh, that hurts!

No, no, just kidding. I understand! But even if you can't claim a perk, you can still do something for this project: Tweet about it, tell your friends in Facebook, leave me a comment here to give me moral support...

Every little detail is appreciated!

We have read this whole thing... some last words to add?

Yep! If you've read all the info, that means you're serious about supporting me so you probably want to know that I'll be updating the project's media. With videos (even showing my face, yes) and such to let you know how we go.

So, stay tuned!

story:
The Book

My new book is called Mr. Bad Example.

"A drunken love story, full of sex, drugs, rock n roll, and other family values."

Harlow Kingston is the wine loving social misfit who fell in love with the girl next door. He tried to be the man she wanted, but he fell for (and into bed with) many women along the way. He does his best to ignore his short comings by staying drunk, but it doesn't take long before his bad choices start catching up to him. He becomes a magnet for pointless sex, crazy people, and death.


Harlow drinks his way into the hearts of three women he can't get enough of. One wants to help him be happy. One wants him all the time and doesn't care about anything else. The third wants him to grow up, stop drinking his life away, and do something with himself. Then there are the other ladies he has gotten carnal with.

He finds himself in a series of alcohol fueled bad situations before he's forced to make a choice. He has to stop his foolish, fleshy ways and settle on one of the amazing women in his life. A good woman won't wait around forever, but even if he makes the wrong decision, it changes everything. Someone has to get hurt.

Sometimes you love someone so much, all you can do is #@$% it up.

 

Short Summary

Crowd funding has been very successful for bands, indie filmmakers, and many other creative projects. There isn't any reason fans can't support a book related venture in the same way and collect some super swell perks too!

This fundraiser is not designed to cover printing cost. Those costs and other fees are covered by the publisher. This is just a campaign to get the books to the readers and meet the people who buy them. The publisher doesn't cover those costs.

The money raised will go towards a U.S. book tour. It will go into travel expenses and advertising.

"I want to be able to tour with my next book. I want to meet the readers and talk about my work. More authors need to connect with their readers."

- J. Travis Grundon


Who the $#@!* is J. Travis Grundon?

J. Travis Grundon is an author and a screenwriter with a focus on transgressive, speculative and general fiction. He has served as an editor and contributor on Forrest J Ackerman's Anthology of the Living Dead and Fracas: A Collection of Short Friction. His books Eclectic Collection and Happy Hour Blues illustrate his love and craft of short stories.

His other work can be found in the Silven Trumpeter, the Tecumseh Review, Scars, Paracinema, Twisted Dreams, and The Monsters Next Door magazine. Other works include stories for Help - An Anthology To Benefit Preditors and Editors, Concrete Blood: Dark Tales of the City, and Toe Tags 2.

 

What We Need & What You Get

$2,350 is not a lot of money to spend on a book tour. It will not cover all of the costs, but it will help. It's the only way to make it possible.

All money raised will go into bringing this book to the readers. The way to do that is to take the book on tour. We need to hit every book store that welcomes indie authors. We will put all of the money we raise towards book signing/ reading events, travel cost, and aditional marketing.

$1 - Special thanks on my Twitter and Facebook.

 

$5 - Special thanks and a limited edition bookmark/ sticker. 

$15 - Social media thanks, sticker and a personalized signed copy of the new book, Mr. Bad Example! 

$25 - All of the above and a personalized signed copy of Happy Hour Blues

$35 - All of the above and a signed copy of Eclectic Collection

 

$40 - Social media thanks, sticker, signed copy of the new book and a very rare J. Travis Grundon T-Shirt!

 

$45 - Social media thanks, sticker, signed copy of the new book and 2 to 3 hand written pages from the original manuscript of the new book.

$50 - Social media thanks, sticker, signed copy of the new book and an extra special thank you ...your name in the acknowledgments of the book. 

$75 - Social media thanks, sticker, signed copy of the new book and a special thanks in the acknowledgments of the book AND you could be a character in a future story or book!

$100 - Social media thanks, sticker, signed copy of the new book and a special thank you in the acknowledgments of the book AND you could be a character in a future story or book AND you will get signed copies of all of my future published work my published work, as it's published. You will have a subscription to my books.

$200 - You will get your pick of anything above AND a high five AND I will do a reading/ signing at your house, local book store, bar or other venue. 

 

$500 or more is just crazy, but if you want to be that crazy - I will try to come to your house and cook for you!  You can also get your pick of anything above AND I might even sleep on your couch! 

 

Links to other books by J. Travis Grundon

Eclectic Collection 

&

Happy Hour Blues 

 

Praise for J. Travis Grundon


"J. Travis Grundon is a passionate, modern storyteller. His dystopian tales are the stuff of delightful nightmares."  - Author Joe Schwartz, Games Men Play

"J. Travis Grundon’s stories contain a dark realism that makes the characters seem like your neighbors as you watch the story unfold through your side window. He is a real talent to the literary world. " - 
Director DP Bonnell, Happy Hooker Bang Bang 

 
"J. Travis Grundon's writing is quite strong as I had no trouble visiting these stories in my mind...I just didn't like being there much after I got there. That IS a compliment." - Director John Taylor, LEACH

"J. Travis Grundon is a visionary. You better watch out!" - Nicholas Grabowsky, Red Wet Dirt/ Black Bed Sheet Books 

"J. Travis Grundon 's stories are as familiar as sitting down to afternoon tea, but his ideas are as exotic and intoxicating as a good stiff shot added to the mix." - Author B.C. Brown, A Touch of Darkness

“J. Travis Grundon’s work has a unique voice in a world of similar voices, something that writers twice his age don’t have. His work, whether they’re straight-out horror, noir mashups or just plain weird, tells stories that strike nerves and stay in the memory long after you’re finished.” –Author John F.D.Taff, Little Deaths

"J. Travis Grundon is an extremely diverse author, who draws you in with his definitive characters and the vivid stories they tell." - Kitsie Duncan, Model/Actress 

"J. Travis Grundon is more than a writer; he's an unstoppable force." -Author  L.B. Goddard, The Monsters Next Door 

“J. Travis Grundon is a true talent that makes turning the page the incredible experience it should be!" - Director Joshua Hull, Beverly Lane

"Travis creates gritty, realistic characters that you may not always like, but that's what makes them real." - Author Justin Brock-Jones, Valley Falls

“Grundon's work is stark, effective, and inventively playful. It's like fine literary nourishment, only incredibly uncomfortable and sadistically twisted." - Director Jakob Bilinski, Shade of Grey

“Gripping, intense, and unforgettable! J. Travis Grundon has an uncanny ability to suck you into a story. There is no “off limits” in his work. Any story written by him will be a true treat to any ones taste from the light reader to the truly demented hardcore fan!”  - Author Leslee Marie Schaffer, Fracas: A Collection of Short Friction

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

If you can't fork over the cash, you can still help! You can share the links and tell your friends. You can also ask your local book stores to carry books by J. Travis Grundon!
