He finds himself in a series of alcohol fueled bad situations before he's forced to make a choice. He has to stop his foolish, fleshy ways and settle on one of the amazing women in his life. A good woman won't wait around forever, but even if he makes the wrong decision, it changes everything. Someone has to get hurt.
Sometimes you love someone so much, all you can do is #@$% it up.
 
Short Summary
Crowd funding has been very successful for bands, indie filmmakers, and many other creative projects. There isn't any reason fans can't support a book related venture in the same way and collect some super swell perks too!
This fundraiser is not designed to cover printing cost. Those costs and other fees are covered by the publisher. This is just a campaign to get the books to the readers and meet the people who buy them. The publisher doesn't cover those costs.
The money raised will go towards a U.S. book tour. It will go into travel expenses and advertising.
"I want to be able to tour with my next book. I want to meet the readers and talk about my work. More authors need to connect with their readers."
- J. Travis Grundon
Who the $#@!* is J. Travis Grundon?
J. Travis Grundon is an author and a screenwriter with a focus on transgressive, speculative and general fiction. He has served as an editor and contributor on Forrest J Ackerman's Anthology of the Living Dead and Fracas: A Collection of Short Friction. His books Eclectic Collection and Happy Hour Blues illustrate his love and craft of short stories.His other work can be found in the Silven Trumpeter, the Tecumseh Review, Scars, Paracinema, Twisted Dreams, and The Monsters Next Door magazine. Other works include stories for Help - An Anthology To Benefit Preditors and Editors, Concrete Blood: Dark Tales of the City, and Toe Tags 2.
 


What We Need & What You Get
$2,350 is not a lot of money to spend on a book tour. It will not cover all of the costs, but it will help. It's the only way to make it possible.
All money raised will go into bringing this book to the readers. The way to do that is to take the book on tour. We need to hit every book store that welcomes indie authors. We will put all of the money we raise towards book signing/ reading events, travel cost, and aditional marketing.
$1 - Special thanks on my Twitter and Facebook.
 
$5 - Special thanks and a limited edition bookmark/ sticker. 
$15 - Social media thanks, sticker and a personalized signed copy of the new book, Mr. Bad Example! 
$25 - All of the above and a personalized signed copy of Happy Hour Blues
$35 - All of the above and a signed copy of Eclectic Collection
 
$40 - Social media thanks, sticker, signed copy of the new book and a very rare J. Travis Grundon T-Shirt!
 
$45 - Social media thanks, sticker, signed copy of the new book and 2 to 3 hand written pages from the original manuscript of the new book.
$50 - Social media thanks, sticker, signed copy of the new book and an extra special thank you ...your name in the acknowledgments of the book. 
$75 - Social media thanks, sticker, signed copy of the new book and a special thanks in the acknowledgments of the book AND you could be a character in a future story or book!
$100 - Social media thanks, sticker, signed copy of the new book and a special thank you in the acknowledgments of the book AND you could be a character in a future story or book AND you will get signed copies of all of my future published work my published work, as it's published. You will have a subscription to my books.
$200 - You will get your pick of anything above AND a high five AND I will do a reading/ signing at your house, local book store, bar or other venue. 
 
$500 or more is just crazy, but if you want to be that crazy - I will try to come to your house and cook for you!  You can also get your pick of anything above AND I might even sleep on your couch! 
 
Links to other books by J. Travis Grundon
Eclectic Collection 
&
Happy Hour Blues 


 
Praise for J. Travis Grundon
"J. Travis Grundon is a passionate, modern storyteller. His dystopian tales are the stuff of delightful nightmares."  - Author Joe Schwartz, Games Men Play"J. Travis Grundon’s stories contain a dark realism that makes the characters seem like your neighbors as you watch the story unfold through your side window. He is a real talent to the literary world. " - Director DP Bonnell, Happy Hooker Bang Bang 
 

"J. Travis Grundon's writing is quite strong as I had no trouble visiting these stories in my mind...I just didn't like being there much after I got there. That IS a compliment." - Director John Taylor, LEACH"J. Travis Grundon is a visionary. You better watch out!" - Nicholas Grabowsky, Red Wet Dirt/ Black Bed Sheet Books "J. Travis Grundon 's stories are as familiar as sitting down to afternoon tea, but his ideas are as exotic and intoxicating as a good stiff shot added to the mix." - Author B.C. Brown, A Touch of Darkness“J. Travis Grundon’s work has a unique voice in a world of similar voices, something that writers twice his age don’t have. His work, whether they’re straight-out horror, noir mashups or just plain weird, tells stories that strike nerves and stay in the memory long after you’re finished.” –Author John F.D.Taff, Little Deaths"J. Travis Grundon is an extremely diverse author, who draws you in with his definitive characters and the vivid stories they tell." - Kitsie Duncan, Model/Actress "J. Travis Grundon is more than a writer; he's an unstoppable force." -Author  L.B. Goddard, The Monsters Next Door “J. Travis Grundon is a true talent that makes turning the page the incredible experience it should be!" - Director Joshua Hull, Beverly Lane"Travis creates gritty, realistic characters that you may not always like, but that's what makes them real." - Author Justin Brock-Jones, Valley Falls“Grundon's work is stark, effective, and inventively playful. It's like fine literary nourishment, only incredibly uncomfortable and sadistically twisted." - Director Jakob Bilinski, Shade of Grey“Gripping, intense, and unforgettable! J. Travis Grundon has an uncanny ability to suck you into a story. There is no “off limits” in his work. Any story written by him will be a true treat to any ones taste from the light reader to the truly demented hardcore fan!”  - Author Leslee Marie Schaffer, Fracas: A Collection of Short Friction



Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
If you can't fork over the cash, you can still help! You can share the links and tell your friends. You can also ask your local book stores to carry books by J. Travis Grundon!

*UPDATE* Lauren received the only full scholarship the NCI gives out! THAT'S how fantastic she is. She still needs airfare, which will cost roughly $700 , so give any amount you can so we can GET her there!!!

 

If nothing else, read this and understand how important the arts are.

 

Who is Lauren Smart?

Lauren Smart has focused her career on telling the stories of Dallas artists, as both a journalist and a social media and communications consultant.

She handles the communications and social networks of Klyde Warren Park. Her latest work as writer can be seen in Dallas Morning News, Patron magazine, CultureMap Dallas, Arts + Culture magazine, TheaterJones.com, American Theatre magazine, among others.

Lauren earned a master’s degree in Arts Journalism from Syracuse University and bachelor’s degrees in Journalism and English from Southern Methodist University.

While in graduate school Lauren founded an arts criticism website in Central New York, Green Room Reviews.

Lauren enjoys the great outdoors and is constantly on the lookout for something inspiring, from home decor to a new sports bra. Her hobbies include running, biking and something she likes to call ‘patioing’ (sitting on a patio with a cocktail).

What is the National Critics Institute?

The O'Neill National Critics Institute is designed for theater writers looking to strengthen their skills in an increasingly competitive job market.

At heart, NCI is an intensive writing workshop.  Critic-fellows turn out a piece of copy almost every night—a review of last night's show, a description of an individual actor's performance, an interview with the director.  After breakfast, the copy is read aloud and dissected by the group, under the direction of a seasoned theater writer or editor.  "A boring script?" Example, please.  "A great performance?" Prove it.

"We don't come to the O'Neill to tell the playwrights what's wrong with their scripts," says NCI Director Dan Sullivan, who reviewed theater for the Los Angeles Times for twenty years.  "This is about our process as writers—the place where we exercise our right to fail."

After lunch, the critic fellows are plunged into the O'Neill's production process.  Says Sullivan: "For two weeks we live and breathe theater. We find out—if we didn't know already, and as a rookie reviewer, I didn't—how a director puts a new play on its feet in four days.  If Edward Albee visits the O'Neill, we sit down with Edward Albee. Our lighting designer may have us hanging lights in the Barn.”

"It's a tough two weeks, not a vacation at the beach. We like to call it a boot camp for critics.  For critics with experience it's a re-boot. There's no other program like it."

This is an elite program and Lauren got in!

It's so exciting that Lauren got in, so let's help get her there! She received a partial scholarship from the program (because she's just that good!) but she still needs tuition money!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Every single dollar helps! Lauren is so talented and kind, so please contribute anything you can. This is a great educational and professional opportunity, don't let her pass it up because she can't afford to go!

Thank you in advance!

story:
HI EVERYONE

I'm Rylan, and I am a creator of all kinds - I'm a fiction writer and musician, among other things.  This is my first online fundraising campaign, but there are others in the works and it certainly won't be my last.  Watching from the sidelines I've seen this community fund some very cool projects, and I figured this was a good place to appeal for support in completing a project I've been working on for about 8 years - a travel guide to the Bay Area.

I'm from the greater Bay and have been driving, taking trains and buses, skating and walking throughout the urban region ever since I've been able to.  During my time buying records I traveled to half of the record stores I could find in the area - and that's in a city of 7 million!  All this time I've been keeping notes and taking pictures, and writing a guide for visitors. 

The goal of the guide is to get people that visit Northern California to go places other than Fisherman's Wharf (the most tacky part of SF), Monterey and Wine Country.  Personally I find these places to be a poor selection of what the Bay Area has to offer, and my hypothesis is that if the other parts of the Bay got more exposure tourists might start to scratch the surface of this large California metropolis.

From the sleepy fishing villages of the Sonoma coast to the vibrant and diverse culture of the East Bay, from majestic redwood groves of Santa Cruz County to the less traveled but incredible roads of urban San Francisco, I've been all over the Bay Area, and have accumulated enough material for a hell of a book.  This project has been in the works for a LONG time and has been a labor of love.

(An example chapter, about West San Francisco, is online at driftbayarea.wordpress.com)

But at this point, love is turning out not to be enough.  I'm broke, and don't have the budget I've had in the past to get out of town.  This is combined with the fact that the parts of the Bay I have less experience with are the farthest away from where I live.  I'm stuck on the project, and given my economic situation the only way for me to continue working on it right now is to ask for funding.

WHAT I HAVE SO FAR

I have 7 out of 10 sections of the guide done - three San Francisco sections, two East Bay sections, a Monterey Bay section and a section about the Peninsula and the South Bay.  The parts that aren't done are the sections on the North Bay, the Northeast Bay and the Tri-Valley region.  By area and population, about 80% of the Bay has been covered already.

I don't need much to finish the project, just some gas money, public transit money, and perhaps some money for lodging.  This is travel within the Bay Area, but the Bay is huge - given the return trip, driving from Santa Cruz to the North Bay can be the quivalent of driving 2/3s of the way from the Bay to Los Angeles.  It's not chump change anymore - I have thoroughly explored the areas closer to home base, and need to get to the outskirts on the opposite side of the city.

I don't need any publishing money; I'm going to publish digitally, on the kindle and in other formats, which lets me keep the guide cheap and also makes it more accessible and environmentally sound.  I'll be doing design and such myself.  Yes, I am technically asking for money to travel, but this isn't travel for fun as much as it is for finishing a project that is already mostly done.

PERKS

As far as perks, if you donate anything you will make the list of 'awesome people' in the back of the publication.  Beyond that, if you ever wanted to visit the Bay Area, I can help - a donation of $5 or more will get you a copy of the guide once it's completed, $20 or more will get you a consultation about your trip, and for $50 you get a personal driver for at least a day upon your visit, which is a pretty good deal really.

Like I said, anything helps me get closer to completing the guide.  If by some miracle I get more money than I need, I'm not going to throw a party - I plan on writing a guide to the Los Angeles area after this one is completed, and any excess funding will go into that project.

THE GUIDE ITSELF

If you feel like you might want to come to the Bay Area at some point, and if you're interested in purchasing a $5 digital guide that would give you a variety of good ideas for that trip, you could buy one now by funding this project.  I hope that this guide provides a sort of 'second opinion' in the travel literature world, because my tastes are not everyone's and seeing my take on things should help anyone in planning a unique trip to the Bay.
 
My research is broad and thorough - many places that are derided as having 'nothing to do there' actually have things to offer, and I seek to find those things as well as delve deep into places that have a 'lot' to do to see what actually IS worth doing there.  So if you'd like to see a guide like that published, you can make it happen here.

OTHER STUFF

If you can't donate yourself, but are in solidarity with the goal, you can still be awesome and could always tell other people about this campaign. 
 
In addition, if you live in the Bay and have any travel tips, shoot me a message or something, I'm always down to hear new info.
 
Well if you've read this far, you're definitely awesome and thanks for your time.  Like I said this is my first campaign, but I'll be on indiegogo again, so keep your eyes peeled.  Peace and see you later,
 
Rylan

Rylan

story:
The Story

The road in the photograph is Highway 61 running out of Lake City, Minnesota, circa 1942.  This is the road my family took when we were run out of town in a vigilante action.  My father was a doctor who had grown up in Lake City.  He was the kind of man about whom people say, “I always knew he would grow up and kill someone.”  My father was born violent, his temper was uncontrollable.  He was raised in what was called “German-America,” a part of the Midwest in which many people had pro-German sympathies during World War I and the rise of the Third Reich.  That right-wing political culture and my father’s pathological anger combined to produce a doctor who was considered so dangerous, his hometown forced him, and his family, to leave.

My book tells two stories, a personal story of growing up with a violently extremist father and the political story of the reactionary environment that shaped him.  In the personal story, I write about the trauma my father inflicted on his family as his illness became more severe and his rage against people in the town increased.  The political story describes the way my hometown organized its vigilante action to drive my father out.  It also discusses the history of vigilantism in America and the immense power America’s German immigrants had on right-wing ideology in the United States. German-Americans were aggressive about promoting their radical right agenda in the Midwest and their politics led to violent vigilante actions against them during World War I. 

I am, to my knowledge, the only person who has grown up with the extreme right wing who is writing about it and against it.  The combination of my graduate school education in political science and my frightening personal experience affords me a unique view of the radical right.  It has also given me motivation.  I want to share what I know.  The more we know about extremists, the more power we have to stop them.

story:
This campaign is over

Many thanks to those who donated on Indiegogo.com  as I attempted to raise funds to publish a ministry version of my book.  The campaign on Indiegogo is over. To give up on my campaign would mean giving up on what I believe is God's plan.  

Though I did not reach my goal on Indiegogo,  I will continue to pursue different ways of fundraising for this important ministry. As stated bellow, If I don’t reach my goal,  I will try to get it published the least expensive way.  The funding I received on Indiegogo will be put towards that goal.  Thanks again.  God bless.


Short Summary

My name is Kathy Graff and I am a member of FBC in CT.  I have been a Christian for over 20 years.  My ministries include praise band and drama among others.  I have recently published my first book based on my journey with cancer.

I am looking to publish a 2nd edition of my book.  The 1st edition has photographs that have raised the retail price of the book.  I would like to make my story more affordable by publishing the 2nd edition w/o photos.  This would drop the retail price from $24.99, to about $8.99.  

The reason I would like to do this is because of the positive feedback from those who have read my book. People who have cancer, those who don’t, people I know, and those I don’t know have conveyed their gratitude to me for sharing my story of hope. It has helped them through their cancer (and in some cases, not cancer but some other circumstance) and helped them draw closer to and trust God.  It addresses the physical, emotional and spiritual issues surrounding cancer and my personal spiritual walk with Jesus and how he brought me through the cancer against all medical odds. 

Through your financial support, your investment will go much farther than just monetary.  You would also have a part in providing hope and encouragement for cancer patients by making my book more affordable in the long run.  Together we can minister to cancer patients.

 What I Need & What You Get

I have set a goal of $4,100.  Here is the breakdown

  1. $2099 is the price for publishing
  2. $90 for google/amazon lookup (sneak peak)
  3. $479 for a press release
  4. $280 for IGG fee
  5. $1124 for books at author discount of 50%.  These books would help me kick off my book campaign at speaking engagements AND be used for gifts/postage sent to you for your support.

A GIFT FOR YOU – For every person who donates $20 or more to my project, I would love to send you a free, signed copy of the 2nd edition of my book as a HUGE THANK YOU for your investment.

If I don’t reach my goal,  I will try to get it published the least expensive way, not order the books or the add on items.  But this would significantly lower the book's exposure to the public.

My Story

So you can get an idea of what is in my book, here is a synopsis.

In August of 2011, I was diagnosed with Stage 3-muscle invasive bladder cancer.  I went to 3 different doctors, 3 different hospitals and they were all in agreement that the bladder needed to come out, that it was squamous cell carcinoma, a very rare and aggressive cancer that most physicians believe there is no cure for, and that my weight would be a danger in surgery.  I felt like I had a literal death sentence.

Being crushed by all of this, I found my faith was being severely tested.  But I chose not to give up on God.  My family, friends and church prayed hard and fast, asking God to give me direction, and He did.  Before I knew it He sent me to the right hospital and surgeon who did the job.  That was October 14, 2011.  As of August 2013, I am 2 months away from the 2 year anniversary of my surgery and I am 100% cancer free without the benefit of treatment aside from the surgery – despite the fact that the cancer started to spread outside my bladder.  When the odds were against me, God was for me.  That was God’s hand of grace and providence over my life.  For every dark moment cancer brought into my life, Christ was there to counteract it with His Presence, grace and unfailing love in the most amazing ways.  This is HIS story and testimony He has given me, worthy to be penned. 

Now I have a new lease on life and a purpose from God, which is to give hope and encouragement to those living with cancer through my book.  It is my passion, my purpose, my life.  If I could afford it, I would purchase the books myself and give them away to every cancer patient on the planet.  But, I can’t.  Getting the 2nd edition published for a lower retail price is as close as I can get to help just a few. 

Other ways you can help if you can’t invest monetarily

I understand times are tough these days.  If you can’t invest funds for my campaign, I would ask that you get the word out about my project.  Use social media and word of mouth.  That would be a great help.  

Another thing is, reach out to a cancer patient from where you are.  Volunteer at a cancer center.  When I lead a cancer fellowship group a while back I found that most people didn’t like to talk about it.  I don’t know why.  But they (we) all need to know that someone cares, even a stranger. 

Thank you again for your consideration in supporting my project.  May God help to find a cure for cancer in our lifetime.  God bless you!!!!

Kathy Graff

We are not victims of cancer, we are children of the Living God!
story_txt:
This campaign is over

Many thanks to those who donated on Indiegogo.com  as I attempted to raise funds to publish a ministry version of my book.  The campaign on Indiegogo is over. To give up on my campaign would mean giving up on what I believe is God's plan.  
Though I did not reach my goal on Indiegogo,  I will continue to pursue different ways of fundraising for this important ministry. As stated bellow, If I don’t reach my goal,  I will try to get it published the least expensive way.  The funding I received on Indiegogo will be put towards that goal.  Thanks again.  God bless.


Short Summary
My name is Kathy Graff and I am a member of FBC in CT.  I have been a Christian for over 20 years.  My ministries include praise band and drama among others.  I have recently published my first book based on my journey with cancer.
I am looking to publish a 2nd edition of my book.  The 1st edition has photographs that have raised the retail price of the book.  I would like to make my story more affordable by publishing the 2nd edition w/o photos.  This would drop the retail price from $24.99, to about $8.99.  
The reason I would like to do this is because of the positive feedback from those who have read my book. People who have cancer, those who don’t, people I know, and those I don’t know have conveyed their gratitude to me for sharing my story of hope. It has helped them through their cancer (and in some cases, not cancer but some other circumstance) and helped them draw closer to and trust God.  It addresses the physical, emotional and spiritual issues surrounding cancer and my personal spiritual walk with Jesus and how he brought me through the cancer against all medical odds. 
Through your financial support, your investment will go much farther than just monetary.  You would also have a part in providing hope and encouragement for cancer patients by making my book more affordable in the long run.  Together we can minister to cancer patients.
 What I Need & What You Get
I have set a goal of $4,100.  Here is the breakdown


$2099 is the price for publishing
$90 for google/amazon lookup (sneak peak)
$479 for a press release
$280 for IGG fee
$1124 for books at author discount of 50%.  These books would help me kick off my book campaign at speaking engagements AND be used for gifts/postage sent to you for your support.


A GIFT FOR YOU – For every person who donates $20 or more to my project, I would love to send you a free, signed copy of the 2nd edition of my book as a HUGE THANK YOU for your investment.
If I don’t reach my goal,  I will try to get it published the least expensive way, not order the books or the add on items.  But this would significantly lower the book's exposure to the public.
My Story
So you can get an idea of what is in my book, here is a synopsis.
In August of 2011, I was diagnosed with Stage 3-muscle invasive bladder cancer.  I went to 3 different doctors, 3 different hospitals and they were all in agreement that the bladder needed to come out, that it was squamous cell carcinoma, a very rare and aggressive cancer that most physicians believe there is no cure for, and that my weight would be a danger in surgery.  I felt like I had a literal death sentence.
Being crushed by all of this, I found my faith was being severely tested.  But I chose not to give up on God.  My family, friends and church prayed hard and fast, asking God to give me direction, and He did.  Before I knew it He sent me to the right hospital and surgeon who did the job.  That was October 14, 2011.  As of August 2013, I am 2 months away from the 2 year anniversary of my surgery and I am 100% cancer free without the benefit of treatment aside from the surgery – despite the fact that the cancer started to spread outside my bladder.  When the odds were against me, God was for me.  That was God’s hand of grace and providence over my life.  For every dark moment cancer brought into my life, Christ was there to counteract it with His Presence, grace and unfailing love in the most amazing ways.  This is HIS story and testimony He has given me, worthy to be penned. 
Now I have a new lease on life and a purpose from God, which is to give hope and encouragement to those living with cancer through my book.  It is my passion, my purpose, my life.  If I could afford it, I would purchase the books myself and give them away to every cancer patient on the planet.  But, I can’t.  Getting the 2nd edition published for a lower retail price is as close as I can get to help just a few. 
Other ways you can help if you can’t invest monetarily
I understand times are tough these days.  If you can’t invest funds for my campaign, I would ask that you get the word out about my project.  Use social media and word of mouth.  That would be a great help.  
Another thing is, reach out to a cancer patient from where you are.  Volunteer at a cancer center.  When I lead a cancer fellowship group a while back I found that most people didn’t like to talk about it.  I don’t know why.  But they (we) all need to know that someone cares, even a stranger. 
Thank you again for your consideration in supporting my project.  May God help to find a cure for cancer in our lifetime.  God bless you!!!!
Kathy Graff
We are not victims of cancer, we are children of the Living God!

story:
I'm a husband, father of 5 remarkable boys, former Government Officer, world traveler, Humanitarian and Church leader.   I've previously written a spiritual adventure guide, but "Dulu" is a story that has been in the works for over a decade.  It is intended to take kids aged 6 to 11 on a unique journey of discovery.

Dulu is an allegory for supernatural living. With illustrations (by Jacob Daniels), readers follow six friends into an adventure of crossing over into a forbidden land where they climb the magnificent mountain and meet the Father of all life before being sent back on a mission to change their own world of Dulu.  

This is the first of two books in this series. 

What I Need & What You'll Receive

The goal is to raise $6,350 to go directly toward paying for illustrations, editing, and publishing. 

Donors who give $100 or more will receive a signed copy of the first edition.

The Impact

In a world of magic and wizardry, Dulu is a spiritual adventure filled with imagery, themes, and encounters with supernatural creatures described in the scriptures.

This project is an inspiring and spiritual on-ramp for your kids, nephews, nieces, grandkids and friends' kids to read and imagine living a real adventure here on the earth, similar in many ways to the kids in the story.

I've published a previous work (The Extraordinary Journey - A Spiritual Adventure Guide).  This is my first work written specifically for children.  As the father of 5 young boys, I've told hundreds of nighttime stories. This one is intended to help inspire kids to live large and see themselves as God sees them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If unable to give financially, please help spread the word to parents of young kids or grandparents that you know. 

You can get the word out by tweeting, sharing on Facebook or emailing this link to them. There are tools that Indiegogo provides to help you get the word out to make Dulu a reality.

Thanks for your partnership!  With your help, it's likely that Dulu will be published in time to share as a gift this Christmas.

story:
A year and a half ago,  many of you came together to help me fund the illustrations for my first children's book, The Energy Thief.

THANK YOU!
I COULD NOT HAVE DONE IT WITHOUT YOU!

It is time to get rolling on the followup....

Why another crowdfunding campaign?

The Energy Thief continues to grow in sales, but to get another book out in the next  year or so, I have to start now....it takes a little over 8 months to produce the artwork for a new book. 

Also, it is always good to strike while the iron is hot. There is a huge market of children's books out there, and right now, I have been able to garner a tiny bit of attention for The Energy Thief, and do not want to lose momentum going forward.

I have written several books to follow The Energy Thief. After talking with my ultra-talented illustrator, Lincoln Adams**, we have decided to move forward on a Holiday themed book next.

This is a charming little book about a kid who thinks he has been bad, and sets out to right the situation with Santa.... "Escaping the Naughty List"

so...

YOUR HELP IS APPRECIATED, and will be rewarded with one of the numerous items listed over there to the right... 

100% of funds raised will go directly to the illustrator of this project to make it happen.If there is any leftover, I will purchase copies of the book to donate to a local reading program.

For those of you who supported The Energy Thief, you know that Lincoln's work raises the level of the book to that of what you see in every book shelf filled with books from your youth..

Can't help? Thanks for reading, and please forward the link that led you here to friends that might have an interest.

THANK YOU!!

Reviews of The Energy Thief:
http://parentteacher.uskidsmags.com/2012/12/09/energy-thief/


http://www.amazon.com/The-Energy-Thief-Clay-Howard/product-reviews/1479269026/ref=cm_cr_dp_see_all_btm?ie=UTF8&showViewpoints=1&sortBy=bySubmissionDateDescending

**Lincoln Adams also illustrated The Energy Thief, and is currently working as a story artist for the uber-succesful Veggie Tales franchise...His work raises the level of the book to that of Nationally published work, and is worth every penny..

story:
Christopher "Jelly" Stanly is a spoken word artist from Kearny, NJ. He is a 2 time National Poetry Slam (NPS) competitor and the current Grand Slam Champion of the Jersey City Slam. He is the J.C. Slam representative for the 2013 Individual World Poetry Slam, which is taking place in Spokane, Wa from October 3-5.

This campaign is to help send Jelly to the Individual World Poetry Slam, a competition of over 72 individual poets based around giving everyone's voice a chance to be heard. 

Your contribution will give not just Jelly, but the entire Jersey City community a chance to be heard and represented on an international level. 


What We Need & What You Get

Here's the deal: 

  • Plane tickets and hotel stays are expensive. Jelly needs 1,100 dollars to cover the aforementioned and the registration for competing.  If we reach over the goal, any extra money will be put towards money forfeited due to loss of work. 
  • Each perk is designed to (hopefully) accommodate everyone who is amazing enough to donate.  
  • If we do not reach our goal, all money received will still be put towards sending Jelly to the 2013 IWPS.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate but still want to support: 
  • Spread/Share this campaign on your facebook/twitter/instagram/cubicle/park tree and let your friends know about an opportunity to support a great cause.
  • If you can't support now but want to help out in the future, look out for Jelly's new chapbook "Beehives & Hand Grenades" coming soon.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Three best female friends' pursue the "perfect bachelor" only to find themselves caught up in a web of lies, deceit, and imminent danger.



A Little About Me
I've always had a vivid imagination that lent itself to the art of creative writing. Now I aim to make a living doing something I'm actually passionate about. With your help, I can make a dream come true. In return, I've got some awesome perks for you!

What's The Novel About?
Three best female friends, Lina, Keisha, and Stacey, make a bet on who can get Atlanta's most eligible bachelor, the handsome and rich Jackson Harwell, to "put a ring on it" in six months. Unfortunately, they find out the hard way that all that glitters ain't gold.

My Inspiration
I believe a woman should love a man because of the size of his heart, not how much money or assets he has. I set out to write a cautionary tale about gold diggers and the very real possibility that what they want isn't always best for them.

Want A Sneak Peek?
Download all of Chapter 1. It's FREE if you pay with a Tweet or Facebook Post!

Why Do I Need The Money?

- professional editing & proofreading

- eBook formatting and conversion

 - website design


Together WE can make "No Money No Honey" a success, and you get the satisfaction of knowing you helped make it happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, and other social media networks.

Thanks for your support. God bless.

* My name is Sophia Clark. I write under the pen name Niki Cloud.

story:
Our Story  My name is Craig Graham. My Wife, Cheri Graham, was stricken with COPD a few years ago and her career and life as`she knew it ended and` she was forced to accept disability and all thought of a comfortable, well planned retirement vanished.  I, in turn, suffered a debilitating injury two years ago and my own career ended prematurely as well. We found our selves going into our supposed 'Golden Years' financially struggling. We reside in Amherst, NH. Fortunately, my wife has a gift. She loves children and animals.  And I've been  told I can write, and write well.  Cheri always wanted to write children's books. She posesses wonderful ideas.  That said, our first children's story, "Chippy The Chipmunk" was born. It's a story of small animals we all see every day who live their lives as we humans do with all the challenges and rewards people find, with all the goodness yet even life's dissappoinments . . . though written for children and for parents to read to their children. The stories are about values, common courtesies, mutual respect and all the ideals that make the world go round.  These basic, short, easy to read stories have been written. Finding a publisher is next to impossible. Waiting lists,  competition and lack of money have been our obstacles. We've had the stories critiqued and all who read them love them, especially children.  Our plan is to find a publisher that can publish these short stories for no more than $3000 or so,  including an artist, which is more than reasonable plus retain an experienced and reliable marketing company to get this project off the ground, in all, approximately $10,000. We have three publishers in mind and have researched this project to great detail.  With both our incomes limited, this may be a dream we may never accomplish unless we can raise this funding here.  With funding, our dream can come true within a year. Given Cheri's disability, time is of the essence.  Any help provided will be greatly appreciated.

(Introduce yourself and tell your campaign's story. Make sure to cover the who, what, where, when and how of your campaign.)


The Impact  We like to have our stories published and marketed within a year as we are both getting on in years plus our stories are very relevant to what is going on in today's society. Family values, morals, manners, and our everyday ethics are constantly being bombarded and eroded at every turn. The positive impact our stories could create could be incalculable. Good , old-fashioned family values in stories written by folks who have seen our values assaulted,  compromised and so long forgotten has to still have a place in our society. Our project is for the children.  Life is not always about money.

(What is the impact your campaign may have on others? What if your campaign doesn't happen, what are the consequences? Make it real for people.)


What We Need & What You Get  We have three basic stories written and in manuscript form. We also have three publishers interested and`are being told that actual publishing begins with a minimum of $2000 up front. We have an artist who can provide illustrations, high quality illustrations for approximately $3000 and the artistry is truly professional, by hand, and of a very unique style reminiscient of the fairy tales of old. Each character is beautifully personified and colorful.  Marketing is the next level and that can run anywhere from $3000 to $5000 just to get the books on the shelves in limited editions. We will be dealing with a local publisher here in the New Hampshire area and our illustrator, Bruce Woods, has many years experience and a portfolio of work that is truly magnificent.  Marketing companies are being suggested by the publishers but we'd rather inject some due diligence, find a marketing firm with a solid track record in childrens' literature and negotiate a situation that will be most effective. There could be incidental expenses and such but our plan is to hire a literary agent to oversee the project to insure the money is being well spent and the project is brought in within a timely fashion.  The stories we have written . . . and the ones about to be written are all manuscript ready and we only require funding to put this altogether.  Help us fulfill a dream. We will provide dedications and book signings for donations over $50/

(Break it down for folks - how much money do you need and where is it going? Be transparent and specific and be sure to address where the money goes if you don't reach your entire goal. For example, do you have other funding sources? Does part of the campaign still happen? Ensure people they are not just buying you dinner. Use this area to tell people about your unique perks, too!)


Other Ways You Can Help 

(Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others' by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Don't forget to remind them about the share tools!)

story:
SUMMARY

In the 3 years since its inception, Battle Born Slam has gone from a coffeeshop full of quiet poet types to a raucous crowd that rock downtown Las Vegas once a month with a unique blend of traditional poetry aesthetic drizzled with modern, hip sensibility. We've brought workshop programs to local youth in community events and through featured appearaces at high schools, presented work at major festivals including First Friday and the 18b Music Festival, and have helped progress spoken word in Las Vegas to a level its never seen before.

But for us to take the next step, we need your help! We were able to compete at last year's National Poetry Slam in Charlotte, NC and brought home the first ever win in a bout for a Las Vegas team, and this year we hope to build on that success as we travel to Cambridge, MA to compete again!

 

HOW MUCH WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

We hope to raise $3,000 through this campaign which will go directly to travel expenses and lodging for our week-long stay at NPS 2013 in Cambridge. Any funds in excess of our goal will go directly into the slam fund, which is dedicated exclusively to expenses that allow us to bring more workshops, slams, and constructive community projects in the Las Vegas area.

As a contributor, you will have access to unique perks from the Battle Born Slam Team including:

  • Fancy, frame-ready typographic prints of poems from the team.
  • Team compilation chapbooks
  • Individual team member chapbooks
  • Team audio CDs
  • Specially-written, individualized poetry from team members
  • A special, private performance from team members at your venue or event
For individual chapbooks or personal poem requests, please include the team member you would like this item from: Kari O'Connor, Vogue Robinson, Lauren Williamson, Nathan Say, or coach AJ Moyer.
 
 
IMPACT
 
By contributing to this campaing, you help to further the growth of the Las Vegas poetry community and open up more opportunities for us to give the youth of our community a productive outlet for their struggles. By our presence at the National Poetry Slam, you also help us continue to bring in top-level talent to expose our city to the kinds of life-changing experiences that can be created with nothing more than a voice and a microphone.
 

WHAT IF I CAN'T CONTRIBUTE?

If you can't contribute financially - we dig that. Times are tough. But if you have access to any special deals on travel, merchandise production, or if you just want to send us good vibes and well wishes we'd appreciate it endlessly! While it may only be 5 of us physically going to the National Poetry Slam, we're taking this whole community with us in our hearts!

Fancy, frame-ready typographic prints of poems from the team.
Team compilation chapbooks
Individual team member chapbooks
Team audio CDs
Specially-written, individualized poetry from team members
A special, private performance from team members at your venue or event
For individual chapbooks or personal poem requests, please include the team member you would like this item from: Kari O'Connor, Vogue Robinson, Lauren Williamson, Nathan Say, or coach AJ Moyer.
 
 
IMPACT
 
By contributing to this campaing, you help to further the growth of the Las Vegas poetry community and open up more opportunities for us to give the youth of our community a productive outlet for their struggles. By our presence at the National Poetry Slam, you also help us continue to bring in top-level talent to expose our city to the kinds of life-changing experiences that can be created with nothing more than a voice and a microphone.
 
WHAT IF I CAN'T CONTRIBUTE?
If you can't contribute financially - we dig that. Times are tough. But if you have access to any special deals on travel, merchandise production, or if you just want to send us good vibes and well wishes we'd appreciate it endlessly! While it may only be 5 of us physically going to the National Poetry Slam, we're taking this whole community with us in our hearts!

story:
Derdimiz Ne?

Her şey Gezi Park'ında kesilen bir kaç ağaca verilen tepki olarak başladı. Sonra büyük bir gençlik hareketine dönüştü.

Eylemi ve sosyolojik nedenlerini NY Times Gazetesi'nde Uluslararası kamuoyuna duyurma iddiasında bir gazete ilanı yayınlandı. Tam sayfa ilanın, eyleme yön veren gençliğin beklentilerini, gerçekleri yansıtmadığını, yanlı ve siyasi kaygılarla yazılmış bir popaganda metni olduğunu düşünüyoruz. 

Her kesimden gencin, insanın daha fazla demokrasi talebiyle biraraya geldiği bu eylemin ruhunu, tüm ideolojilerden bağımsız bir şekilde anlatalım istiyoruz. 

Ne lazım?

  • NY Times'da çıkmasını planladığımız "Türkiye'de Neler Oluyor? Vol.2" (What's Happening in Turkey? Vol.2) tam sayfa gazete ilanı için maddi destek.

story:
I couldn't find a children's book about trans-gender children for my client to be able to identify with- so I wrote one!

 "Creative Chameleon Finds Acceptance" is a story for trans-gender/gender creative children who are trying to understand feelings, differences and what it means to accept who they really are and navigate society.

Children need to be able to identify and express what they are feeling in order to integrate what they are learning into their experience. Books provide a platform for them to project themselves into the story and feel validated. The follow-up questions and resources for parents at the end of the story help support the child and their family's process, allowing them navigate the difficult subject of trans-gender, self-identifying and acceptance.

Please enjoy an excerpt of the book where Chameleon is trying to explain how she feels and integrate what it means to be different from others;

"...She had just gotten settled in when she heard a shuffle and, turning her left eye in the direction of the noise, she saw a meerkat.
Meerkat looked at Chameleon and looked at the tree, once, twice, three times.
“Hey, weren’t you just a different color?” He quickly questioned.
“Yes,” replied Chameleon rolling her eyes, “I was blue/green and now I am grey.”
“You change color? What is wrong with you?” Meerkat questioned with a tilt of his head and his eyebrow raised.
Chameleon sighed. She didn’t know what to say. Her stomach started to hurt worse – she wasn’t hungry at all now.
Now she just felt confused and ashamed.
Why did she change color? It just happened; she didn’t even have to think about it. It always just felt right.
“I don’t know why I change color, I just do! I don’t always feel one way or another. Right now I feel grey. It’s the way I am! I can’t explain it…I really wish I could…” she replied with a sad tone.
“Well,” stated Meerkat, as he looked around nervously, “I think you should just try to stay one color. Others like it better if you are just one way. You make me feel nervous when you change…” and with that he was off running, tail up, back into the bush, fearful of getting caught out in the open..." 

Thanks for reading! Please join me in bringing this book into the world for gender creative kids!

Funds raised will be added to the $1800 that I have already invested to pay for self-publishing through Balboa-Press (a division of Hay House). 

Illustration will be done by Ms. Joni Beckner, LPC, Art Therapist

story:
05 de JUNIO 2016

HALEL Primer Festival de Adoracion en UNIDAD

Judios y Evangelicos adorando juntos al Dios de Israel y reconociéndolo como Único soberano del Universo.
www.halelisrael.org 


QUIENES SOMOS

Mi nombre es Deborah Bartfeld - Organizadora de HALEL -  Festival de Adoración en UNIDAD - primero y único en su género en la historia de Israel, un evento que abrirá los cielos. 

Con  origen judio y 10 anios de ser testigo - junto a mis esposo - de la ilusion con la que miles de peregrinos caminan Tierra Santa, nuestro corazón se sentía  inquieto presentándose frente a Dios (como la primera vez..) en humildad y preguntandole: “de que otra manera deseas utilizarnos?  Es asi como HALEL nace, de un llamado de Dios en nuestro corazón para unir a sus dos pueblos amados en alabanza a EL.


Nos recordó el Libro de Josue cap 4. Y nos pidio, que hoy a orillas de este nuevo tiempo que ya comienza, le levantemos un altar humano de adoración y alabanza, en ese mismo lugar, en UNIDAD - judíos y cristianos. Dios nos llama a adorarlo juntos y a reconocerlo como único soberano del Universo.

Sera el 05 de junio del 2016. 

La respuesta ha sido gigante y emotiva! Mas de 200 adoradores de toda centro y sud America han confirmado su participación y a ellos se sumaran  otros 100 cristianos y judíos israelies.  

Salmistas y adoradores incluyendo a Marcos Witt (USA), Shabat Nekabla (Israel) Kike Pavon (Espana), Carolina Liberzuk (Comunidad Judia Beit Hilel de Argentina) y Ronaldo Bezerra (Brazil) entre otros, nos guiaran a la presencia de Dios en adoracion.

Este evento historico sera trasnmitido en vivo en mas de 23 paises en norte y sudamerica por la cadena de televisión CBN (Christian Broadcasting Network). Este  apoyo que nos brindan  a través de los medios de comunicacion lograra que esta alianza de Adoracion en Tierra Santa llegue a los hogares de miles de personas.

Hagamos Historia! 

UNETE a los esfuerzos que haran posible lo que en mas de 2000 años no se ha visto. La creacion del Altisimo adorandole tal y como el lo profetizo...

"Mas la hora viene, y ahora es, cuando los verdaderos adoradores adorarán al Padre en espíritu y en verdad; porque también el Padre tales adoradores busca que le adoren." Juan 4:23 

 NUESTRA META

Levantar a HALEL  tiene muchos costos, cubrir los gastos de viaje y estadía de nuestros salmistas también lo tiene y hoy necesitamos de tu apoyo para poder llevarlo acabo. Uniendo nuestros esfuerzos podremos levantar HALEL y hacer que se abran los cielos para todos los que llegan y los que nos vean en VIVO. GRACIAS A TU APOYO miles de personas podrán recibir SU PALABRA esa noche de mano  de uno o más salmistas y juntos podremos bendecir y alabar SU NOMBRE.

Necesitamos recaudar un minimo de $15.000. Lo podremos lograr juntos !

Tu contribución de c será de gran Bendicion y el 5% sera donado al

International Fellowship of Christians and Jews

 http://www.ifcj.org/site/PageNavigator/eng/USENG_homenew.

que posee diversos proyectos de trabajo social en Israel tanto para huerfanos, como soldados, ancianos, sobrevivientes del Holocausto y demás.

CADA DOLAR CUENTA! y si no esta en tu poder apoyarnos económicamente pero aun deseas colaborar te ruego..DIFUNDE ESTE LLAMADO con cualquiera de las herramientas que te ofrecemos en este sitio y en especial de manera personal de uno en uno, porque aquí cada uno cuenta de manera muy especial.

UNE a tu iglesia a este llamado,

UNE a tu templo a este llamado,

UNE a tu familia y a tus seres queridos,

UNE al que no conoces pero le deseas el bien,

UNETE TU !

ADORAR EN UNIDAD es el llamado de este nuevo tiempo!!

SHALOM!

UPDATE: OUR CURRENT 2000 FROM THIS CAMPAIGN + 1500 FROM CORNELL DEPARTMENTS = 3500 DOLLARS 

Now we are just working to make up for the fees that Indiegogo subtracts from raised funds, which are 4% for their services and 3% for credit card fees. 

ANY CONTRIBUTION OR ANY SHARING OF THIS LINK WILL BE INVALUABLE TO GETTING US TO OUR GOAL. WE CANNOT WAIT TO SHARE THIS ISSUE WITH YOU ALL. WE ARE SO CLOSE!!!

Kitsch magazine was founded 12 years ago to fill what students felt was an obvious void on campus— there needed to be a publication that focused on longer, investigative, creative, and altogether unhindered pieces on subject matter that effected communities both in and outside of Cornell. With this dedication in mind, Kitsch has published fiction, high-caliber art and photography, interviews with local and global figures, reviews of literature, film, and music, cultural criticism, back-handed observations, personal essays, lengthy tirades, loving odes, and much more. We extensively edit all articles in a way that allows writers to have hands-on journalistic experience and ensures that pieces are of the highest quality. Every member of the Kitsch staff—writers, editorial board members, art contributors, copy editors and innocent bystanders— are afforded the opportunity to participate in the final magazine’s design, layout, and construction in an effort to give students the chance to create a publication they can be proud of from start to finish.

For the academic year of 2014-2015, Kitsch was denied funding due to a bureaucratic error. 1000 copies of our magazine (3,500 dollars worth) have already been printed and are awaiting pick up, pending our ability to pay for them. Any donation big or small will be greatly appreciated. It is of utmost importance for us to fulfill our obligation to pay our printer, especially so that our representative does not suffer any negative repercussions.

We will write you a love song or poem of your chosen form and theme for any donation above five U.S. dollars.

For any donation above 25 dollars you will get a personal thank you, printed up nice in the Spring 2015 issue.

For any donation above 100 dollars we can offer a full-page ad in the Spring 2015 issue, as well as 50 copies of that issue (usually 250 dollars).

Check us out at issuu.com/kitschmag

All the best,

Kitsch Magazine

story:
Trump ha dirigido su campaña para la presidencia insultándonos, atacándonos y prometiendo que nos deportará.Y en lugar de de rechazar su odio y expulsarlo,  ha recibido la nominación del partido Republicano.

Si una de las promesas más grandes de su campaña es la construcción de un muro pagado por México, pues vamos a hacerlo. Pero no en la frontera.

Vamos a construirlo en Cleveland, Ohio en la convención donde será coronado como el candidato official a la presidencia. 


English Version Here


Mijente es un eje nacional para Latinxs y Chicanxs que organizan en sus comunidades y vamos a ir a la Convención Nacional Republicana (RNC) para amurallar al odio.

Si Trump quiere ser un creador de trabajos, pues le tenemos un programa de construcción de infraestructura planeado este verano.

En lugar de construir un muro entre nuestros países, vamos a construir un muro alrededor del odio, la xenofobia y el racismo que representa su candidatura.

No vamos a dejar que nos lleve a un tiempo antiguo el cual nunca fue grandioso para nuestras comunidades. Nos negamos sentarnos a una lado mientras se hace la historia. En lugar de tenerle miedo al futuro parecer de este país, celebraremos la imaginación y el potencial hermoso de nuestra gente.

Y eso es lo que vamos a comenzar en Cleveland: Organizadores  artistas, padres y niñxs, construirán muros simbólicos que se enfrentarán al odio y viajaran a través de la ciudad para protestar una visión tan limitada como el tamaño de las manos de Trump. 

Si puede, haga una donación para ser parte de la construcción del muro. Para hacer un frente a la intimidación y la xenofóbia. Para amurallar a Trump. “Sera hermoso." ;)



PERKS!

$2 Descargar una plantilla para hacer su propio arte


$5. Imprima su nombre en el muro

Sea un parte del muro cuando encerremos el odio en Cleveland. Incluiremos su nombre como parte del diseño.

$15 Donald Go Home, You're Drumpf

$32. Gorra: Make America Mexico Again

 

$50. Camiseta: No más Trumpadas

$250 Piñata de Trump*

*Puede ser que la piñata no sea igual a la de la foto. La usamos para darle una idea. Pero estará bonita. Hermosa. Y le encantará pegarle. 

$1.000 Cortar la cinta roja

haz el honor de cortar el liston rojo cuando construimos el muro en Cleveland.

story:
(PLEASE SCROLL DOWN FOR ENGLISH TRANSLATION)

              

DOBRODOŠLI NA INDIEGOGO KAMPANJU ROMANA PILULA SREĆE!  

 

Pridružite se i Vi kako bi ovaj roman mogao ugledati svjetlo dana!

 

Bok! Ja sam Iva Plavšić. Pilula sreće je roman o prijateljstvu, ljubavi, hrabrosti i nadi, ali i o gluposti, ponosu, strahu i predrasudama.

 

RADNJA ROMANA

 

Naša glavna junakinja Lea raste u  devedesetima u ozračju, gdje sve više mladih ljudi završava u parku s bocom u ruci. Konzervativno društvo, umjesto da im pomogne, stavlja ih na stup srama i ukazuje prstom na njih, a iza kulisa izviruje jasna činjenica da je društvo itekako svjesno svoje odgovornosti, makar je odbija priznati. Nisu samo roditelji zakazali već čitavo društvo prestaje paziti na mlade i na djecu koja se trenutno nalaze u najranjivijim godinama.

Lea i njezini prijatelji, koji usred bezbrižnog odrastanja odjednom bivaju pogođeni najsurovijom stvarnošću, pokušavaju se nositi sa svakodnevnicom na način da se priklanjaju alternativi-drugačijem načinu razmišljanja od onog kojeg čovjeku nameće
neoliberalizam. Suočavamo se i s ozračjem Leine srednje škole koja se u ratnim
vremenima nalazi u rasulu. Mnogima se ne sviđa činjenica da su upisali umjetničku školu, a po novom će programu morati završiti gimnaziju i učenici radi toga krenu u mirne demonstracije kojima apsolutno ništa ne postižu. U jednom od slijedećih poglavlja Leine školske kolege Bocu i Muca nakon akcije kojom njih dvojica pružaju konkretan otpor novom školskom režimu, vlasti u školi identificiraju i oštro kažnjavaju. Boci se uskoro gubi svaki trag i policija ga proglašava nestalim.

Zajedno s nekolicinom svojih najbližih prijatelja Lea se, poput kakve
ulične heroine, pokušava oduprijeti onima koji žele na silu promijeniti lice starog grada.

U romanu upoznajemo i Sanjina. On i Lea nađu se nekoliko puta na istim mjestima, međutim kako u njihovoj zemlji bjesni rat i oko njih je konstantno kaotična situacija, te dvije srodne duše stalno se mimoilaze. U trenutku kada se Lea i Sanjin napokon upoznaju, ona mu povjerava kako je protiv nje napravljena zavjera i da joj je život u opasnosti. Sanjin počinje shvaćati da se upleo u nešto mnogo opasnije i kompliciranije nego što je uopće mogao zamisliti ...
 

MALO O MENI

 

2001. godine objavljen mi je prvi roman „Eva-izgubljena generacija“, a već druge godine objavljuju moj drugi roman "Oporuka iz budućnosti". Moje pjesme „1991“ i „Bijeli konj“ izlaze 1997. godine u novinama. 

Pročitajte više o mojem radu na web stranici: www.pilulasrece.com  gdje možete besplatno pročitati prvih šest poglavlja novog romana "Pilula sreće." Na ovim stranicama dostupni su vam moja biografija, životopis, sinopsis romana, te skenirane, novinarske kritike prethodna dva romana.

WELCOME TO THE INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN OF THE NOVEL “THE PILL OF HAPPINESS”!
 

  You can also join, so this novel could see the daylight! 
 

Hi! My name is Iva Plavšić. “The Pill of Happiness” is a novel about friendship, love, courage and hope, but also about ignorance, pride, fear and prejudices.

 

NOVEL ACTION

 

The novel begins in the 80’ of the last century in the capital of Socialistic Republic Croatia (one of the six Yugoslav republics). Marshal Tito is dead. Some people predict military dictatorship, the others are afraid of the civil war and breakup of Yugoslavia. The action flows chronologically. The little girl called Lea is growing up in a very intense atmosphere. All adults are frightened. More and more young
people end in a park with a bottle in their hands.  The conservative society is putting them to shame. They are pointing their finger instead of helping them, and behind
the scene it is perfectly obvious that the society is aware of its responsibility but  declines to admit it. The whole society, not only the parents, stops taking care for the teenagers who are presently in the most sensitive years of their growing-up.

Lea and her friends, in the middle of their care-free youth, suddenly start to experience a most horrible reality. Amid the war they are trying to survive listening to gothic, punk rock and rock music. As the readers we confront with the environment
of her high school in a capital of Croatia (Zagreb), which is in disorder during the war.  A great number of pupils cannot adapt so suddenly to a new order: after the break of socialism Croatian authorities simply closed up their famous Art School.  The pupils do not like the fact that they have registered to a good art school and now, almost over the night, they are the pupils of the ordinary high school. Soon the pupils began to stand up for their rights in demonstrations but they have not achieved anything. After Boca’s and Muc’s
(Lea’s friends) night action in the school’s building, school’s authorities identify two fellows and punish them. Boca just vanishes one day and police proclaims his disappearance.  

Lea did not surrender, she is fighting not only for her place under the sun, but for the others, for majority!  Together with her best and closest friends, Lea is trying to contravene aggressive individuals who are planning to change the heart of her city.  She is honest, equitable, virginal and spotless, she has got a power and she is capable to turn Zagreb upside down ...  

In this novel we meet Sanjin. He and Lea appear several times in the same places, however their land is in war and around them is constantly a chaotic situation, so they miss each other. When they finally meet, two rebels instantly fall in love and the real tangle has just begun. She confides him that conspiracy has been made against her and that her life is in danger. Sanjin begins to comprehend he met with something more dangerous and complicated than he could imagine.


 A FEW WORDS ABOUT ME

 

I published the first novel called “Eva-the Lost Generation” in 2001. Next year I published a second novel called "A Testament from the Future”. In 1997’ I published two poems: „1991“ and „A White Horse“ in the newspapers. 
 

You can take a look at my art photos on web page: www.pilulasrece.com (I was working for 20 years as a photo model) but you can not read the first six chapters of my new book (it is free of cost) because it is in Croatian.  If I manage somehow to raise more money than I expected, my publisher will translate this book to English.

As the readers we confront with the environmentof her high school in a capital of Croatia (Zagreb), which is in disorder during the war.  A great number of pupils cannot adapt so suddenly to a new order: after the break of socialism Croatian authorities simply closed up their famous Art School.  The pupils do not like the fact that they have registered to a good art school and now, almost over the night, they are the pupils of the ordinary high school. Soon the pupils began to stand up for their rights in demonstrations but they have not achieved anything. After Boca’s and Muc’s(Lea’s friends) night action in the school’s building, school’s authorities identify two fellows and punish them. Boca just vanishes one day and police proclaims his disappearance.  Lea did not surrender, she is fighting not only for her place under the sun, but for the others, for majority!  Together with her best and closest friends, Lea is trying to contravene aggressive individuals who are planning to change the heart of her city.  She is honest, equitable, virginal and spotless, she has got a power and she is capable to turn Zagreb upside down ...  In this novel we meet Sanjin. He and Lea appear several times in the same places, however their land is in war and around them is constantly a chaotic situation, so they miss each other. When they finally meet, two rebels instantly fall in love and the real tangle has just begun. She confides him that conspiracy has been made against her and that her life is in danger. Sanjin begins to comprehend he met with something more dangerous and complicated than he could imagine.
 A FEW WORDS ABOUT ME I published the first novel called “Eva-the Lost Generation” in 2001. Next year I published a second novel called "A Testament from the Future”. In 1997’ I published two poems: „1991“ and „A White Horse“ in the newspapers.  You can take a look at my art photos on web page: www.pilulasrece.com (I was working for 20 years as a photo model) but you can not read the first six chapters of my new book (it is free of cost) because it is in Croatian.  If I manage somehow to raise more money than I expected, my publisher will translate this book to English.Take a close look at the gallery where I have put another four video's and some interesting photos. 
Take a look at my interview about this Indiegogo campaign You need to have FIREFOX (MOZZILA) to see my interview: MREZA TV
You can find me also on Facebook ( Iva Plavšić-The writer, Iva Plavšić-Facebook ), Twitter ( Iva Plavšić-Twitter ) and Linkedin ( Iva Plavšić-Linkedin).

If the payment through Paypal-aor a credit card makes you difficulties, please do not hesitate to contact me. I will try to find some other solution.  You can contact me on my Email address ivaaplavsic@gmail.com

If more money I raise, better it is, so I chooseflexible fond, because with that surplus my publisher can pay an English translation of my book.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Olexandr Shevchenko, I am instructor in History at the University of Manitoba and freelance translator and interpreter. I teach course “Ukrainians in Canada” and I was really thrilled when I read the book by Myrna Kostash “All of Baba’s Children”. The book is really fantastic, it captures the incredible story of Ukrainian immigrants to Canada and tells their story in their own voice. I am absolutely sure this book must be translated into Ukrainian language and made available for the readers in Ukraine. For this I need your help.

What We Need & What You Get

I need funding to help me with the expenses for translating and publishing this book. Once translation is complete I will have the book professionally edited and published. 

The Impact

The biggest impact of this project is in allowing Ukrainian readers to enjoy truly remarkable piece of Ukrainian Canadiana. Moreover, it will allow to foster better understanding between two branches of Ukrainian tree on both sides of the Atlantic Ocean. For me personally this project is a realization of my dream of many years.

Other Ways You Can Help

I would greatly appreciate if you spread the word about my campaign to your friends and relatives. If you have some other ideas that can help with this project, feel free to contact me

 

Contact information

You can contact me via email at olexandr.shevchenko@gmail.com.

story:
This Campaign is about supporting two pilgrims in their effort to raise money to publish an photo book of the seven cathedrals that make up the French Camino and their role in the lives of today’s pilgrims. The book will be shared with our supporters at the end of the pilgrimage in both hardcover and ePub format.

Who We Are

Besides being brother and sister separated by exactly four years, we both are writers and photographers. I, Michael, feel comfortable describing us this way because people paid us to write and take photos. The writing I sell is non-fiction, I have aspirations of being an author of fiction, but, so far that is all it is! My sister has written both a non-fiction book "When I Cried Out" and a fictional book "Bubba's Friends".

I owned a photography business for three years called Event Photography. It was located in Penticton, British Columbia.

I am a Canadian, a husband, father and grandfather. Lezlie is an American, mother and grandmother.

Currently I make my living through a computer company I own, Lezlie is a teacher in Redding, California.

What we are doing

We are walking over 700 kilometers from Pamplona to Santiago, Spain. We will be photographing the seven cathedrals as we walk along the Way of St. James, the Camino Frances. We will produce an illustrated book about each of the seven cathedrals and the journey to reach them and their importance to today's pilgrims. Besides the hardcover book there will be an ePub version that will be longer than the printed version that will include our day-by-day pilgrimage leading to the cathedrals.

When we are doing it

This July, beginning in Madrid on July 1 and ending in Finisterre on August 1.

Where we are doing it

The route and distances are listed here:

  • Pamplona to Logrono 95 km
  • Logrono to Santo Domingo de la Calzada 50 km
  • Santo Domingo de la Calzada to Burgos 73 km
  • Burgos to Leon 179 km
  • Leon to Astorga 48 km
  • Astorga to Santiago de Compostela 264 km

The names of the cathedrals are:

  • Pamplona Cathedral Church
  • Logrono Cathedral Parish of St. Mary of the Round
  • Santo Domingo de la Calzada Holy Cathedral
  • Burgos Holy Cathedral Church (Chapel of Santa Tecla)
  • Leon Holy Cathedral Plaza de Regla
  • Astorga Holy Cathedral
  • Santiago de Compostela - Cathedral of Santiago Obradoiro Square

Why we are doing it

Michael -

Because I love old churches and cathedrals fascinate me in so many ways, their history, their architecture, their grandeur, their spirituality, the role in the community, and, specifically for this book, their role in the lives of the pilgrims on the camino of St. James, historically and today.

Lezlie -

Dear Friends: I've leaned on my brother to put all this incredible work together. Everything he talks about doing, relates to the two of us as a team.

Here's why I’m walking. I love to travel. As a young girl, I climbed the highest pine trees and sat in them day dreaming for hours. I’d look out over the tree tops and pretend I was in a foreign country. As soon as I had my driver’s license at age 16, I was visiting major cities, and even other North American countries. I traveled during my 24-year marriage but mainly on cruise ships (not that I’m complaining.) I've also been able to travel Europe with high school groups as a leader.

So when my oldest brother, on whose birthday I was born, asked if I’d be interested in walking the Santiago pilgrimage trek from southern France to the St. James cathedral on the coast of Spain, I said, “Of course!”  I’m not walking for “religious” reasons but for relationship. I want to get to know my brother better (we live 12 hours apart, in two different countries). I also want get to know the dreams of the seekers we meet along the way as I share encouragement and hope with them.

Spiritual, I want to embrace a deeper level of who my Master Creator is. I want to experience one more of God’s European counties—the dawns and dusts of the rising and setting sun. I want to taste the fruit of the Spanish vineyards, walk the dusty roads of past and present all the while praying and pouring out what God equips me to release. I want to be a missionary interceding for all I see and meet.

How we are doing it

By walking to each cathedral city starting with Pamplona with my sister Lezlie we will record the entire pilgrimage in a journal, using video and photography all which will lead to the production of the illustrated book(s) and eBook.

Here's how I'll use the money from your sponsorship:

To purchase camera and related equipment, daily and publication expense while on the camino. To pay for the blank DVD disk, to pay for photo processing for the 5x7 and 10x15 photos for you, my sponsors, to pay for the photo books of the pilgrimage, to cover expenses at home that go on while we are away and lastly, to pay for postage and incidentals we may have forgotten.


I invite you all to follow my sister Lezlie and I on our blog page http://eyesofapilgrim.com and on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Eyes-of-a-Pilgrim/1501297163423560

story:
Hooked on Happiness: Making Teenage Dreams Come True

ENGLISH I  DEUTSCH


Over 40,000 in one week!

I want to help young people use their full potential and start doing extraordinary things. Hooked on Happiness has received over 40,000 views in the past week. There is clearly something in the air!


We need to work together to motivate and educate young people not only to survive, but also thrive outside of the classroom; to set goals and start doing extraordinary things.


In my profession as a teacher and university lecturer I meet hundreds of talented teenagers and young people every year who have no purpose in life and are totally unprepared for the real world. 


It is our job to teach teenagers and young

people how to become the best possible

individuals they can be.

 

It is our responsibility to teach them how to discover and make the most of their talents and opportunities, how to deal with problems in positive ways and how to achieve success.


There are certain fundamentals that are necessary to succeed in life, skills like goal-setting, dream-building, self-motivation, time management, and building high self-esteem, but they are not being addressed in schools or at many homes today.  

                             

It is our job to teach teenagers and young people how to become the best possible individuals they can be. It is our responsibility to teach them how to discover and make the most of their talents and opportunities, how to deal with problems in positive ways and how to achieve success.

Oprah Winfrey once said that when ordinary people do extraordinary things, they transform their lives and the lives of others around them. 

                               

Today's teens face innumerable challenges. We believe that our youth can better meet those challenges by applying principles of personal-development-enhancing skills like goal-setting, dream-building, self-motivation, time management, and creating high self-esteem and a sense of purpose and our mission is to help teens develop these skills so they can reach their full potential.

                         

We want to help teens make teens and young adults make the decision to start thinking about their future now. The aim of Hooked on Happiness is to help young people learn essential skills, like goal setting, time management, and self-motivation. 

     

Hooked on Happiness aims at helping young adults become the best possible people they can be, how to make the most of their talents and opportunities, how to deal with problems in positive ways and how to achieve success. We want young people to get Hooked on Happiness.

                               

Success in life in not about how smart or how lucky somebody is. It’s not about where somebody comes from, the neighbourhood somebody grows up in or the school somebody goes to. It’s not about how somebody looks or about how popular somebody. There is only one difference between teens who are on the path to success and those who are not: Knowing that they can create any life they want. Attitude is everything and everything starts with small steps!

                          

We want to help young people recognize their talent. We want them to be a part of something bigger. We want to show them how to make their talent their story.

We want young people to get Hooked on Happiness 

At the heart of this book is a basic truth… Everybody has a talent

This book will show teenagers and young people how to:

1)  Discover their talent

2)  Live on purpose

3)  Make a difference in their own lives and in the lives of others by getting Hooked on Happiness 

                                            



Back to top 



DEUTSCH   I  ENGLISH

Das Glück am Haken


In meiner täglichen Arbeit mit Schülern und Studenten treffe ich jedes Jahr zahlreiche junge Menschen, die keine Ziele haben oder völlig unvorbereitet ins Leben starten und durch das Leben gehen.

Wir müssen zusammen arbeiten um junge Menschen zu animieren, sich nicht nur eine Überlebensstrategie zu schaffen, sondern eine Strategie, damit sie auch ausserhalb des Klassenzimmers erfolgreich sein können. Wir wollen ihnen helfen, ihre Begabungen zu erkennen und zu wissen, wie man sie richtig umsetzt.  


Es gibt eine Reihe von Erfolgsprinzipien die man braucht, um sein Leben richtig zu meistern. Fähigkeiten wie das Setzen von Zielen, Zeitmanagement und die Fähigkeit, sich immer aufs Neue zu motivieren. Aber leider lernt man das nicht in der Schule.

 

                               

Es ist unsere Aufgabe, junge Menschen auf das Leben vorzubereiten, damit sie im Leben alles erreichen können. Es liegt in unserer Verantwortung ihnen beizubringen, wie sie ihre Talente entfalten und teil einer unglaublichen Reise sein können.

                               

Die heutige Jugend steht vor unzähligen Herausforderungen. Wir glauben, dass unsere Jugend diese Herausforderungen durch die Anwendung der Grundsätze der Persönlichkeitsentwicklung, wie Zielsetzung, Selbstmotivation, Zeitmanagement, und die Erarbeitung von einem hohen Selbstwertgefühl und einem Gefühl von Lebenssinn, besser bewältigen kann. 

Unsere Mission ist es, Jugendliche zu helfen, diese Fähigkeiten zu entwickeln, so dass sie ihr volles Potenzial erreichen können.

                         

Wir wollen jungen Menschen helfen, sich jetzt Gedanken über ihre Zukunft zu machen. Wir wollen ihnen dabei helfen, ihre Talente und Begabungen zu entdecken, damit sie darauf aufbauen können. Wir wollen jungen Menschen beibringen wie sie ihre Probleme positiv und selbständig bewältigen können und erfolgreich werden, wobei Erfolg nicht nur als etwas Materielles gesehen werden kann. 

                                

Erfolgreich kann man im Beruf sein, in der Freizeit, in Beziehungen und in der eigenen, persönlichen Entwicklung. Wir wollen, dass es sich junge Menschen holen, das Glück am Haken.

                           

Erfolg im Leben hat nichts damit zu tun, wie intelligent man ist. Es hat nichts damit zu tun, woher man kommt, wo man aufwächst, oder in welche Schule man geht. Es geht nicht darum welche Klamotten man trägt und was andere von einem halten. Es gibt nur eines, was einen erfolgreichen jungen Menschen von anderen unterscheidet: Das wissen, das ich mein Leben verändern kann. Die persönliche Einstellung ist der Schlüssel zum Erfolg!

                          

Wir wollen jungen Menschen helfen, etwas zu erreichen. Wir wollen, dass sie ein Teil von etwas Grossem sind. Wir wollen jungen Menschen helfen, unglaubliche Dinge zu vollbringen.

Dieses Buch birgt nur eine Wahrheit: Jeder hat ein Talent.

Dieses Buch zeigt jungen Menschen wie sie:

1) Ihre Begabung entdecken

2) dieses Talent ausleben, und

3) in ihrem Leben und im Leben Anderer etwas bewirken in dem sie es sich holen, DAS GLÜCK AM HAKEN

                                            


Zurück zum Anfang I Back to top
