small steps!                          We want
to help young people recognize their talent. We want them to be a
part of something bigger. We want to show them how to make their
talent their story.
We want young people to
get Hooked on Happiness 
At the heart of this book is a basic truth… Everybody has a talent
This book will show teenagers and young people how to:
1)  Discover their talent
2)  Live on purpose
3)  Make a difference in their own lives and in the lives of others
by getting Hooked
on Happiness                                             Back to top DEUTSCH   I  ENGLISH

Das Glück am HakenIn meiner täglichen Arbeit mit Schülern und Studenten treffe ich jedes Jahr zahlreiche junge Menschen, die keine Ziele haben oder völlig unvorbereitet ins Leben starten und durch das Leben gehen.
Wir müssen zusammen arbeiten um junge Menschen zu animieren, sich nicht nur eine Überlebensstrategie zu schaffen, sondern eine Strategie, damit sie auch ausserhalb des Klassenzimmers erfolgreich sein können. Wir wollen ihnen helfen, ihre Begabungen zu erkennen und zu wissen, wie man sie richtig umsetzt.  
Es gibt eine Reihe von Erfolgsprinzipien die man braucht, um sein Leben richtig zu meistern. Fähigkeiten wie das Setzen von Zielen, Zeitmanagement und die Fähigkeit, sich immer aufs Neue zu motivieren. Aber leider lernt man das nicht in der Schule.                                
Es ist unsere Aufgabe, junge Menschen auf das Leben vorzubereiten, damit sie im Leben alles erreichen können. Es liegt in unserer Verantwortung ihnen beizubringen, wie sie ihre Talente entfalten und teil einer unglaublichen Reise sein können.                               Die heutige Jugend steht vor unzähligen Herausforderungen. Wir glauben, dass unsere Jugend diese Herausforderungen durch die Anwendung der Grundsätze der Persönlichkeitsentwicklung, wie Zielsetzung, Selbstmotivation, Zeitmanagement, und die Erarbeitung von einem hohen Selbstwertgefühl und einem Gefühl von Lebenssinn, besser bewältigen kann. 
Unsere Mission ist es,
Jugendliche zu helfen, diese Fähigkeiten zu entwickeln, so dass sie ihr volles
Potenzial erreichen können.                         
Wir wollen jungen Menschen helfen, sich jetzt Gedanken über ihre Zukunft zu machen. Wir wollen ihnen dabei helfen, ihre Talente und Begabungen zu entdecken, damit sie darauf aufbauen können. Wir wollen jungen Menschen beibringen wie sie ihre Probleme positiv und selbständig bewältigen können und erfolgreich werden, wobei Erfolg nicht nur als etwas Materielles gesehen werden kann.                                 Erfolgreich kann man im Beruf sein, in der Freizeit, in Beziehungen und in der eigenen, persönlichen Entwicklung. Wir wollen, dass es sich junge Menschen holen, das Glück am Haken.                           Erfolg im Leben hat nichts damit zu tun, wie intelligent man ist. Es hat nichts damit zu tun, woher man kommt, wo man aufwächst, oder in welche Schule man geht. Es geht nicht darum welche Klamotten man trägt und was andere von einem halten. Es gibt nur eines, was einen erfolgreichen jungen Menschen von anderen unterscheidet: Das wissen, das ich mein Leben verändern kann. Die persönliche Einstellung ist der Schlüssel zum Erfolg!                          
Wir wollen jungen Menschen
helfen, etwas zu erreichen. Wir wollen, dass sie ein Teil von etwas Grossem sind. Wir
wollen jungen Menschen helfen, unglaubliche Dinge zu vollbringen.
Dieses Buch birgt nur eine
Wahrheit: Jeder hat ein Talent. 
Dieses Buch zeigt jungen Menschen
wie sie:
1) Ihre Begabung entdecken
2) dieses Talent ausleben,
und
3) in ihrem Leben und im
Leben Anderer etwas bewirken in dem sie es sich holen, DAS
GLÜCK AM HAKEN

story:
Qu’est-ce que Rutabaga Magazine ?

Rutabaga est un magazine en ligne axé sur la cuisine végétarienne et un style de vie urbain et conscientisé.

Étant photographe et passionnée de cuisine, j’ai voulu partager en images mon intérêt pour la cuisine santé.

Je cherchais une manière de faire les choses différemment. Comme le magazine est un type de parution qui m’inspire beaucoup, je me suis entourée d’une équipe et nous avons développé l’idée d’un magazine Web. Nous voulions que le lecteur conserve les mêmes sensations que lorsqu’il reçoit une revue par la poste : l’attente entre les saisons, l’excitation de le feuilleter d’un couvert à l’autre, puis se laisser tenter par une recette ou un article.

Nous avons donc travaillé sur une première version afin de pouvoir présenter notre idée et observer la réaction des gens.

Ayant reçu l’encouragement souhaité pour poursuivre, nous sommes maintenant prêt à entamer la deuxième phase du projet dans laquelle nous souhaitons produire cinq (5) numéros et faire plusieurs améliorations au site. Tout ce qui nous manque, c’est votre support !


What is Rutabaga Magazine?

Rutabaga is an online magazine that is all about vegetarian and healthy cooking, as well as living a conscious urban lifestyle.

Being a photographer and a food aficionado, I wanted to combine those two interests and share with the rest of the world my passion for healthy recipes.

I was looking for a way to do things a little differently. Since the magazine is a medium that inspires me a lot, I surrounded myself with a talented team and we developed the idea of creating a Web magazine. We wanted the readers to feel the same way they do when they receive their favourite issue through the mail: the wait between seasons, the excitement of reading it from cover to cover and then being inspired to try and cook one of the recipes or read an article.

So we worked hard on a first issue so as to be able to show the world our idea and see what kind of feedback we would get.

Fortunately, we have received enough love from you to decide to continue with the project and we are now ready to start the second phase of the magazine, in which we wish to produce five more issues and improve the website. All we are missing is your support!



À quoi ressemble la deuxième phase du projet ?

Suite au lancement des deux premiers magazines, nous avons recueillis plusieurs commentaires et avons une longue liste de modifications et améliorations à apporter au site Web, notamment une plus grande compatibilité avec les différents appareils (mobiles, tablettes, etc.), une meilleure ergonomie et navigation, et un look général rehaussé.

Par ailleurs, au cours de la prochaine année, nous aimerions produire cinq magazines, dont un numéro spécial imprimé !


What we want to do in phase two?

After the launch of the two first magazines, we gathered a lot of comments and suggestions. They helped us build a list of edits and features we want to apply on the platform, like a better support for different devices (phones, tablets, etc.), a better user experience and navigation, as well as a enhanced overall look and feel.

Within the next year, we are also planning to produce five new issues, including a special printed volume!


À quoi servira le financement ?

Votre don servira à financer directement la création du contenu des magazines, des recettes, en plus de nous aider à améliorer et à maintenir la plateforme Web.

Afin de continuer à vous fournir les magazines web gratuitement, nous avons besoin d’un coup de pouce pour la production de ceux-ci. Chaque élaboration de magazine engendre des coûts plutôt élevés : recherche et développement, achat de nourriture pour créer les recettes, shooting photo, stylisme culinaire, location d’équipement et d’accessoires, etc.

Par ailleurs, la phase deux de la plateforme Web nous demandera de nombreuses heures de travail, en plus de continuer la maintenance et l’intégration des magazines.


How we would use the money?

Your donation will help directly finance content and recipes creation, while also contributing to maintaining and working on the website.

Even thought we aim to keep the web issues free, we do need your help to make them come to life. Each volume means we spend a considerable amount of money in research and development, food to create the recipes, photoshoots, food stylism, equipment and accessories rentals, etc.

Also, phase two of the website will require a lot of design and development hours, on top of the normal maintenance and integration of the platform.


Ce que vous pouvez recevoir en échange de votre appui ?

Une carte recette : Il s’agit d’une de nos photos préférée, format carte postale, avec la recette à l’endos. Accrochez-la au mur ou utilisez-la de façon pratique sur votre frigo !

Un sac à lait de noix : Vous pourrez maintenant faire votre propre lait de noix...vous verrez c’est encore plus simple que vous pensez ! Essayez la recette de lait d'amandes et sésame :  http://www.rutabagamag.com/recettes/lait-damand...

Un magazine imprimé : Nous produirons une édition spéciale imprimée, dont la sortie est prévue pour le mois de septembre. On y retrouvera quelques-unes des meilleures recettes, de nouveaux articles et recettes exclusives... et bien sûr de belles photos :)


What are the perks?

A recipe postal card: One of our favorite recipes, in a postal card format with the recipe on the flipside. Pin it to your wall or stick it on the fridge!

A nut milk bag: You will now be able to make your own nut milk… And it is way easier than you might think! Try the Almond and Sesame Milk recipe : http://www.rutabagamag.com/en/recipes/almond-an...

A printed magazine: We will print a special edition of the magazine, which should come out at the end of September. It will include some of our best recipes, new articles and exclusive recipes… And of course beautiful pictures :)



* * *


Vous voulez devenir collaborateur(trice) de Rutabaga Magazine ?

Rutabaga Magazine est constamment à la recherche de nouveaux collaborateurs et nous serions heureux de vous faire une place dans l’équipe ! Vous aimeriez écrire, élaborer des recettes, gérer les médias sociaux, nous aider à la gestion et coordination, à la recherche de subventions ? Vous êtes styliste, artiste coiffeuse et maquilleuse, développeur Web, intégrateur ? N’hésitez pas à nous proposer vos idées de collaboration en nous faisant parvenir un courriel à info@rutabagamag.com.


Want to become a collaborator?

Rutabaga Magazine is always looking for new collaborators and we would be delighted to have you in the team! You would like to write, cook, manage social networks and projects? You are a stylist, make-up artist or Web developper?

Please do not hesitate to shoot us an email with your ideas at info@rutabagamag.com.


Vous représentez une compagnie ?

Vous pouvez nous joindre directement au info@rutabagamag.com pour de plus amples informations sur les prix réservés exclusivement aux compagnies.


Your represent a company?

You can email directly to info@rutabagamag.com for more info on the commercial perks.

story:
I had a beautiful dream a year and a half ago and told my niece and mother about the stunning half dragonfly girl I met in my dream.My niece and Mother said; that should be a book, and so Idecide to turn it into a story.A year and a half later The Dragonfly Kingdoms: Discovery Book One is now in the editing stages!
 
A little about me:

Nicole Jamison is a graduate of The International Academy of Design & Technology, and currently resides in sunny Florida. She is an artist, and enjoys writing, painting, sewing, theater and jewelry making. The Dragonfly Kingdoms is Nicole’s first book series. @nikkiloreal ( follow me on twitter)

With the help of kind strangers I will be able to see this dream all the way through!
 
The total cost for my to self publish my book is $3500. Some of the things this money will cover are editing, cover design, promoting and isbn #

Everyone one who donates $25.00 or more will get a signed copy of the book and thank you card !

I understand that money is tight for some, so some other ways you could help me is to spread the word and post this link which is a amazon preview of The Dragonfly Kingdoms
 
https://www.createspace.com/Preview/1120113

I wanna Thank you all in advance for all your help in making this dream real!

Nicole

story:
ABOUT THE PROJECT

Nepalese in Photography is a magazine conceptualized by group of youngsters after realizing Nepal does not have a photography magazine that focuses on trends, styles and different topics regarding photography. After starting Nepalese in Photography group in Facebook in 2007, we saw Nepali youth -- living in Nepal and abroad, are very much interested in photography and have been involved in it as a professional or as their passion. Our next move was to start a magazine that will focus on everything related to photography.

As soon as the idea was floated many interested in the project quit their job as journalists and designers in different organizations to come together and work on something that was closer to their heart. And it's not only the youth of Nepal but also some friends and Facebook page members from Australia are interested in the project and are getting involved in this magazine to make it a complete photography magazine.

Nepalese in Photography will not only cover various aspects of photography, but also will be a perfect platform to encourage and guide amateur photographers into the world of photography. As it is a new and one of its kind projects, it might take us a while to capture the market and bring in advertisement for our magazine. So for couple of months, we will be working without pay check, foundation grants, advisory boards or independently wealthy vanity investors—for now, at least.

To start a magazine is not easy but with passion towards writing and photography, brought together group of enthusiastic co founder, editors, reporters and photographers to give up their well paying salary and start working for this project. For next few months we will be focusing on bringing out a quality magazine with original articles, feature writings, interviews, and breath taking photo features.

We’re in the process of recruiting a diverse team of passionate contributors. 

PEOPLE BEHIND IT

Abhilasha Subba (Editor)

Worked for the national daily, The Himalayan Times, from 2006 to 2012. Started as trainee journalist in 2006 and later promoted to the post of Senior Sub Editor in 2010. Was part of TGIF (weekly weekend supplementary of The Himalayan Times) and features department that looks after the variety section, which covers lifestyle, feature stories and entertainment. From August 2011 till August 2012 headed TGIF as department head.

Alok Thapa (Senior Feature Writer)

Has been working as a radio presenter at Hits FM 91.2 for almost 10 years.Worked as a reporter/writer at CyberSansar.com from 2009-2011. Worked a correspondent for Republica national daily. Currently a senior feature writer at Pagoda Labs Pvt. LTD.

Supriya Pradhan (Reporter/Writer)

Has been working as a radio presenter at Hits FM 91.2 since 2006. Worked as a reporter/writer at Cybersansar.com from 2009-2011.Worked as a sub-editor for The Himalayan Times – TGIF.Currently working as reporter/writer at Pagoda Labs PVT. LTD.

DESIGN AND PRODUCTION

Shoki Shakya (Founder Partner Nepalese in photography magazine)

VP of business development at Pagoda labs Pvt ltd. CEO at Nepalese in photography

Vivek Basnet  (Founder Partner Nepalese in photography magazine)

Professional photographer based in Sydney Australia. Founder / partner of Nepalese in photography group on facebook. Technical writer for Nepalese in photography magazine

Kewal Rai (technical writer for Nepalese in photography magazine)

New gears reviewer and technical writer for Nepalese in photography. Head of photography for kgarira.com Australia. Professional photographer based in Sydney

Amit Bajracharya (Creative Director at Pagoda Labs)

Web and print media direction

Salya Howald Tamang (Head of Designing)

Art director at Pagoda labs. Head of  magazine layout and print

Sampurna Manandhar (head of photography)

Directs teams of photographers for the magazine in Nepal. Works in conjunction with the editor in chief. Director of photography at Pagoda labs Pvt ltd. Key photographer at Navyaata magazine.

Buddha Singh (Photographer)

Team photographer at Nepalese in photography

Phurbu Tsering Gurung (Photographer)

Worked with Navyaata magazine from Feb-Oct 2010. Produced two stories with the Photo Circle during the workshops conducted by them. Both the story is regarding the “internal-migrant worker”, one is done in Bangladesh, at Sirajgong. Currently he is involved with Nepalese in photography and doing his personal project on “family” and “illness”. 

MARKETING AND SALES

Nischal Bajracharya (Marketing and promotions)

Marking and promotions director for  Pagoda labs Pvt limited and Nepalese in photography. Business strategist

Navaneeta Amatya (Head of Marketing and Sales)

Has been working in the media for the past 5 years. Radio Presenter at Hits Fm 91.2 since 2007. Event Coordinator and official Master of Ceremonies at Kgarira Marketing and Promotions Pvt Ltd. as an since 2010. Writer at Nepalese in Photography. Head of Marketing and sales at Pagoda Labs Pvt Ltd. since 2011.

 

WHAT WILL THE MAGAZINE HAVE?

Write ups on various concepts, themes and styles and methods of photography, interviews of Nepali and well known international photographers, introduction of upcoming photographers, various photography related events, their post and pre-coverage, information on latest technologies and equipment  And many other regular and special coverage on photography.

 

WHAT WILL THE FIRST ISSUE OF THE MAGAZINE HAVE?

       

HOW WILL YOU SPEND THE MONEY?

The money we're raising on Indiegogo will go to start-up costs. Our biggest costs are design and printing, but there are several smaller costs: Branding, websites, postage and packaging expenses.  The money will go into the printing of the first and second issue of the magazine and towards the development of a website Nepalese in Photography            

 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you are unable to give money at this time, please help by spreading the word via:

  • Share this Indiegogo campaign on Facebook, Twitter & other social media 
  • Email friends/ family and anyone interested in supporting the first photography magazine in Nepal
  • Anything to spread the word!

Thank you for your help!

Directs teams of photographers for the magazine in Nepal. Works in conjunction with the editor in chief. Director of photography at Pagoda labs Pvt ltd. Key photographer at Navyaata magazine.
Buddha Singh (Photographer)
Team photographer at Nepalese in photography
Phurbu Tsering Gurung (Photographer)
Worked with Navyaata magazine from Feb-Oct 2010. Produced two stories with the Photo Circle during the workshops conducted by them. Both the story is regarding the “internal-migrant worker”, one is done in Bangladesh, at Sirajgong. Currently he is involved with Nepalese in photography and doing his personal project on “family” and “illness”. 
MARKETING AND SALES
Nischal Bajracharya (Marketing and promotions)
Marking and promotions director for  Pagoda labs Pvt limited and Nepalese in photography. Business strategist
Navaneeta Amatya (Head of Marketing and Sales)
Has been working in the media for the past 5 years. Radio Presenter at Hits Fm 91.2 since 2007. Event Coordinator and official Master of Ceremonies at Kgarira Marketing and Promotions Pvt Ltd. as an since 2010. Writer at Nepalese in Photography. Head of Marketing and sales at Pagoda Labs Pvt Ltd. since 2011.
 
WHAT WILL THE MAGAZINE HAVE?

Write ups on various concepts, themes and styles and methods of photography, interviews of Nepali and well known international photographers, introduction of upcoming photographers, various photography related events, their post and pre-coverage, information on latest technologies and equipment  And many other regular and special coverage on photography.
 
WHAT WILL THE FIRST ISSUE OF THE MAGAZINE HAVE?

       
HOW WILL YOU SPEND THE MONEY?
The money we're raising on Indiegogo will go to start-up costs. Our biggest costs are design and printing, but there are several smaller costs: Branding, websites, postage and packaging expenses.  The money will go into the printing of the first and second issue of the magazine and towards the development of a website Nepalese in Photography            
 
 


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP


If you are unable to give money at this time, please help by spreading the word via:

Share this Indiegogo campaign on Facebook, Twitter & other social media 
Email friends/ family and anyone interested in supporting the first photography magazine in Nepal
Anything to spread the word!

Thank you for your help!

story:
“Embracing your wholeness is the greatest gift you can give to others. Being sustained fully as you are right now, leaves you empty of grasping to the world to fill yourself up. Being already full, you are free to just be yourself, as you are, moment by moment. When you don’t need anything from the world, or from other people, everything you do is service.” - Christine Wushke

 

Short Summary

You are invited to be part of the release of a powerful book on transformation being published by Inner Splendor Media in the fall of 2013.

Inner Splendor is a company that produces quality audio and video for yoga, meditation, relaxation and sleep aid. We are beginning to venture into publishing books and would like to invite you to be part of the journey.  

The book is called Freedom is Your Nature: A Practical Guide to Transformation. 

This is an extraordinary new and important work on the inner journey written by Christine Wushke, a woman whose life has seen a series of classical spiritual encounters and experiences. In these pages, she shares with us her amazing revelations, their intoxicating sweetness, and their life-giving fruit.

But the book is more than the just the fascinating story of Christine’s own spiritual growth, for it unfolds for the reader a renewed understanding of life in general, accompanied by practical exercises that anyone can use to begin to change their own inner landscape — and with it — their outer world.

Using parables, stories, experiences, and insights from her meditations, she takes the reader on a double-decker journey: both hers and their own.

What We Need & What You Get

The book is already written and edited. The additional funding we seek is for the printing of the hardcover edition and for complementing our marketing and Public Relations budget.

For being part of the team, we are offering all sort of perks and extras. 

The perks come at different levels and some include: 

  • Signed Edition of the hardcover book
  • Donation of books to individuals in prisons who are interested in meditation.
  • Audio and Video products for Yoga and Meditation
  • Limited Edition 11x14 C print.
  • An exclusive 6 week meditation course 
  • One on one Skype sessions with Christine
  • And at the top levels we will have your name at the aknowledgments in the book or you can even be part of our next yoga and meditation retreat in Hawaii!

The campaign will allow us to print the first 3,500 copies of the hardcover edition of the book and will contribute towards the cost of hiring a publicist and creating the website for the book.

Any amount helps us get to the goal!

The Impact

We stand behind the content of the book and have experienced that the wisdom being shared works! This is information that needs to be properly shared with the world.

Inner Splendor has a solid record of delivering products that are uplifting in nature. We have released dozens of successful albums for our artists, including Music For Deep Meditation, Music for Deep Sleep, and Splendor of Meditation, some of which have been on the top charts for New Age and World Music. We also have several Yoga DVDs available.

Freedom is Your Nature is already edited and laid out. We also have an edition in Spanish. We just need your help for the final push to get this beautiful work out into the world.

Other Ways You Can Help!

You can also help us by sharing this campaign with all of your friends on Facebook, Twitter, or face to face! To keep updated on our products, you can like Music for Deep Meditation on Facebook: www.facebook.com/MusicForDeepMeditation

 

Here is what people have said about the book:

“Freedom is Your Nature is a simple and profound explanation of the teachings of yoga and how we can apply them to our lives. Read this book slowly and take time to digest each concept because they are all highly concentrated gems of wisdom.” - Desiree Rumbaugh

“An awakened Yogini is still a rarity these days when yoga is on everyone's lips, and Christine is certainly one of the rare ones” - Igor Kufayev

“Out of a hundred or so spiritual books read in 15 years, there's only two other authors - both world famous - that drove me back to re-read several times. Christine's Freedom is Your Nature is one of the simplest yet most effective books I have found. Through a compelling set of insights and techniques she helps me to better embody and live the consciousness that I am in my daily life; her teachings have impacted and made a substantial difference in my life.” – Giampaolo

"Christine Wushke beautifully explores one of the most compelling questions of life: How do we emerge from suffering and transform ourselves with real, encompassing wisdom and love? This book doesn't focus solely on turning inward for the elusive answers. Instead, she encourages us to find hope, healing and inspiration by connecting with her own experiences and practical applications. I found Freedom is Your Nature to be deeply personal, refreshing, and insightful." - Sam Chahda, Owner, Yoga Elements Okotoks

story:
Summary

The Authors’ Zone is the place to go for recognition of your book in the form of awards-and the place to go in person and on line for education and support. We will recognize authors, give them guidance and introduce them to a national and international audience.

Do You Love Books? Do you wish there were MORE Good- books?

Then you are going to love this!

The Author Zone supports and encourages writers/authors on their journey, and YOU can help!

The Author Zone (TAZ) will be hosting their first ever award ceremony for authors on October 16th, 2014.

This is the kick-off to an amazing series of gatherings, on-line webinars and the offering of tons of information that writers need.

Authors need support. They need information, encouragement, and comradeship of other authors.

You can help!

Whether you are an author or reader, the awards ceremony will be a fun event.

It is more than an awards ceremony. It is THE place to go to find information and have a positive experience! Celebrate with the Award winners and share your enthusiasm for writing and good books!

On October 16th, 2014, make great connections with those who have the information authors need!

Editing/proofreading/graphic design/self, subsidy and traditional publishing representatives will be there. The Authors Zone Awards Ceremony will have great speakers, fantastic educational materials, great food and great company!

What we need

But we need your help!

TAZ needs $7,500 to host this event and subsidize future on-line webinars and scholarships for aspiring writers. Our webinars will cover topics like: How to market your book-How to identify a good editor-Steps to creating your ultimate writing space-How to find a good agent-Traditional Subsidy or self- publishing? The money will also help to cover:

  • Awards

  • Speakers

  • Venue

  • Improvements to the web site

  • Book reveiws

If you cannot join us in Pittsburgh the evening of October 16th, 2014 you will be interested in one or more of our webinars and you can still help!

Your donation will be put to good use and SO appreciated!

What you get

Donations of any amount will help and there are special gifts for donations of $25 or more.

  • Donation of $25 will help pay for educational materials for writers and will pay your admission to the first webinar this winter!

  • Donation of $50 will help with the event cost and YOU will receive a tee shirt with the TAZ logo and admission to the winter webinar

  • Donation of $100 will give you a ticket to the Awards Event, submission of your book, a tee shirt and a written thank you in the program.

  • Donations of $500 will get you a ticket to the event, admission to all four webinars-acknowledgement in the program and on the web site and submission of your book this year or next year.

Let’s help writers learn how to take their writing from that first written page to being published!

Here's how to donate:

Even if you are unable to contribute, we would love it if you could help us spread the word!

Email: info@theauthorszone.com (Donor/Sponsor inquiries welcome!)

Facebook and Twitter users are our best forms of communication. You can assist us in increasing our reach to literary patrons, bookstores, businesses, and corporations. Make them aware that this is a great contribution to the literary scene in Pittsburgh PA. and beyond.

Twitter; #theauthorszone

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/authorszone

Who we are:

Anna Marie Petrarca Gire, & Yvonne Phillips

Yvonne Phillips

President | Creative Color & Design

412-215-8247

YvonnePhillips1@aol.com  

Yvonne Phillips is an innovative Feng Shui color and design consultant, author, speaker and featured media guest with expertise in visual merchandising and promotional marketing.. Through Creative Color & Design, Yvonne and her staff provide Feng Shui analysis, training and consulting for businesses and corporations

Anna Marie Petrarca Gire has been publishing Women’s Independent Press (WIP) since 2003. First as a general interest newspaper distributed in Pittsburgh PA and Champaign IL until 2005. In 2006 it was reinvented into The Women’s Yellow Pages, a magazine with articles/ads/resources distributed throughout Southwestern PA. In 2009 the WIP was reintroduced as an on line news magazine.

412-563-6712

wip@fastmail.fm

.

story:
UPDATE- 10/4

A heartfelt THANK YOU to each and every contributor! The second full set of proofs has returned to the editor with only a handful of changes to be made before Carried Away goes to press. The book is still on track to be completed by the end of November, at which point all perks will be fulfilled. Again, thank you for contributing and please feel free to visit my blog for new wrapscapes (to be featured in a second edition) and updates: Carried Away Baby 

The Birth of a Wrapscape

Many new moms aren't aware that there are baby carriers beyond the aisles of the local department store. Among them are woven wraps, readily available online, which are quickly gaining popularity due to how comfortable, ergonomic, and adjustable they are for babies and toddlers of all sizes.

I began collecting woven wraps before my son was even born. As my collection grew I began to imagine what beautiful scenes, or "wrapscapes", I could create. So many colors and patterns exist in the wrap world, and my collection contained a variety of both.

There isn't enough room in our small apartment for me to paint like I loved to do before becoming a mommy, so creating "art" on the living room floor out of my woven wraps has become an enjoyable substitute. I twist, layer, and fold them carefully (all measure about 5-6 yards long) and find a way to incorporate my sweet baby boy into each one. I then teeter precariously from our recliner with my camera extended as high and far as my arm can reach to capture the scene.

I love being able to create magical moments on film for me and my son to enjoy long after he's too big to be worn.


Carried Away is a collection of these wrapscapes, each accompanied by a nursery rhyme or short poem that I have written. The full-color book is sure to entertain your heart and warm your soul. 

What is Needed

Funds will go toward the self-publication of Carried Away, including the following:

  • Professional cover design
  • Editing of text and photography
  • Page formatting
  • ISBN acquisition
  • Production and promotion
  • Shipping and distribution of hard copies
  • Creation and distribution of eBook 

I am already in contact with a self-publishing company with whom I have worked previously on a collection of inspirational poetry. They have a phenomenal team of designers and editors and are sure to produce a beautiful, quality book that will be cherished for years to come.


Spread the Word

  • I would greatly appreciate your sharing the campaign far and wide! Even if you cannot contribute financially, word of mouth is a powerful thing and allows the book to reach as many hands as possible. Thank you in advance for spreading the word about Carried Away!

story:
About the Journey

How do you get to know the soul of a country? Through its people.

In the summer of 2014 sisters, Naomi and Grace Hatton will be setting off on a road trip across the USA to collect stories and images of every day Americans. These stories and portraits will be collected and presented in a book entitled Meeting America.

As a photographer and a writer we decided to combine our talents to create the Meeting America project. We will be visiting 18 states ranging from Florida to New York and Texas to Oregon. This trip will literally take us the breadth of the country. As we visit each city and place on our list we will be interviewing and photographing the interesting people we meet along the way asking questions like What does the American dream mean to you? We will also be volunteering with charities at each stop.

The goal of Meeting America is to present a realistic and moving portrait of the American people as a whole by meeting people of different ages, races and social standing all over the country.  However in order for this trip to happen we need your help. We have three goals that we need to reach in order to visit everywhere we've planned.

Goal 1: $5,000

  • With this funding we will be able to travel up the East Coast
  • 12 days on the road.
  • The project will be done, just on a smaller scale. 
  • We will only be able to create an ebook version

Goal 2: +$5,000

  • With this funding we will be able to travel up the east coast and through the Midwest.
  • 25 days on the road
  • We're nearly all the way there.
  • We Will be able to create an ebook and possibly a paperback

Goal 3: +$5,000

  • We will get to all 18 states and 39 sites!
  • 35-45 Days on the road.
  • All publishing funded for ebook, paperback, and hardback
  • We Did It!!!!

Who Are We?

Naomi and Grace Hatton are new American citizens, moving here in 2003 from the United Kingdom and finally receiving their citizenship this year! As new citizens of this amazing and diverse country we really wanted to see all the unique and interesting places in the United States. But more than that we want to truly get to know the country that we have chosen to become a part of and the best way to do that is through meeting Americans all over the country. And in turn discovering what it truly means to be American.

The road trip (if all three rounds are funded) will be a 45 day adventure to 18 states and 39 stops. These places were chosen due to their cultural significance to the country as well being spread out across very different landscapes. The trip will be about 10,000 miles of roads starting in Orlando, FL, going to the south of Florida and all the way up the east coast, across many mid states, to the west coast and back to Florida.

Along the way we will be meeting people at random restaurants, stores, festivals, museums and all the other places we will stop along the way. We will interview people asking them what it means to be American and then we will be taking a portrait of them to go along with the interview. We are hoping to interview at least one person a day to give ourselves a true sense of the sentiments of each place we go. We will also interview an active servicemen or veteran in each state that we go, as they are the American heroes.

Through these interviews and portraits we will create a tapestry of images and quotes that represent the breadth and diversity of this country.

What Makes it Unique

This trip is not just about us, it’s about you and creating a project that people can be involved with. It’s an interactive project. During the trip we want our supporters and followers to be involved with shaping the trip. Followers will have voting rights and will get daily/weekly emails. In these e-mails we will offers a few choices for what we want to do in the city/place we are visiting as well as a couple of charities we are considering volunteering with. It will then be up to our supporters to vote on what we should do. Everyone will get a chance to be involved. We will also have “spot the car” competitions where people can try snap the Meeting America car and will get prizes and shout-outs on social media.

What We Need

We need to fund the book project and trip as a car does not run on water alone:

We need to raise money for two parts. 

  • The first is the journey: we need to put gas in the car, a bed to sleep in every night, and food would be nice!
  • The second is the book itself, we need to fund printing and design
  • If we do not reach our goal and cannot go on the road trip we will donate the raised funds to a charity that helps veterans, as they are the true American Heroes!

The Impact

Without your contribution this project will NOT happen!

  • This project will give unparalleled insight into America from a unique and authentic perspective.
  • We will be able to showcase the everyday Americans who are heroic, beautiful, inspiring, one of a kind and rare that make this country so wonderful.
  • With your support we will be able to produce an e-book and book that puts together all the portraits and interviews in one lovely presentation.
  • This project will last far beyond this trip and will an unprecedented experiment in human connection across the length of a country. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out! Invite your friends 
  • Share this page on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Follow our blog at meetingamericablog.wordpress.com

If you have any questions about the project feel free to contact us and we will get back to you personally. We want Meeting America to be a truly interactive and collaborative effort, you are part of the creation of this project and we can’t wait to get started. Thank you in advance for your support.

Goal 3: +$5,000

We will get to all 18 states and 39 sites!
35-45 Days on the road. 
All publishing funded for ebook, paperback, and hardback
We Did It!!!!
Who Are We? 
Naomi and Grace Hatton are new
American citizens, moving here in 2003 from the United Kingdom and finally
receiving their citizenship this year! As new citizens of this amazing and
diverse country we really wanted to see all the unique and interesting places
in the United States. But more than that we want to truly get to know the
country that we have chosen to become a part of and the best way to do that is
through meeting Americans all over the country. And in turn discovering what it
truly means to be American. 
The road trip (if all three rounds
are funded) will be a 45 day adventure to 18 states and 39 stops. These places
were chosen due to their cultural significance to the country as well being
spread out across very different landscapes. The trip will be about 10,000 miles
of roads starting in Orlando, FL, going to the south of Florida and all the way
up the east coast, across many mid states, to the west coast and back to
Florida. 
Along the way we will be meeting
people at random restaurants, stores, festivals, museums and all the other
places we will stop along the way. We will interview people asking them what it
means to be American and then we will be taking a portrait of them to go along
with the interview. We are hoping to interview at least one person a day to give
ourselves a true sense of the sentiments of each place we go. We will also
interview an active servicemen or veteran in each state that we go, as they are
the American heroes.
Through these interviews and
portraits we will create a tapestry of images and quotes that represent the
breadth and diversity of this country.
What Makes it Unique 
This trip is not just about us, it’s
about you and creating a project that people can be involved with. It’s an
interactive project. During the trip we want our supporters and followers to be
involved with shaping the trip. Followers will have voting rights and will get
daily/weekly emails. In these e-mails we will offers a few choices for what we
want to do in the city/place we are visiting as well as a couple of charities
we are considering volunteering with. It will then be up to our supporters to
vote on what we should do. Everyone will get a chance to be involved. We will
also have “spot the car” competitions where people can try snap the Meeting
America car and will get prizes and shout-outs on social media.
What
We Need 
We need to fund the book project and
trip as a car does not run on water alone:
We need to raise money for two
parts. 

The first is the journey: we need to put gas in the
     car, a bed to sleep in every night, and food would be nice!
The second is the book itself, we need to fund printing
     and design
If we do not reach our goal and cannot go on the road
     trip we will donate the raised funds to a charity that helps veterans, as
     they are the true American Heroes!
The
Impact
Without your contribution this
project will NOT happen!

This project will give unparalleled insight into
     America from a unique and authentic perspective.
We will be able to showcase the everyday Americans who
     are heroic, beautiful, inspiring, one of a kind and rare that make this
     country so wonderful. 
With your support we will be able to produce an e-book
     and book that puts together all the portraits and interviews in one lovely
     presentation. 
This project will last far beyond this trip and will an
     unprecedented experiment in human connection across the length of a
     country.  

Other
Ways You Can Help

Get the word out! Invite your friends 
Share this page on Facebook and Twitter.
Follow our blog at meetingamericablog.wordpress.com 
If you have any questions about the
project feel free to contact us and we will get back to you personally. We want
Meeting America to be a truly interactive and collaborative effort, you are
part of the creation of this project and we can’t wait to get started. Thank
you in advance for your support.

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Disturbing Truth

We all know child abuse happens. But like most of us, I somehow thought it only happened to 'other people' and occurred in 'poor' families or third world countries.

But I was so wrong. It happens all around us.

I was shocked when my friend confided in me that she had been raped by her father when she was just five years old.

How could this be? She comes from an affluent family, her father is a lawyer and her mother is a doctor. Surely this hideous crime couldn't go on and nobody notice?

But it did, and it still does. Millions of innocent children around the world are having their lives shattered and bodies broken by the ones that are supposed to protect them.

My friend's story is terrible, and I am the only person she has told. It came out over a couple of tearful months, and I was horrified.

When she said that it was still happening 14 years later I became very angry and wanted to do something, but what? Report him, expose him, beat him up?

My friend won't let me do any of those things. She still has some kind of misplaced loyalty to her father and won't let me do anything that might give him reason to hit her even more.

But I have to do something. I have to try to make a difference to the millions of abused children around the world, and maybe even prevent it from happening to some of those innocent treasures.

I want the world to know that child abuse doesn't just happen in poor families or third world countries. It happens everywhere and must be exposed so that it can't damage more children.

I am going to write my friend's story and publish it as a book. I won't identify her of course. But I will shock you with what has happened to her. Her abuse is far worse than I have said already and will make you cry. I still do.

I want the world to know that this could be happening down your street, next door, or maybe even in your own house.

I plan to use the funds raised to pay for a talented writer who can take this story and turn it into a gripping account of my friend's life that will shock people into action against this terrible crime.

This book will be written even if I don't get any funding. But the more I get, the more I will be able to pay for writers and editors to improve my work.

I have contacted a couple of writers and editors already who support this project and will moderate their cost to help get the job done.

Secondary Goals

  • If enough money is raised I will also build a website as a resource centre to help those that need it the most, the victims and survivors of child abuse.
  • And who knows, if a miracle happens and the money rolls in, I might even be able to fund a short film.

No Money? No Problem!

I know what it means to be short on cash and that not everyone can donate money.

But that doesn’t mean that you can’t help stop this crime against our children. You really can help by just doing a few simple things.

  • Tell people about our project so they can help spread the word
  • Email, tweet and post on facebook the link to this campaign.
  • If you’re a blogger, write about us.
  • Send the link to this campaign to any bloggers you may know.
  • If you have any religeous leanings you could even say a prayer for the success of the project.

This is a good and noble cause and you can become part of the team that reaches out and makes a difference in this world.

Please help in any way you can.

story:
Last 5 Days Special Offer - All High Level Perks 1/2 Price 

I've dropped the price on the Alice Pack, Ramngefinder, NVG and Satchel Charge perks by half.

Summary

Survivors & Bandits is a full length novel set in the world of DayZ. It’s a work of fiction that is a culmination of both my experiences and the experiences of people I’ve interviewed in DayZ. The first draft is currently at 95,000 words with the Act 1 sample provided coming in at 28,000 words – so it’s going to be big! I’ve been a writer for over seventeen years - writing novels, screenplays and television. This is my first Zombie fiction novel which my wife hopes will finally purge my constant discussions about the impending zombie apocalypse.

Cherno Journo is my DayZ ingame name and my pen name for this project. The Indiegogo sepcial edition pre-order version of Survivors & Bandits will be unique to this campaign only. It will have additional content, such as transcripts of in-game interviews and my own Survivor diaries extracts, which any future release will not contain.

The eBook version of Survivors & Bandits will be out before Christmas and will be a great gift for any DayZ fan. At this stage I can’t confirm a release date for the print versions as that will depend on contributor numbers and the printer’s deadlines. I know that if I wasn’t writing it I’d love it as a Christmas present so I’ll try my hardest to get all perks out for Christmas.

Samples

Downloadable samples of the first 120 pages for all major eBook readers can be found here. If your format isn't here then please let me know - I have tried to cover as many as possible.

If you are not sure about what format you need for your own device, consult Wikipedia to find it.

 

PDF (Almost all eReaders support PDF)

Kindle, Goole Play Books, (mobi reader format)

iBooks, Nook, Kobo (ePub Format)

Character Sheet (Spoiler Alert - This PDF has lots of spoilers from Act 1 and beyond)

 

Perks

$1 - Empty Tin Can

Although underrated in DayZ, the Empty Tin Can does allow you to distract Zeds.  Throw enough of them and you can kill one. This is the 'cool story bro' perk – if it took you three hours to read the sample that’s $0.33 per hour of entertainment. I’ll also send every Tin Can perk contributor a Cherno Journo DayZ wallpaper for their computer.

 

  $5 - Empty Whisky Bottle

I love how these can break a Survivor’s legs. The empty whisky bottle perk is the basic eBook, in the format of your choosing. You get the entire Survivors & Bandits novel to read while roaming the woods of Chernarus. The Cherno Journo DayZ Wallpaper is included.

$10 – Chemlight

You find them everywhere and they seem useless until you lose your NVGs at night. The Chemlight perk is an special edition copy of Survivors and Bandits plus the Cherno Journo DayZ wallpaper. eBooks will be available to choose from the same file types as those of the sample.  This special edition includes transcripts of interviews with other DayZ players, and excerpts from my own survivor diaries. Think World War Z but on a much smaller scale.

$15 – Can of Beans

Ahhhh the Can of Beans – where would DayZ be without it? This perk is the eBook plus. Your name (ingame or real - you choose) will be listed in the 'thanks' section of the eBook and you’ll get an additional customised PDF map of Chernarus so you can follow the path of the characters as they get off the coast and battle inland. The map will mark the locations of the prominent scenes and includes Elektro and Cherno detail insets.

$30 – Soda Can

Snap, hiss gulp… ahhhhh - thirst satisfied. The Soda Can perk is the paperback copy of Survivors & Bandits, shipped to your home. Shipping is included so I’m hoping I get more people from the US, Europe and Australia contributing and less people from the Galapagos Islands! You’ll also have a Cherno Journo DayZ wallpaper emailed to you.

 $40 – Canteen

Much better than the Soda Can as it can be refilled time and time again - just don’t do it at the pond near Stary! The Canteen perk comprises a paperback copy of the book along with a high quality A3 version of the Chernarus map, all shipping included. You’ll also have a Cherno Journo DayZ wallpaper emailed to you.

 $50 – Cooked Meat  

800 blood – need I say more? The Cooked Meat perk gets you a signed paperback copy of the book along with the high quality A3 version of the Chernarus map, shipping included. You’ll also have a Cherno Journo DayZ wallpaper emailed to you.

 $75 – Morphine Auto Injector

Legs broken in the middle of the forest? Bet you wished you’d stopped at the hospital for one of these babies! The Morphine Auto Injector perk is the hardcover copy of Survivors & Bandits along with the high quality A3 version of the Chernarus map, shipping included. You’ll also have a Cherno Journo DayZ wallpaper emailed to you.

  $100 – Blood Bag  

A definite lifesaver – so long as you can find someone who’s friendly to transfuse you. The Blood Bag perk nets you a signed hardcover copy of Survivors and Bandits along with the high quality A3 version of the Chernarus map, shipping included. You’ll also have a Cherno Journo DayZ wallpaper emailed to you.

 $250 – Alice Pack (Was $500)

Now you’re talking when you got one of these babies! The Alice Pack gives you the chance to name a minor character in Survivors and Bandits. I’ll work with you on their name, their background and other details, depending on the character. See the Characters sheet for more details about which characters are still available. This is a first buy, first choice perk and I’ll update the Characters sheet once a character is confirmed as taken. You can leave a note about which character you want in the comments box but until you receive confirmation from me, that request is not guaranteed. You’ll also get a signed and dedicated hardcover copy of Survivors & Bandits and a special one-off ebook version with a personalised dedication at the front.

$500 – Range Finder   (Was $1000)

Great for snipers and anyone who wants to really get into the PVP. The Range Finder perk gives you the chance to name one of the major characters in Survivors & Bandits. I’ll work with you on their name, their background and other details, depending on the character. See the Characters sheet for more details about which characters are still available. This is a first buy, first choice perk and I’ll update the Characters sheet once a character is confirmed as taken. You can leave a note about which character you want in the comments box but until you receive confirmation from me, that request is not guaranteed. You’ll also get two signed and dedicated hardcover copies of Survivors & Bandits and a special one-off eBook version with a personalised dedication at the front.

  $1500 – NVG (Was $3000)

You will become the leader of the Survivors (currently named Robert in the sample). We’ll work together over Skype to come up with his backstory, his history and you’ll be able to name and describe him. I know he doesn’t do much in the first Act but trust me, he comes good in the second and third Acts. This perk also comes with a specialised hardcopy version of Survivors and Bandits, of which only 5 will be made. You’ll also get a personalised eBook version and special 'thanks' in all printed and eBook versions along with the high quality A3 version of the Chernarus map and the Cherno Journo wallpaper.   

   $1500 - Satchel Charge (Was $3000)

Flap me - the Satchel Charge can cause some destruction – just like Shutov does in Survivors & Bandits! The Satchel Charge perk gives you an opportunity to become the Bandits' leader, currently named Shutov. We’ll work together over Skype to come up with his backstory, his history and you’ll be able to name and describe him. This perk also comes with a specialised hardcopy version of Survivors & Bandits, of which only 5 will be made. You’ll also get a personalised eBook version and special 'thanks' in all printed and eBook versions along with the high quality A3 version of the Chernarus map and the Cherno Journo wallpaper.   

 

So hurry up and take my money

Woah, not so fast! I want to give you something for free first. I’ve worked with my editor of over ten years on the first Act of the novel. This sample I’m giving you for free - so read it and then decide if you like the project enough to pre-order. The links are at the top and in the next section and I’ve covered off all the major eBook formats. If there’s a different format you’d like then let me know and I’ll see if I can create it for you.

There are just three things to remember with the free sample;

- It’s only a draft so anything could change - although I do doubt it as the whole first draft novel is done, but the thing about DayZ is that it’s brutal. I might need to kill off existing characters and introduce some new characters.

 - It’s the first Act. There is a lot of getting to know the characters. If you don’t know them then you can’t care about them, so I need to give you their backstory. Lots of the action, the vehicles and the really messed up stuff that DayZ is known for occurs in the second and third Acts.

 - It’s only the first 120 pages and full of spoilers. Act 1 ends on a small climax but the story is far from resolved and many questions are left unanswered. I recommend you read as much as you need to make a decision and then stop - save the surprises for your final read of the whole novel. This is even more important for the Character sheet which is spoiler city. Don't read that unless you've read the entire 120 pages. If you don’t want to know who lives and who dies, who betrays who and and who assists who, then don’t look at that sheet. The sheet is there for the contributors who want higher level perks, to provide them with more information and knowledge about which characters are still available.

Samples

Sample of the first 120 pages can be found here.

PDF (Almost all eReaders support PDF)

Kindle, Goole Play Books, (mobi reader format)

iBooks, Nook, Kobo (ePub Format)

Character Sheet (Spoiler Alert - This PDF has lots of spoilers from Act 1 and beyond)

Love The Novel but Strapped for Cash - Then Let the World Know (not the cash part of course)

I hope you’ve enjoyed reading the sample as much as I’ve enjoyed writing it. If you do, then share the love! Let all your DayZ friends and fans of Zombie fiction know. Send the sample to anyone. It is copyrighted so you can’t take any part of it and reproduce it, but I give you my permission to share the whole file, unedited, with the world.

There's also all the usual social media channels. I’m on all of them, so we can tweet #DayZNovel @Cherno_Journo, you can 'Like me' or subscribe to my YouTube channel. I’d love to hear what you think.

Or find me ingame and let’s talk on 'direct'. Just remember I’m friendly, I’ve never killed a person as Cherno Journo even when I’ve been fired upon.

TL;DR  Awesome DayZ Novel. Read the Sample and judge for yourself.

We’ll work together over Skype to come up with his backstory, his history and you’ll be able to name and describe him. I know he doesn’t do much in the first Act but trust me, he comes good in the second and third Acts. This perk also comes with a specialised hardcopy version of Survivors and Bandits, of which only 5 will be made. You’ll also get a personalised eBook version and special 'thanks' in all printed and eBook versions along with the high quality A3 version of the Chernarus map and the Cherno Journo wallpaper.   
   $1500 - Satchel Charge (Was $3000)
Flap me - the Satchel Charge can cause some destruction – just like Shutov does in Survivors & Bandits! The Satchel Charge perk gives you an opportunity to become the Bandits' leader, currently named Shutov. We’ll work together over Skype to come up with his backstory, his history and you’ll be able to name and describe him. This perk also comes with a specialised hardcopy version of Survivors & Bandits, of which only 5 will be made. You’ll also get a personalised eBook version and special 'thanks' in all printed and eBook versions along with the high quality A3 version of the Chernarus map and the Cherno Journo wallpaper.   
 
So hurry up and take my money
Woah, not so fast! I want to give you something for free first. I’ve worked with my editor of over ten years on the first Act of the novel. This sample I’m giving you for free - so read it and then decide if you like the project enough to pre-order. The links are at the top and in the next section and I’ve covered off all the major eBook formats. If there’s a different format you’d like then let me know and I’ll see if I can create it for you.
There are just three things to remember with the free sample;
- It’s only a draft so anything could change - although I do doubt it as the whole first draft novel is done, but the thing about DayZ is that it’s brutal. I might need to kill off existing characters and introduce some new characters.
 - It’s the first Act. There is a lot of getting to know the characters. If you don’t know them then you can’t care about them, so I need to give you their backstory. Lots of the action, the vehicles and the really messed up stuff that DayZ is known for occurs in the second and third Acts.
 - It’s only the first 120 pages and full of spoilers. Act 1 ends on a small climax but the story is far from resolved and many questions are left unanswered. I recommend you read as much as you need to make a decision and then stop - save the surprises for your final read of the whole novel. This is even more important for the Character sheet which is spoiler city. Don't read that unless you've read the entire 120 pages. If you don’t want to know who lives and who dies, who betrays who and and who assists who, then don’t look at that sheet. The sheet is there for the contributors who want higher level perks, to provide them with more information and knowledge about which characters are still available.
Samples
Sample of the first 120 pages can be found here.
PDF (Almost all eReaders support PDF)
Kindle, Goole Play Books, (mobi reader format)
iBooks, Nook, Kobo (ePub Format)
Character Sheet (Spoiler Alert - This PDF has lots of spoilers from Act 1 and beyond)
Love The Novel but Strapped for Cash - Then Let the World Know (not the cash part of course)
I hope you’ve enjoyed reading the sample as much as I’ve enjoyed writing it. If you do, then share the love! Let all your DayZ friends and fans of Zombie fiction know. Send the sample to anyone. It is copyrighted so you can’t take any part of it and reproduce it, but I give you my permission to share the whole file, unedited, with the world.
There's also all the usual social media channels. I’m on all of them, so we can tweet #DayZNovel @Cherno_Journo, you can 'Like me' or subscribe to my YouTube channel. I’d love to hear what you think.
Or find me ingame and let’s talk on 'direct'. Just remember I’m friendly, I’ve never killed a person as Cherno Journo even when I’ve been fired upon.
TL;DR  Awesome DayZ Novel. Read the Sample and judge for yourself.

story:
Unleash the Hounds and Support The Wild Hunt and Independent Pagan Journalism During Our Fall Funding Drive!

“The Wild Hunt blog is a must-read for those interested in news and events dealing with the modern Pagan and Heathen communities – and religion coverage in general.” – M.Z. Hemingway, Get Religion

“…a source for smart commentary on a broad range of news, media, and ideas from a pagan perspective.” – Jeff Sharlet, author of “The Family: The Secret Fundamentalism at the Heart of American Power”.

The Wild Hunt is primary destination for those interested in following news relating and of interest to modern Pagan religions and other minority faiths. Founded by Jason Pitzl-Waters in 2004, The Wild Hunt has grown to become one of the most-visited and popular destinations exploring these topics. Recruited to Patheos.com in the Summer of 2011, The Wild Hunt decided to exist as an independent journalitic entity once more in the Summer of 2012. In addition, The Wild Hunt is now expanding into a media outlet with paid contributors and two paid staff members. 

To make the dream of an independent Wild Hunt a reality, I need your help! 

A New Vision For Pagan Media

While our interconnected community has proliferated with amazing media sources of all kinds, The Wild Hunt still inhabits a unique role and purpose: a mix of original reporting, insightful analysis, and a daily commitment to keeping you informed. Now, we would like do more, and do it in a way that honors the commitment of our community's writers and reporters. 

In addition to the reporting of Wild Hunt founder Jason Pitzl-Waters, we will be using the funds raised here to pay two ongoing staff members, and pay for all future guest reporting and editorials, including reports from the Pagan Newswire Collective. 

Here's how we'll spend that $6000 dollars:

$1000: Yearly Hosting Fee

$1200: $100 per month for reporter Rynn Fox

$1200: $100 per month for reporter/columnist Heather Greene

$1200: $100 per month to run stories from the Pagan Newswire Collective

$1200: Yearly budget for guest posts from other writers.

$200: Fees and other expenses.

This will, I believe, provide incentive to build better Pagan journalism, help train writers and reporters interested in emulating The Wild Hunt, and allow me (Jason) the time to write more in-depth journalism for our community. 

But Jason, why aren't you being paid in this budget? Good question! If we happen to surpass our goal, I will budget a salary for myself, but I'm more concerned with buidling a new model for Pagan media and I'm willing to put my time, energy, and money, where my mouth is. If we succeed here, maybe we can do more, build more, expect more, from our Pagan media outlets. 

Why Should I Support The Wild Hunt? 

The Wild Hunt has a proven track record stretching over 8 years, and over those years we've become an essential news source and inspired many to create their own media. We've interviewed big-name Pagans like Margot Adler and Starhawk, reported on controversies and inspirational moments that have affected our community deeply, and acted as a watchdog when the mainstream media reports on modern Pagans and other minority faith traditions. However, the commitment, time, and energy needed to make this sustainable can only happen if you are willng to step forward and help us fund it. 

Over the years many have said our community has a hard time supporting institutions and services that benefit them. I don't believe that. I think we can come together if something is worthwhile, and goes to the trouble to ask. I believe The Wild Hunt is giving something unique to our community, and I am asking you, please help us make this step into a new reality. Our success won't just be for us, it will be for you, and for those who follow us. 

I Don't Have Much Money How Can I Help?

Even if you're flat broke, you can do so much for us! 

Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, and anywhere else Pagans congregate. Explain to them why The Wild Hunt is important to you, and help spread the word! This only works if everyone pulls together and helps us UNLEASH THE HOUNDS!

story:
A new horror anthology from High Dive Publishing!!

High Dive Publishing has wrangled 13 writers to create an incredible horror anthology. This Indiegogo campaign will serve as a pre-order to get YOUR copy of this hair-raising book, along with many other fun and frightening perks. Check out the perks, there are items and services for any budget.

But first, here’s the pitch for the book:
A zombie outbreak at a community pool…
A terrible secret at a school for children who can’t sleep…
An actress who will do anything for fame…
And more!

High Dive Publishing presents 12 spine tingling stories and 1 spooky poem to make you shiver in your board shorts. These tales are scary enough to frighten you in broad daylight while you watch the surf from your beach chair, or late at night when you’re nursing that sunburn. 13 writers have come together to create an anthology scarier than climbing the ladder to dive off the high diving board.
Welcome to Horror From The High Dive!

Why a horror anthology?

Hey, Pete here!

I'm the fella behind High Dive Publishing. When I created High Dive I began brainstorming about the projects that I would like to do and the FIRST thing that jumped into my mind was a collection of scary stories.

I love things that are...

I was raised on Scary Stories To Tell In The Dark and Goosebumps and Fear Street. I borrowed tattered copies of Stephen King collections from the New Carrolton Library. I sought out spookies of all sorts. Once I got it into my mind to do a horror anthology the idea beat at my brain's cellar door like a tell-tale heart.

So I set out to find 12 other writers to send me their scariest stuff. I wrote a story, collected 11 more stories, and got a wonderful introductory poem from another talented wordsmith. It took me literally a year, from October 2019 until now, to get the book just right and I can honestly say that this is an incredible selection of written works and I'm so excited for it to be out there!

Who are the authors?

K.C. Dunford lives in Pueblo, Colorado and is a wife and mother of two. She is the author of Lost Illumination, a young adult fantasy novel. Her writing has also appeared in The Remington Review and was selected in the Words and Brushes worldwide writing competition. Find her on Facebook and Instagram @KCDunfordBooks.

Peter L. Harmon created High Dive Publishing to help authors take the leap into the daunting waters of publishing. He has always loved spooky stories. He is the author of The Happenstances… young adult book series. He lives in the Los Angeles area with his wife, two kids, and their pug, Summer. Find him on Twitter and Instagram @PeterLHarmon. 

Andrew Adams is a writer, adventurer, and filmmaker who has produced videos in over thirty countries and six continents. He has climbed mountains and hiked glaciers and kayaked through caves and bungee jumped out of gondolas while shooting, directing, and producing travel content for National Geographic Adventures, Tastemade Travel, and DreamWorksTV. He lives in Los Angeles. He has written and directed narrative film work for Disney XD (The Fixits) and CryptTV. He is the creator of two independent comic book series (Schismatic and Revisionaries).

Beck Medina is a young adult author, podcast host, and mindset coach residing in California. She has been publishing under 1537 Press, her independent publishing company, since 2016 and has written two novels, including A Fantastic Mess of Everything and All the Stars on Fire. Aside from writing, Beck is also a full-time cat mom and pop music lover. Find her on Twitter and Instagram @BeckMedina.

Originally from Seattle, Malcolm Badewitz now writes from his kitchen table in Los Angeles. He studied psychology at the University of Washington, where he learned he's a terrible researcher. Now he's writing scripts, most of which deal with horror in one way or another. Pray for him. 

Daniel Lee is the author of the novel After Death, which won First Place in the Nerdist Sci-Fi Contest and is forthcoming from Inkshares, and his short story "The Grave Ordeal of Jawbone John South" can be found in Writing Bloc's ESCAPE! An Anthology. He lives in Los Angeles, where he makes his living as an editor. See more of his work at Dan-Lee.net.

Sean Cameron is from Rochester, England and currently lives in Los Angeles, California. When not laughing at the British weather report, he finds time to write the comedy book series REX & EDDIE MYSTERIES. He likes carrot cake, dinosaurs, and hiking; although not much hiking happens as he fears being eaten by a mountain lion. He dislikes the news, squash soup, and mountain lions. Find him on Twitter @SeanCameronUK or Facebook SeanCameronAuthor. 

Ben Greene is a writer and actor living in Los Angeles. Most recently, Ben was a writer for the Emmy-nominated animated series, "Hilda" (Netflix), writing multiple episodes for an upcoming season. Ben has previously worked as a staff writer on the DreamWorks animated series "Harvey Girls Forever!" (Netflix) and as a freelance writer on shows like "Talking Tom and Friends " (Netflix) and "The UCB Show" (Starz On-Demand). Find him on Twitter @BenjaminGreene and Instagram @BenGreene6. 

Joe Cabello is a California-native who has written several Star Wars parody books as well as the anime-inspired comic book, Robot. Black Belt. Champion. He has worked in TV, film, and games, and aside from writing, he also has worked with Pre-K to 3rd-grade students for the last decade taking them on ninja adventures for the company Young Ninjas USA. See more of his work at JoeCabello.com. 

Matthew Hartwell is a TV and feature writer who lives in Los Angeles, California. There used to be a pond in his backyard, but he drained it as a precaution. Find him on Twitter @Hartwellish. 

Around watching the world burn and his rather vanilla day job, Graham Stone Johnson is a writer. If it creeps, slithers, manifests, hails from the future, or comes indifferent from light-years away, he’s down to tell its story. He shares a small apartment in Los Angeles with his wife, Bethany, who is also a writer, and their 65 lb. lapdog, Penny, who does nothing of import. Find him on Twitter @Grahamification. 

Christopher Malone is a Maryland-native who enjoys writing and playing music when he isn't hanging out with his wife and kid. His story "The Picture" was originally published in The Dark City Crime and Mystery Magazine.

Katherine Forrister is an author of speculative fiction with a love of fantasy, history, science, and romance. Prior to her writing career, she attended Georgia State University, Kennesaw State University, and Gwinnett Technical College, focusing on the subjects of theater and performance studies and veterinary technology. She now lives near Kansas City with her family, where she enjoys local festivals and conventions, hiking, playing open-world video games, and curling up on the sofa to read on cold winter nights. Find her on Twitter @KatForrister and Instagram @KatherineForrister or on her website KatherineForrister.com.

Other Ways You Can Help 

Even if you can't support this campaign financially you can still help us out:

  • Please share this campaign on your social media accounts or better yet, in real life! Nothing helps sell books like word of mouth from someone you trust.
  • Follow @HighDivePublishing on Instagram and @HighDivePublish on Twitter for future projects.
  • Buy a High Dive Publishing T-Shirt here: https://www.teepublic.com/user/highdive/t-shirts
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!!

Thank you!!!

- Pete and High Dive Publishing

story:
SUMMARY

Yasmine Watson's slogan is "From Foster Care 2 Foster Mom". Yasmine is a former foster child who is now a foster mom of four beautiful little girls, and the mother to many other children in here life. She is a small business owner that specializes in all natural skin care products. Yasmine's passion is working with youth and young adults in and out of foster care. After working as a teachers assistant at a private elementary school, she saw a void that she knew needed to be filled! That being teachings of African American Inventions. She also vowed to be the change she wanted to see in all areas of her life, and definitely when it came to having a wider diversity of African American Women Children's Books authors; as well as books that focused on African American characters. Her goal is to not only teach the youth about their history but to also build the confidence inside each and every one of them. 

Yasmine was always eager to tap into the history that we unfortunately are not taught in school. If you were to ask 10 people, who invented the Kitchen Table, 8 out of 10 wouldn't know the answer, yet we eat at the kitchen table everyday. An African American man by the name of Henry Jackson invented the Kitchen Table. Yasmine wants to bring some excitement into the lives of children across the world. What's amazing about this book "Well Now You Know" is that it's not only educational for children, but also for adults as well.   

What We Need & What You Get

This $15k will help with the production of the books and different items that will be sent out with each copy. We will be surprising 200 youth in foster care with their very own copy of the book for Christmas. Not only that, we will be taking it a step further by adding a gift box filled with things that most youth in foster care need. 

  • Socks
  • Under Clothes
  • Pajamas 
  • Blankets 

& Christmas would not be a success if they didn't have a toy to top it off!!! What is so amazing about this is that it will not only come as a surprise for the children, but also as a surprise for the foster agencies Yasmine will be donating to! 

All money raised will be used as follows:

  • 65% - Developing & printing of Well Now You Know
  • 25% -  Items needed box gift boxes
  • 10% -  Packaging of each gift to be donated 
  • You will also be able to write a personal note to a child you will be sponsoring, that will be added in each box donated.

The Impact

 STATISTICS: As of Oct 1st, 2020, the State of Georgia has approximately 11,581 children in foster care. Many of these children do not receive gifts for the holidays. The sad part is, some have never even experienced what Christmas is like. Help us change that this Christmas! Know that you will be making a difference in a child's life. According to Kids & Family Reading Report: Families expect more from children's book. Diversity in children's books is highly inclusive. Many children and parents want more diversity in books.  CHARACTERS BUILD CHARACTER.

 

Risks & Challenges

Distribution: Our goal is to be in every household and every bookstore you can possibly think of. We want to have a presence in local books stores right in your back yard. We also would like to be in every elementary school that you can think of. We hope to partner with a book distributor that will help us reach our goal. We know that our goal of donating to 200 kids is kind of a stretch for a 45 day goal, but we know with the help of so many people like you reading this, that this is POSSIBLE and it will happen. 

WORD OF MOUTH: We know the impact that word of mouth can bring. In order for this dream of Yasmine's to be a success, we are asking that you tell a friend, to tell a friend, to tell a friend!!! We plan to also do local pop up shops with local businesses in the Atlanta, Ga, and surrounding areas. Although Covid-19 has stopped local schools from opening, we plan to do virtual readings and also fun challenges surrounding "Well Now You Know"

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with EVERYONE you know. Social media is taking over, so if you have a Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter account, pl ease share our campaign.
